loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, the mother of four children and has for the last five years earned a living by running a shop where she sells snacks, breads and biscuits. She is applying for a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more items to sell to her customers. She is a new member of HSPFI, but is committed to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy snacks, beverages and detergents.

loans.name: Sanabar's Group

texts.en:
Sanabar is the treasurer of this group.  She is 55 and married to a farmer. Together with her husband she raising two sons.  The first son went to work in Russia and the second son is in school.  In order to earn money to meet the daily needs the family, she cultivates agricultural products and breeds livestock. 

Five years ago, Sanabar, with an initial investment of 4,000 soms purchased four goats and then she resold them at a higher price after fattening them. In this way she earns an additional 2,300 soms per month.  Sanabar needs additional money to start repairing the house and for this purpose she applied for the loan.  She hopes that the loan will help her to realize the plans. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to repair the house

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria tiene 25 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive en casa familiar, en una comunidad pequeña en vías de desarrollo, ubicada a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Lambayeque.

Victoria se dedica a la venta de abarrotes (arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite, etc.) en una bodega ubicada en el interior de su domicilio. Ella cuenta con una de las bodegas más surtidas de su comunidad y realiza ventas al contado y al crédito.

Victoria tiene clientela establecida y este negocio le ha traído grandes satisfacciones por lo que desea seguir invirtiendo en él. Es por ello que solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad de los productos que tienen gran demanda en su bodega.

Victoria ya ha trabajado con nuestra entidad y ha cancelado puntual y responsablemente sus cuotas. Este préstamo le permitirá seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Victoria is 25 years old, a single mother and lives in her family home in a small developing community 20 minutes from the city of Lambayeque.

Victoria sells groceries (rice, sugar, milk, oil, etc.) from a shop in her home. She has one of the best-stocked shops in the community and sells for cash or on credit.

Victoria has an established clientele, and this business has brought her great satisfaction, so she wants to continue investing in it. This is why she is requesting a loan of 1000 new Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy a greater quantity of the products in her shop for which there is high-demand.

Victoria has already worked with our institution and has punctually and responsibly made her payments. This loan will allow her to continue growing her business.

loans.use: To buy groceries to stock her business.

loans.name: Edeliza

texts.en:
This is Edeliza, 48, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Eduardo, a driver, and mother of four children. Together with her husband, she manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Edeliza operates a rug-making business. She mainly offers rugs, from round palm-sized ones to the much larger doormats, braided quilts and bed sheets, and other crafts that most rug-makers offer every day. As rugs are a major part of Filipino housekeeping and cleaning, rugs are one of the most common products that can be bought, sometimes even from a peddler while you are riding in a speeding "jeepney" (minibus) down the highway. She also earns additional income from their "tricycle" which her husband drives regularly. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 750 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 22,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Edeliza dreams of being able to give her all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials she uses in her business.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is 48 years old and is married to Kimai. For the past 11 years, she has been a farmer in Emali town. Magdalena was introduced to KADET by a friend who is also a client. 

Magdalena is requesting a 40,000 KES loan through KADET to purchase seedlings and till her land. In the future, she hopes to begin dairy farming to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy seedlings to plant

loans.name: Gloria Matilde

texts.es:
Gloria es una mujer emprendedora que ha luchado por salir adelante, comenzó su negocio con muchas dificultades debido a los pocos recursos que tenia para la adecuación de los equipos, en su negocio gloria presta el servicio de Internet y sala de computo, pero afirma que es complicado ya que el mantenimiento es costoso, por lo cual necesita una buena inversión que le ayude a alcanzar un equilibrio económico.

Sueña con llegar a comprar una casa en Medellín, municipio del departamento de Antioquia, pues es conciente que allí su hijo tendrá mas posibilidades de progresar y como madre soltera ese ha sido su mayor anhelo durante estos 24 años, sin embargo es conciente que actualmente no tiene el capital necesario para comprar 2 equipos de cómputo con lo cual sus ingresos se incrementarán notablemente, es por este motivo que hoy Gloria solicita un crédito que le permita mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gloria is an entrepreneurial woman who has worked hard to get ahead in life.  She had a really difficult time starting her business owing to the limited resources she had available to set up her equipment.  Gloria provides an Internet service and IT room but she says that it is difficult because the maintenance costs are high.  For this reason, she needs to make a good investment which will help her achieve financial stability.

Gloria dreams of buying a house in Medellín, in Antioquia department, as she is aware that her son would have more opportunities to make progress there.  As a single mother, that has been her main desire over the past 24 years.  Gloria currently doesn't have the money she needs to buy two computers which would help her increase her income significantly.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan which will allow her to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy two computers

loans.name: Andon

texts.en:
Andon spent most of his adolescence moving to and from different countries, including Chile, Mexico, India, and multiple states in the US. He says that along the way his family was a part of every socioeconomic class, from “third world rich” to “first world poor”. His father built oyster and shrimp hatcheries all over and taught Andon about the customs of Latin America. In 2008, Andon took a journey from Appalachia to Yucatan to learn about how he can contribute to forest restoration- this is how Andon’s non-profit, New Forest Earth, came to be.

New Forest Earth works with community cooperatives in Mexico and Ecuador to bring handcrafted, sustainable goods to customers in the United States. These goods vary from recycled paper journals, jewelry made from plants in the Amazon rainforest, and USDA organic, Rainforest Alliance certified chocolate. The goal of the business is to fund reforestation and indigenous cultural development projects. The organization has a large support group, including interns from universities and even children as young as 12, all trying to raise awareness amongst their peers.

Andon hopes to expand his business across the United States, and with this loan from Accion USA, he will purchase inventory from co-ops, which will allow him to sell more products and in turn contribute to the mission of reforestation. 

Help New Forest Earth raise awareness by visiting the website here: 
http://www.newforestearth.org/

loans.use: To purchase inventory from community cooperatives to sell.

loans.name: Sabria

texts.en:
Sabria is a 56-year-old woman. She is married and has four sons and two daughters; one of her sons is employed with a decent salary. 

Sabria has a beauty salon and wants to purchase a new beauty salon kit such as hair products, creams, chairs, mirrors, etc., in order to improve her work. The amount of money Sabria has isn't enough to pay for it, so she needs to take a loan of $1,000 from FATEN. When Sabria gets the loan, which will be repaid on a monthly basis, she will purchase a new beauty salon kit and improve her work positively; in this way, she will increase her income and live in better life conditions with the family. Sabria is photographed in her salon.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing a new beauty salon kit to improve her work.

loans.name: Munhgerel

texts.en: Munhgerel is 36-years-old and lives with her parents in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Suhbaatar Province of Mongolia. Her daughter is in kindergarten. She started her business in 2004 by renting a counter in a local market to sell clothes. She is very well experienced in her business and her current assets are 2,000,000 MNT. She has many regular customers. She is a hardworking and diligent woman who says,"I want to expand my business and one day I will open my own store." She is requesting 800,000 MNT to buy more clothes from Erlian.

loans.use: to buy more clothes from Erlian.

loans.name: Hajidmaa

texts.en: Hajidmaa is 51 years old and lives with her son in an apartment in the Arhangai province of Mongolia. Her eldest daughter is a clerk in her retail business and her younger one goes to college. Hajidmaa started her business in 2000 by renting a space to run a barber shop. Also, she runs a garment retail trading business. Over the years she has acquired many regular customers. Now that winter is approaching, she needs to buy winter garments and some new equipment for her barber shop from China. She is a hardworking and diligent woman who says, "I will do everything I can for my daughter to get educated." She is requesting 2,500,000 MNT to buy equipment for her barber shop.

loans.use: To buy equipment.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is a divorced woman with four children.  Two are enrolled in school.  She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Julia has operated a vegetable stall for the past 3 years; her clients are local residents.  She faces a major challenge of seasonality.  Julia dreams of expanding his business.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan she wants to purchase vegetables for his business.  Julia decided to join Yehu Microfinance to access loans.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables for his business.

loans.name: Awad

texts.en:
Awad is a 45-year-old married man and father of five children. Awad is a hard worker; he built a small cottage years ago to provide his family with their daily food for their living. Awad makes and sells specially made noodles, lupines, and corn. This kind of food is highly attractive to children in his region, especially during the evening and while celebrating holy occasions.

Awad has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to increase his food business by buying a large quantity of noodles at a discount. Awad also works in construction, specializing in cement work. Since this business is not going well, Awad is hoping to improve it also by buying new construction tools.

His food business is his main source of income. Through its income he covers his family's necessities. He hopes to provide his family with the best education and living, and hopes to improve his both of businesses as much as he can.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of noodles for his food selling business.

loans.name: Esha

texts.en: Esha is taking another Kiva loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to boost her motorcycle business. With the loan, she wants to purchase spare parts to repair her motorcycle. She also operates a fruit juice making business which she earns her other source of income. She dreams of expanding her business and hiring more employees in the future.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts to repair her motorcycle.

loans.name: Gf Mawoudekon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GF MAWOUDEKON est composé de cinq personnes qui sont des amies et vivent dans le même village. C'est la cinquième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante  du groupe, du nom de Henriette est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Henriette est âgée de 33 ans et vit au Bénin. Henriette n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Henriette est une veuve et mère de deux enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à sa charge. Henriette vit seule avec ses enfants et assure seule les diverses charges de la famille. Afin de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Henriette mène comme activité depuis dix huit ans, la culture du piment dans sa région. De façon secondaire, Henriette vend de la farine de manioc dans une ville du Bénin. Henriette s’approvisionne dans sa région. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Henriette sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GF MAWOUDEKON, un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les quatre premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
GF MAWOUDEKON Group is made up of five women who are friends and live in the same village. This is the fifth time that the members of the group are seeking financial support from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, in order to bolster their businesses.

The group's representative, named Henriette, is the one raising her hand in the photograph. She's 33 years old and lives in Benin. She never attended school. She's a widow, and the mother of two children she has to support. Some children attend school.

Henriette lives alone with her children, and supports her family on her own. In order to provide for herself and her children, she's been growing chili pepper for eighteen years in her region. As a second business, Henriette sells manioc flour in a city in Benin. She buys the flour in her region.

Eager to meet customer demand, and in order to increase her revenue and income, Henriette, together with the other member of the group, is seeking her fifth loan from ALIDé. The previous four loans were repaid without problems.

loans.use: To buy peppers to grow and also manioc flour

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a 56-year-old businessman and he is married to Pauline.  The couple is blessed with six children. 

Julius has been operating a bicycle transportation business as his primary business and a retail shop as a secondary business for the past seven years, earning a monthly income of KES 10,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan term with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Julius will use the loan to service his bike and to buy more stock of sugar and rice for his retail shop. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. 

He hopes to buy commercial land in the near future.

loans.use: To service his bike and buy more sugar and rice for his shop

loans.name: Banan

texts.en:
Banan is a 48-year-old woman who is married with three sons. Her husband has a low pension salary that is not enough to cover his family's needs.

Banan has had a cosmetics store for two years, and it is the only source of income for the family. She wants to purchase necessary accessories that are missing from her store and for which she has a good demand from the customers, such as perfumes, creams for different uses, makeup, etc.

Because her store is new, and the income she has is low and isn't enough to pay for all of this purchase, she needs to take a loan from FATEN in the amount of $3,000. When Banan gets the loan, she will be able to purchase a collection of accessories to resell that will enable her to compete with other stores well and increase her sales, and so increase her income to create better living conditions for her family. 

Banan is a conservative woman, so her son is photographed in the store instead.

loans.use: To purchase a collection of accessories for her store.

loans.name: Ndiague's Group

texts.fr:
Inauguré depuis le 13 décembre 2008, ce groupe évolue grâce à l'élan de solidarité des membres qui font comme activité principale le petit commerce.
Ndiague, debout à droite de la Photo et levant la main est âgée de 62 ans. Elle est veuve et mère de 09 enfants dont 06 filles. Elle fait comme activité principale le petit commerce. Elle vend des légumes et du poisson au marché qui se trouve dans sa localité. Elle développe cette activité depuis fort longtemps et a une très bonne expérience dans ce domaine. Elle fait comme activité parallèle l'élevage de poussins. Elle va acheter pour 66 000 F de poissons et de légumes. Avec le reste, elle va acheter 40 Kg de (niébé) haricot local à 300 F / kg, 200 Kg de mil à 300 F / Kg. Elle va aussi acheter des poussins pour un montant de 50 000 f et 12 000 F seront consacrés aux vaccins et à l'entretien.
Les bénéfices vont servir à améliorer son quotidien (nourriture) et à renforcer son épargne.
texts.en:
This group was created on 13 December 2008, and has been driven by the commitment to solidarity shown by its members, who mainly work in small-scale retail.

Ndiague, who is pictured standing to the right with her hand raised, is 62 years of age. She is a widow and has nine children, six of whom are girls. Her main business is small-scale retail, and she sells vegetables and fish in the market in her town. She has been working in this business for a long time now, and has a lot of experience in this field. In addition, she also works rearing chickens.

Ndiague will use 66,000 francs of her loan to buy fish and vegetables. With the rest, she plans to buy 40 kilos of ‘niébé’ (a local bean) at 300 francs per kilo, as well as 200 kilos of millet at 300 francs per kilo. She also plans to buy chicks for 50,000 francs, as well as spending 12,000 francs on vaccinations and expenses for looking after her chicks.

Ndiague will use the profits she makes to improve her daily life (food), as well as to increase her savings.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and fish

loans.name: Alodo Abi Group

texts.fr: ALODO ABI est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la quatrième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Lucienne (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 55 ans. Lucienne n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Lucienne est mariée à un pêcheur du nom de Yonlonfoun. Le couple a huit enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Lucienne et son mari. Pour cette raison, Lucienne des crevettes fumées depuis quarante ans, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Lucienne  s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Lucienne sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe ALODO ABI, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des crevettes.

loans.name: Fana Market Group

texts.en:
Adama is a member of Fana Market (see group picture - Adama is in the middle of the picture). She is a widow with five children, one of whom is a student. The rest are presently working in different institutions.

Eleven years ago, Adama established her rice, salt, pepper, fish, etc. business to support herself and her child in school. She pays school fees, buys learning material, and provides food from the profit she gets from the business. She sells 6 days per week from 9am to 6pm.

Adama plans to use the loan to buy additional bags of rice, pepper, fish, salt, etc. for resale. She will use the proceeds from the business to open a savings account, which will be used to pay her child's school fees.

Adama and her group members need a loan, totaling 5,000,000 SLL, of which Adama would be entitled to 1,000,000 SLL.

Adama plans to buy a motor bike for commercial purposes, to build a house, and to live a happy life.

Adama and the rest of the group members thank you for your support.

loans.use: to buy additional bags of rice, pepper, fish, salt, etc.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es: Cristina es una mujer viuda de 64 años que vive en la localidad rural de Puquina, que está ubicada en Moquegua. Ella trabaja como obrera agrícola y también se dedica a la agricultura y a la cría de ganado vacuno orgánico, poniendo siempre mucha atención en el cuidado y en la alimentación que les brinda, que está constituida por la alfalfa orgánica que cultiva. Solicita el micro crédito para poder comprar dos vacas orgánicas, espera que su leche sea vendida a un mejor precio al ser orgánica. En el futuro espera poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y seguir contando con buena salud, razón por la cual apuesta por lo orgánico.

loans.use: Para comprar dos vacas orgánicas para vender la leche que producen y así aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida

loans.name: Raila's Group

texts.en:
The lady standing to the right hand side in the photograph in a yellow saree is Raila.She is a resident of a small village of Koraput district,Odisha,India. Raila is a married lady having two daughters and a toddler son.Raila's husband is a farmer by profession. Raila helps her husband in the field in order to supplement her family's income and provide her children a better standard of comfortable living.She is engaged in cultivating of green leafy vegetables in her small piece of land and sells those produce in the market after harvesting it.

Raila along with her group member is requesting for a loan amount of 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum. She will use her portion of loan amount to purchase high yielding variety of vegetable seeds,organic manures and fertilizers for higher productivity with quality produce.

Raila is eagerly awaiting for your kind help and generous support.

loans.use: to purchase high yielding variety of vegetable seeds,organic manures and fertilizers

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Madam Veronica D. is an inhabitant of Effiakuma (1st Bus Stop). She deals in general provisions and food items. She has lots of customers and a high demand for her goods. She however, needs capital to stock up more items. She has no source of finance and is therefore seeking a loan of $700.00 from Kiva. She is a very hardworking woman and looking forward to receiving a positive response.

loans.use: re-stocking capital

loans.name: Pauline Zi

texts.en:
Pauline is a mother of seven children. The mysterious death of her daughter and sister coupled with the fact that her husband lost his job at an early age and she has had to struggle alone to educate their children and to pay for medication has been strength and source of motivation. She is a seven-time borrower. With her six previous loans she succeeded in provided her community with firewood, pork, manure and fresh raw food stuff. Her good business gained her the name “Mami Firewood” in her community.

Given a loan of $1200, she plans to buy table birds to rear and sell at Christmas, fortify her existing pig-fence, give her son small capital and buy seeds for cultivation. She is optimistic and plans to pay her loan with income from sales of firewood, manure and vegetables.

She plans to pay loan in 18 months. The first installment repayment shall be on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of loan.

loans.use: Selling firewood and sundries

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.en:
María del Socorro is a hard-working married mother of four children of 14, 16, 18 and 21 years of age. Her husband is a bricklayer. Facing the need to increase their income to improve their quality of life, María decided to start her own business in the sales of cosmetics after testing the good quality of these products. It has been 3 years since she started and fortunately her number of clients has increased.

At this time, María asks for a $275 dollar loan which she will use in the purchase of merchandise to offer a larger variety of products to her clients and meet their demands. She promises to return this amount in 4 to 8 months. You can help María and her family. They sincerely thank you for your support.

Translated from Spanish to English by Patricia Yáñez, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria del Socorro es una mujer muy trabajadora, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos de 14, 16, 18 y 21 años de edad. Su esposo es albañil y ante la necesidad de obtener un ingreso extra que le permitiera mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y su familia, Maria decidió iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de cosméticos, después de comprobar la buena calidad de estos productos. Ya tiene tres años que empezó y afortunadamente se han incrementado sus clientes.

En estos momentos Maria solicita un préstamo de $ 275 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para poder ofrecer una mayor variedad a sus clientes y cubrir su demanda, ella promete devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 4 a 8 meses. Tú puedes ayudar a Maria y a su familia, ellos agradecen sinceramente tu apoyo.

loans.use:
Purchase of Merchandise
Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Sum

texts.en: Mrs. Sum S. is 54 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with her husband and their two children. She earns a living selling fruit, while her husband works as a security guard. The couple earns $6/day, but they are also helped by their two children that work as security guards just like their father. This loan will be used for Mrs. Sum S. to purchase more fruit so she can expand her business.

loans.use: Sum would like to purchase fruit to sell.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en: I am Khadija B.. I was born in Vehari. I am a widow and I buy and sell garments from my home, which helps provide for our family. I have four children; three boys and a daughter. My youngest son and daughter are still studying and my other two sons are in the livestock business. One of my sons wants to buy a goat or cow before Eid (religious festival). As prices of animals will escalate during Eid, he will make a good profit from it. He will pool in some savings with the loan to purchase the animal and requires a loan of $325 to support him in this venture.

loans.use: wants to purchase a cow

loans.name: Neylin

texts.es:
Neylin has her own business, located in the Ivan Montenegro market near the city of Managua. She has had this busness for eight years. Starting this business required great effort on her part, as she had to save up a lot of money.

Even when the area in which her business is located began to go through a difficult time, moreover, she was still able to build up her business bit by bit. In fact, by making many sacrifices, she was able to improve her location in order to better serve her customers.

CEPRODEL has been a helping hand for Neylin. With its support she has been able to expand her business and offer her goods to more people. Neylin has been working with CEPRODEL for two years and has a good credit rating.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

Neylin tiene su propio negocio ubicado en el Mercado Ivan Montenegro de la ciudad de Managua desde hace ocho años. Con mucho esfuerzo logro ahorrar C$20,000.00 cordobas para empezar con su negocio.

Cuando inicio el local donde se encuentra ubicada estaba en malas condiciones, sin embargo poco a poco y con mucho sacrificio ha logrado mejorar la estructura del local brindando asi mejor atencion a sus clientes.

CEPRODEL ha sido una mano amiga para Neylin, ya que gracias al apoyo que se le ha brindado ha logrado crecer, ofreciendo sus productos a mayoristas. Neylin lleva dos años trabajando con CEPRODEL y tiene un record de 9 creditos.

loans.use: Purchasing products and raw materials

loans.name: Vagif

texts.en: Vagif has been in this business for 7 years. He breeds sheep. This man is 55 years old,  married, and has 5 children. The S. family lives in the Salyan region in the Yenikand village. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy baling presses (for hay) that he needs to improve his sheep breeding.

loans.use: To buy baling presses

loans.name: Kasubi Iii B(I) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together  for ten months. Esther is 37 years old and married with five children. She sells hardware equipment. She wants to use the extra profits to increase her sales. Teopista has a charcoal selling busines. Sandra has a market stall for raw foods, while Sharifa sells used clothes.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more hardware.

loans.name: Luz Estela

texts.es:
Mrs. Luz Estela belongs to the communal bank “La Amistad 2”, which is located in the Jr. Libertad #820, district Calleria, in the Ucayali department. She is 56 years old, divorced, and has three older children. She invested the first loan of S/.300 that she received from Manuela Ramos in the purchase of second-hand goods. In her current business, she sells and repairs all sort of products. She wakes up very early to open up her business (she has numerous clients), and generally she does not close till 8 pm. With the new loan of S/. 1000 soles, which she will repay in 5 months, she will buy products such as radios, TVs, irons, rice cookers, etc. Luz Estela feels very good about working with Manuela Ramos because they help all women who want to get ahead establish their own business.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Luz Estela pertenece al Banco Comunal De La Amistad 2, ubicado en Jr. Libertad Nº 820, distrito de Callería, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 56 años, es madre de 3 hijos, todos mayores de edad y es separada. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 soles decide invertir en la compra y venta de artefactos de segunda . En la actualidad se dedica a la venta y reparación de todo tipo de artefactos. Se levanta muy temprano para abrir su negocio, ya que goza de mucha clientela, y generalmente se queda hasta las 8 de la noche. Con el préstamo de S/ 1,000 soles, el cual pagará en 5 meses, invertirá en la compra de artefactos, como radios, televisores, planchas, ollas arroceras, etc. Luz Estela se siente muy bien trabajando con Manuela Ramos porque dice que es una ayuda para todas las mujeres que quieren salir adelante y emprender su propio negocio.

loans.use: To buy electronic products

loans.name: Wanyama West B (Ii) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Betty Nkimbugwe. She is currently in the business of selling used clothes and is requesting a loan to put up a boutique. Betty is 25 years old and is married. Her husband is a hairdresser. She has 2 children aged 3 and 5, and both of her children go to school. Each week, Betty makes approximately UGX 20000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to save and add to her clothes business. Betty has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to buy more clothes and the loan was paid back on time.

Betty is joined in her small group by Margret A., Faith N. and Agnes N.. Margret A. has a business running a grocery and wants to purchase more groceries. Faith N. is currently operating a business selling charcoal and wants a loan to stock more charcoal. Agnes N. operates a retail shop business and wants to purchase more shop items.

loans.use: To add to clothing sales business

loans.name: Rehema's Central Group

texts.en:
ReH. is 42 years old and is married with six children. ReH. owns a small cloth shop, which she opened in 2005. Every day she works from 10am to 9:30pm at her business, and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more cloth (khanga and Vitenge) for her shop. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Happiness, Aziza, Barke, and Aisha, who have businesses dealing in cloth sales and perfume sales.

loans.use: To buy more cloth (khanga and vitenge) for her shop.

loans.name: Javhar

texts.en:
S. Javhar is 47 years old. He is married and has 2 children. Mr Javhar lives in the high-mountain region of Tajikistan where agriculture and livestock are well-developed and one of the main avenues of the business development in the Asht region.

Mr. Javhar is a very hard-working man, and a good family man. He works in the collective farm, but because it is seasonal work, he also works in his family's livestock business. Mr. S. Javhar has the necessary skills and bring a love of animals to the livestock business.

Mr. S. Javhar is applying to Kiva for a business development loan of 2100 STJ ($625) for 6 months to buy pedigreed bulls to add to his herd.

loans.use: To buy pedigreed bulls.

loans.name: Nury

texts.en: M. Nury lives in Khujand and is engaged in a small business selling small items and sundries. She trades thread, henna, packages, and other items. Mrs. M. Nury is an active client who we have been working with since 2003. The business and a stable income helped her to pay the previous loan on time and to improve her business significantly.  She started the business practically from the scratch. Now, M. Nury has applied to KIVA for help with a business development loan of 1500 STJ for 4 months for the new good importing.

loans.use: Import new goods.

loans.name: Anvar

texts.ru:
Anvar S. lives in Qurgan-Tube. He is 31 years old. He is married and has two children. He has a higher education. By profession, he is an engineer. He works selling vegetables and fruit. Currently, he brings in watermelons and other types of melons, buying them at wholesale and selling them at retail. He wants to increase turnover. Therefore, he wants to take out a loan for 2500 somoni for 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa, Kiva Volunteer

Собиров Анвар житель города Курган-Тюбе. Возраст 31 год . Женат и имеет двоих детей. Образование высшее. По специальности инженер. Занимаетс яторговлей овощей и фруктов. В данный момент привозит арбузы и дыни , скупая их у оптовых реализаторов. Продает в розницу. Хочет увеличить товарооборот . Для этого хочет получить кредит на сумму 2500 сомони , сроком на 12 месяцев

loans.use: Increase sales

loans.name: Joel Elvis

texts.es:
Joel is 31 years of age, is the father of the family and lives with his wife and two small children.

He has made coffins for ten years, a trade he learned from his father-in-law and that today is the economic support for his home. He has a shop in his home that he works in all day. He makes two coffins per week and later sells them to funeral companies and in this way generates income. Up to now, he has been very satisfied because this has allowed him to support his family as well as to enjoy his work on a daily basis. For him, his greatest difficulty is the amount of capital which many times is insufficient for growth, but he is working on it so that he can expand his horizons.

The reasons for his efforts are his family and the responsibility he has to care for it as a good father and provider.

Joel asks for a loan because he wants to be able to outfit his shop with wood, paint and varnish which are all indispensable supplies for his work. With the loan, he will be able to increase the capital of his work since it is his intention to be able to have his own funeral services business.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

Joel tiene 31 años, es padre de familia, vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos pequeños.

Se dedica a la fabricación de ataúdes o cajones mortuorios desde hace 10 años, por medio de su suegro que le enseñó este oficio, y que hoy es el soporte económico de su hogar. Tiene su taller en su propia casa, al que le dedica todo el día, realiza 2 ataúdes por semana y luego los vende a las empresas funerarias, de esta manera se genera ingresos, hasta el momento le a traído muchas satisfacciones porque le permite sostener a su familia, además de que disfruta diariamente de su trabajo, para él su mayor dificultad es la cantidad de capital, muchas veces es insuficiente para crecer, pero está trabajando en ello para poder expandir sus horizontes.

La razón de su esfuerzo es su familia y la responsabilidad que tiene de cuidar de ella, como buen padre sustentador.

Joel solicita un préstamo porque desea poder implementar su taller con madera, pintura y barniz, que son insumos indispensables para su trabajo, con ello podrá acrecentar su capital de trabajo, ya que su mira es poder tener su propia empresa funeraria.

loans.use: Purchase of Raw Material for the Making of his Coffins.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La señora Martha pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Talentosas, ubicado en Jr. Alvarado Nº 915, distrito de Callería, departamento de Ucayali. Martha tiene 46  años de edad y 3 hermosos hijos, es casada y su esposo trabaja de instructor en su propio gimnasio. Martha trabaja desde hace 3 años con el banco comunal de Manuela Ramos y con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300, decidió invertir en la renovación del gimnasio.

En la actualidad, Martha, continúa con el negocio de “Gimnasio”, en la cual  trabaja junto con su esposo. Ambos están muy contentos porque cada día van teniendo mas acogida de alumnado. 

Con el préstamo de S/.3,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, invertirá en la compra de 2 bicicletas de aeróbicos.

Martha es una mujer emprendedora que día a día se esmera para lograr grandes objetivos y así seguir creciendo en el negocio del gimnasio y también es una  mujer empresaria muy activa quien además se mantiene en forma con los ejercicios diarios que practica
texts.en:
Martha belongs to the “Talented Women” Communal Bank, located on Alvarado Street #915, in the Callería district, department of Ucayali. Martha is 46 years old and has three beautiful children. She is married and her husband works as an instructor at his own gym. Martha has worked with the Manuela Ramos Communal Bank for three years and with the first loan of 300 soles ($100) that she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in the renovation of the gym.

Currently Martha continues working alongside her husband at the gym. Both are very happy because every day they are better received by the gym members.

With this loan of 3,000 soles ($1,025), which she will repay over four months, she will invest in the purchase of two aerobic bicycles.

Martha is a very enterprising woman who day after day does her best to achieve her great goals and in this way, keep growing in the gym business. She is also a very active businesswoman who stays in shape with the exercises that she does on a daily basis.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of two aerobic bicycles

loans.name: Mrs. Pich Mach Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this four-member group is Mrs. Pich M.. All the members in this group live in Trapeang Anchan Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. 

Mrs. Pich M. is a grocer in the local market. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she has decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery products to resell to her customers. Mrs. Pich M. is a 49-year-old widow with two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory. The youngest one is attending the local school. 

One of the members in this group loan has an end-of-term loan and the rest have monthly-payment loans. The member with the end-of-term loan is not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more groceries

loans.name: Shahnaz Bano Rauf Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz bano baji is the wife of R. A. and resides the city of Shah Rukn, Pakistan. Shah Rukn city is famous among travelers for its holy places and tombs. Shahnaz baji completed her education till 5th standard, after which point she stopped her education as her family couldn’t afford it. She owns a two room brick house and has been living in it with her family for the past 20 years. She is the mother of three children: two sons and one daughter. Her eldest son has a power loom machine (used to make clothes) and sells clothing in the market. Her younger son and her daughter are enrolled in a local neighborhood school. Shahnaz baji’s husband is a transit driver and operates a rented auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Shahnaz baji herself has a knitting business. She knits clothes and sells them in markets to earn a profit. She has already successfully repaid two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a third loan to buy an auto-rickshaw for her husband.

This is a group loan, and she is joined in her request by four other members. Shaista baji and Shahnaz baji each want a loan to buy clothing for their knitting businesses. Zareena baji wants a loan to buy cooking oil, lentils, rice, and spices for her Punjabi food business. And Shamim baji wants a loan to buy plastic shopping bags to resell. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in their own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es: Felicitas tiene 24 años, es madre soltera de dos niñas Estefani de 14 y Xiomara de 6. Ella es una madre que en bienestar de sus dos pequeñas hijas se dedica al tejido de prendas, para luego vender en los mercados de la ciudad de Puno. Felicitas le dedica a su trabajo todo el día, ya que cuando no está tejiendo sus prendas, tiene que salir a venderlas. La venta le da muy bien, es por eso que quiere agrandar su producción. Lo difícil es elaborarlas, ya que las cantidades que le solicitan a veces escapan a sus posibilidades. Este es su primer préstamo a Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de materiales para la elaboración de sus prendas.
texts.en:
Felicitas is 24 years old and a single mother of two children, Estefani, 14, and Xiomara, 6. She is a mother that, for the well being of her two small daughters, weaves rugs to later sell in the markets of Puno. Felicitas works all day, since when she is not making rugs, she is out selling them. Her sales are going very well, and because of this she wants to increase her production. It is difficult to create the rugs, since the quantities that are requested sometimes escape her capabilities. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money she is requesting she will buy a larger quantity of materials to weave her rugs.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To Purchase more materials for weaving.

loans.name: Mrs. Hen Khoem Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. HE. K. is the village bank president of eight members, all live in the Phum Lor village of Kampong Chhnang province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Teng Morm, is a field laborer hired by others to work their land. EvE. though they work hard, they still cannot provide a better living for their family. Thus, Mrs. HE. K. asks for a loan to add her savings to buy a cow to start a breeding business. She hopes to increase income and improve her family's living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To buy a cow to start a breeding business.

loans.name: Orbelina

texts.es:
La Emprendedora Orbelinda R. S. tiene la edad de 50 años su estado civil es casada, Doña Orbelinda tiene 4 hijos de los cuales todos son mayores de edad y trabajan por cuenta propia su edades son las siguientes un varón de 31 años casado, una mujer de 27 años actualmente trabaja un varón de 28 años trabaja y un su hijo menor de 22 años que también trabaja, su compañero de vida labora en un taller de vulcanización, sus propósitos son de mantener la actividad económica ya que este es el único medio  de trabajo que ella posee y no le gustaría perderlo ya que por medio de este pudo satisfacer las necesidades de sus hijos sus sueños son de que sus hijos siempre se mantengan unidos debido a las difíciles situaciones que cada uno de ellos se ayuden mutuamente ya que ella les enseño a ser humildes y generosos sus deseos son que sus productos sean exportados al exterior para comprobar que la calidad de su trabajo es la mejor y pueda de esta forma obtener mas ingresos para su familia.

Su actividad económica es un taller de costura, la ubicación de su negocio es de forma ambulante, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 37 años, Doña Orbelinda inicia este negocio por la necesidad de obtener un ingreso par su familia ya que tenia la responsabilidad de proporcionarles a sus hijos educación, vestimenta y techo y fue así como empezó a dedicarse a este oficio como lo fue la venta de algunas prendas de vestir como fueron: faldas, camisas y shorts y así empezó a ofrecer sus prendas que ella misma elaboraba y fue así como fue adquiriendo experiencia y clientela y mas tarde decide incrementar su negocio y lo logra por medio de mano ayuda de la Fundación León 2000 y las organizaciones amigas así obtuvo su préstamo para lograr sus propósitos mas tarde decide realizar la compra de maquinas de coser para aumentar su producción pero necesitaba mas apoyo y esto la conlleva a realizar otro financiamiento propuesto para capital de trabajo que será utilizado para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de faldas de vestir, vestidos y tras prendas ya que tiene que viajar hasta Managua por lo que aquí le resulta mas favorable la compra y agradece a las organizaciones amigas y a la fundación León 2000 ya que fue el vínculo de la unión para que sus propósitos se realicen.
texts.en:
The business woman Orbelinda R. S. is 50 years old and married. Orbelinda has four adult children who work to support themselves. They include: a 31 year old married man, a 27 year old woman, a 28 year old man, and a 22 year old man. Her husband works at an industrial workshop. Her goal is to maintain this source of income because it is his only means of work and she would not like to lose it until they have fulfilled all of the needs of their children. Her dream is for her children to always stay united and that each of them will help each other in difficult situations. She has taught them to be humble and generous. Her desire is for her products to be exported, which will prove the high quality of her products and earn more income for her family. Orbelinda's job is at a sewing shop in which the nature of the business is traveling. She has had the business for 37 years. Orbelinda started this business to earn income for her family because she had the responsibility to provide her children with education, shelter, and clothes; she began to work in this trade by selling various items of clothing: skirts, shirts, and shorts. Accordingly, she began to gain experience and a clientele. Later, she decided to increase her business by receiving help from Fundacion Leon 2000 and other friendly organizations. She obtained a loan to carry out her proposals and later decided to buy sewing machines to increase the production. However, she needed more help and with this, she realized she needed more financial aid. She will use the loan to purchase basic materials to make skirts, dresses, and other clothes so that she can travel to Managua where she can find more sales. She appreciates these friendly organizations and la fundacion Leon 2000 for helping her family achieve their goals.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment capital

loans.name: Parveen M. Khalid Group

texts.en:
Parveen baji is 28 years old and married. She has been a citizen of the city of Multan, Pakistan for the past 25 years. She is the mother of one son and one daughter. Both of her kids are in kindergarten.

Parveen baji is a seamstress; she sews clothes to pay the school fees of her children. Her husband, M. K., has been involved in a scrap business for the past 10 years. Parveen baji is applying for a loan to buy scrap for her husband’s scrap business.

Parveen baji is a group leader of some more women of her locality. Kosar baji and Shahnaz baji each want a loan to buy donkey carts for loading.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy scrap

loans.name: Difa

texts.fr: Difa A.  est une jeune fille de 32 ans elle est célibataire sans enfant, elle est propriétaire d’un atelier de coiffure sis à soviepe à lome la copitale togolaise.elle exerce cette activité depuis 5 ans c’est la principale source de son revenu, avec ce crédit, elle pense élargir la taille de son activité en achetant une 2e séchoir pour bien satisfaire ses clients.
texts.en:
Difa A. is a young girl, 32 years of age, unmarried, and without children. She is the owner of a hair salon located in Soviepe in Lomé, the Togolese capital. She has been in this business for five years, and it's her principal source of income. With this loan, she is thinking of expanding her business by buying a second hair dryer, so as to do well in satisfying her customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a hair dryer, hair extensions, and cosmetics for her salon

loans.name: Kaniza M. Ismail Group

texts.en:
Kaniza baji and her husband M. I. have lived in a city named Borewala in Pakistan for the past 15 years. Her husband has run a salon in the community for the past six years. Presently, he has two employees in his salon and he pays them bimonthly. Kaniza baji is applying for a loan to buy supplies (mirror, razors, creams and chairs) to give a new look to her husband’s salon.

She is the group leader of three other women from her locality. Gulshan baji and Parveen baji both want loans to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Rani baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy salon supplies

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is 36-year-old Juliana A. from Mwanza. She is married with six children between the ages of 9 and 21. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one other dependent because he is an orphan.

Juliana has been running a hardware business selling building equipment since 2002. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, six days per week. Juliana currently earns about $180 per month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 in order to purchase brushes, clear vanish, nail iron and brooms. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Juliana thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback micro-finance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase brushes, clear vanish, wires, nail iron and brooms

loans.name: Emiliana Adela

texts.es:
Emiliana es socia del Banco Comunal Arco Iris.
Emiliana es conviviente, tiene 43 años y 4 hijos, Emiliana tiene un taller de confección de prendas de vestir en su casa, confecciona ropa típica como faldas, mandiles, sus ventas los realiza en los pueblos de la región.
Emiliana necesita un préstamo de 2200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de telas.
Los sueños de Emiliana son que sus hijos culminen sus estudios e implementar con maquinas modernas su taller.
texts.en:
Emiliana is a partner of "Banco Comunal Arco Iris".

She lives with her partner, is 43 years old and has 4 children. Emiliana has a workshop at her house where she makes garments such as skirts and aprons to be sold in the villages of the region.

Emiliana needs a loan of 2200 soles to be invested in buying material. It is her dream that her children finish their studies and to install modern machines in her workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza es una mujer emprendedora y su entrega como madre y esposa es un indicador de la calidad de persona que es. Siempre ha sido responsable, durante el tiempo que trabajó para diversas empresas era muy puntual y rápida con los trabajos, pero un día tomó la determinación de independizarse y tener su propio taller de costura. Pero la falta de máquinas limitaba su trabajo, hasta que adquirió una máquina de coser con la cual viene trabajando desde hace 10 años. Maritza supo aprovechar algunos contactos con empresas para ofrecerles sus servicios como costurera, y la contrataron por temporadas, esto incrementó el costo de su labor, y en poco tiempo tuvo mayores recursos para implementar un taller de costura en su casa donde ha contratado a dos señoritas para cumplir con los trabajos que las diversas empresas le solicitan. Ahora, Maritza tiene el anhelo de ampliar su taller en el segundo piso de su casa, y este paso lo avizora como el inicio de una empresa exitosa. Cerca de siete personas conforman su Banco Comunal en Microfinanzas PRISMA, pero este es su primer crédito individual, oportunidad que se ganó por la responsabilidad que mostró desde hace 4 años. Con los 3500 soles que solicita cubrirá los costos de producción que realiza con cada pedido, además de la cancelación de su nueva máquina de coser.
texts.en:
Maritza is an entrepreneurial woman and it shows in the quality of mother and wife that she is. She has always been very responsible, especially when she worked at various companies she was timely and a very fast worker. But one day she made the determination to go independent and start her own sewing business. But the lack of equipment limited her work until she purchased a sewing machine 10 years ago.

Martiza did take down some contacts with companies to offer her services as a seamstress and contracted temporarily which increased the cost of labor and soon she had the resources to implement a sewing business at her house where she employs two ladies which comply with the requirements for the various companies they service.

Now, Maritza has a desire to expand her studio on the second floor of her house as it is needed to start a successful business. Nearly 7 people make up her microfinance community bank of PRISMA, but this is her first personal loan and it’s an opportunity to show how accountable she has been for the last 4 years. With 3500 soles loan she can cover the cost of production for each order, as well, she cancel the order for the new sewing machine.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials and cancel the order of a new sewing machine

loans.name: Betty

texts.es: Betty tiene 32 años, vive con su pareja en su casa propia, es madre de una pequeña de un año a quien le dedica toda su atención y cuidados. La siembra, cultivo y venta de plátanos y café, son las actividades cotidianas que realiza Betty por más de 3 años en las chacras que le prestaron sus padres y sus suegros hasta que obtengan sus propias tierras. Cuando era joven, tenía la idea de dedicarse al comercio de ropa, pero se enamoró de un agricultor y sus pretensiones cambiaron debido al amor que le tiene a su esposo, pues lo apoya en sus labores agrícolas, y con el paso del tiempo aprendió a amar cada uno de sus cultivos. Ahora, junto a su esposo, se han propuesto incrementar su producción y generar las ganancias suficientes para comprar sus propias chacras, pero mientras logran esa cantidad, también están procurando comprar un terreno en la ciudad, donde construyan una casa, con mejores comodidades para sus futuros hijos. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, durante los ciclos anteriores ha demostrado ser una cliente muy puntual en sus pagos y colaboradora con las actividades y acuerdos de su banco comunal, al que le tiene mucha gratitud y cariño porque le permitirle seguir trabajando. Con el dinero facilitado va a mandar a limpiar sus chacras de plátanos, así mismo, empezará a preparar la tierra en otras extensiones de terreno para sembrar en mayor cantidad.
texts.en:
Betty is 32 years old and lives with her husband in their own house. She is the mother of a little one-year-old girl to whom she devotes all of her attention and care. Planting, cultivating and selling plantains and coffee are the everyday activities that Betty has performed for more than three years in the fields that her parents and step-parents have loaned her until she can obtain her own. When she was young, she thought she would go into clothing sales, but she fell in love with farming and her aspirations changed because of the love she has for her husband, since she helps him with their agricultural chores, and over time she learned to love every one of her crops. Now she and her husband are proposing to increase their production and generate enough profits to buy their own fields, but while they are accomplishing this, they are also trying to buy some land in the city where they can build a house with better amenities for their future children. This is her fifth loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. During her previous loan cycles she has shown herself to be a client who is very punctual in her payments, and one who participates in the activities and fulfills the agreements of her communal bank. She has a lot of affection and gratitude for them because they have allowed her to continue working. With the money provided she is going to take charge of cleaning up her plantain fields. At the same time she will begin to prepare the soil in other areas of the land in order to plant even more.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve her plantain fields.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica K. is fifty-two years old. She is married and has given birth to five children, four sons and one daughter. All are currently in school – senior high, junior high and primary school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Her husband works with a cocoa marketing company.

Veronica runs a chop bar. She prepares and sells local dishes like ‘fufu’, ‘banku’, rice balls, etc. Veronica wants a loan to buy bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk. She buys her goods from nearby communities. She has been in business for two years. She aspires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs to prepare dishes to sell

loans.name: Sherley

texts.en:
Sherley T. is from the village of Katipunan, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 35 years old. Sherley is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Sherley owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting corn for sale. Sherley has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Sherley joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sherley has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Sherley is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Sherley from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Sosan Muhammad Bashir Group

texts.en:
Kosar parveen baji wants a loan to buy material (scissors, clothes and thread) for her tailoring center.

Najma baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for her clothes-sewing business.

Sakina baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruit to sell.

Sabra baji wants a loan to buy vehicle-repair tools for her motor workshop. 

Sosan baji, wife of M. B., has resided in the city of Vehari, Pakistan, for the past twenty years. Her husband runs a barbershop in the community where people come for a haircut and to get a shave. He has been running this salon for the past six years.

Sosan baji is a very cooperative lady. She operates a clothes-sewing business to manage the household needs as required. Her family feels proud of her. She is applying for a loan to buy items (scissors, hair dressings and creams) for her husband’s barbershop. Sosan baji is seated second from the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy material for her husband's barbershop

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Forty-four year old Emily was just a business partner with her mother before she joined Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI) seven months ago. She used the first loan for the business with her mother. Her farmer husband supports some of their family's financial needs, while profits from the business were reinvested in the business and also used for the educational expenses of her only child.

After paying back the previous loan on time, Emily now would like a loan for a larger amount to enhance her variety store by buying additional items that are most needed by people in their village. Someday, she hopes that her business will increase through having sufficient capital. She also wishes to employ people to work with her in her business in the future, and that her child finishes his studies.

loans.use: To buy more products for her variety store business.

loans.name: Zaina

texts.en:
Zaina is a 38-year-old married woman with five children between the ages of 1 and 17. Four of her children go to school. She rents a three-room house, where she is staying with her children. Zaina takes care of additional family members (parents).  There is electricity but no piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day. She resides in a semi-urban area in the outskirts of Kampala.

Zaina rents a stall in the Owino market, where she also purchases second-hand clothes. She sells to an average of 10 people a day. Zaina uses public transport to and from work. Her major monthly expenses are food, health care and school fees. Zaina has been with MCDT for four years and is servicing her eighth loan, working all this time with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more stock.
.

loans.use: To buy more second-hand clothes

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes S. is from the village of Poblacion 2 Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 61 years old and married. To make a living, Lourdes owns and operates a women's tailoring service for local community members. Lourdes has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2006, Lourdes joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lourdes has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. Lourdes is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. This will be her sixth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics and materials

loans.name: Dinamicas Group

texts.es: El grupo “Dinámicas” son amigas, socias activas emprendedoras que desean realizar actividades para confraternizar y unirse mas como grupo; la presidenta tiene como ocupación la venta D. ropa y cosméticos como ambulante, las demás  señoras tienen una amistad desD. hace mucho tiempo como vecinas del barrio y como compañeros D. negocio. Desempeñan diferentes tipos D. actividades comerciales y D. servicio como: venta D. ropa, productos cosmético, venta D. comida en pensiones, venta D. tarjetas telefónicas, venta D. bocaditos y servicios D. peluquería todas  desarrollan sus  actividades en su propio domicilio o como ambulantes.  En cuanto al entorno competitivo podemos mencionar que sus competidores si bien están presentes en el barrio, pero las socias tienen sus clientes fieles que son constantemente y ellos generan el movimiento económico necesario para subsistir, en caso D. que no les vaya muy bien el barrio se dirigen a otro lugar para realizar la comercialización D. sus productos o diversifican su actividad económica D. forma que puedan obtener su ingreso diario y obtener mas y mejores ingresos. El crédito esta destinado a surtir sus tiendas, compra  materiales D. trabajo y a la compra D. insumos en mayor cantidad; las promotoras D. cosméticos aprovechando las ofertas para una mejor ganancia. Su expectativa es  tener más ingresos y ser más independientes económicamente, en cuanto a sus experiencias en grupos solidarios ya cuentan con la misma a pesar D. ser su primer ciclo en Agrocapital por lo que saben administrar bien los fondos otorgados. Dos D. las socias se encuentran acompañadas por sus esposos que forman un circulo familiar.
texts.en:
The members of the Dinámics group are friends. The members are active entrepreneurs who wish to participate in activities to interact and unite more as a group. The president sells cloths and cosmetics as a street vendor. The rest of the women have been friends as neighbors and business colleagues for a long time. They carry out different types of commercial activities and services like selling clothes, cosmetic products, meals in boarding houses, telephone cards, snacks, and hairdressing services. They all work at home or as street vendors. As far as competition goes, there are competitors in the neighborhood. But, the members have their constant, loyal customers. They generate enough business to survive. In case it is not going very well in the neighborhood, they go to another place to sell their products or diversify their economic activity so that they can get their daily income and get more income. The loan is to stock their stores, buy work materials, and buy wholesale supplies. Those who sell cosmetics are taking advantage of offers to improve their earnings. Their expectation is to have more income in order to become more economically independent. As far as their experience in communal banks goes, they do have experience even though this is their first cycle with Agrocapital. They know how to administer the given funds. Two of the members are accompanied by their spouses to form a family circle.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is forty-seven years old. She is married and the mother of four children. She lives with her family in their own house. She operates a pharmaceutical shop and sells various kinds of medicine like blood tonics, pain killers, malaria drugs, etc. in her neighborhood. Many local people patronize her drugstore for first aid and cure when they are sick.

Emelia has time for every customer that visits her shop. She usually enquires about the symptoms of the illness to offer the right medicine and also gives advice on its usage. She has been in operation for the past twelve years and has assisted in the cure of a number of common diseases such malaria, cholera, typhoid ,etc. in her community.

She requests the loan to top up her working capital to purchase more medicines to serve her community and in the process raise more income to support her family. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To procure assorted pharmaceutical drugs

loans.name: Felix

texts.en: Felix is 45 years old and married with 10 children. He has a large family to cater for. He sells over long hours to ensure that there is food on his table to feed his immediate family members. He is so determined to give his children quality education. He sells poultry birds. His poultry are kept in his house. He created a space to rear his birds. He said that it is cheaper for him since he does not have to pay for stall rent. He has been in this business for a long time. He hopes for a loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more poultry birds to sell. This is the high season for his business and he hopes to meet the demands of his customers. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase poultry birds to sell

loans.name: Baptisseurs Plus Group

texts.fr:
Jean Patrice B. est président du groupe dénommé « Bâtisseurs Plus » composé de 27 micro entrepreneurs engagés solidairement à bénéficier des prêts de Kiva et de l’IMF HOPE RDC dans le but de développer leurs activités.
Jean Patrice gère sa propre boutique générale dans une zone périphérique  située à l’Ouest de la ville de Kinshasa. Il est entré dans le monde de micro entreprise depuis 1994. Il aime son affaire et il en a acquit une solide expérience. Jean Patrice a déjà démontré sa fidélité en recevant 4 fois les crédits chez IMF HOPE RDC qu’il a correctement remboursé. Le prochain prêt lui permettra de renforcer le stock de sa boutique en achetant divers articles tels que du savon, des conserves, du sucre, etc… en vue d’accroitre le revenu. Son ambition est d’élargir sa boutique en y ajoutant des vêtements mixtes. Jean Patrice est âgé de 50 ans, marié et père de 6 enfants dont leurs âges varient entre 6 et 23 ans. Tous vont à l’école.
texts.en:
Jean Patrice B. is the president of a group names "Bâptisseurs Plus" composed of 27 micro-entrepreneurs committed in solidarity to benefiting from loans from Kiva and the micro-finance institution HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses.  Jean Patrice manages his own general store in an outlying area west of the city of Kinshasa.  He entered the world of micro-finance in 1994.  He likes his business, and he has acquired solid experience from it.  He has already demonstrated his trustworthiness by receiving a loan four times from HOPE RDC that he has repaid properly.  The next loan will enable him to bolster the inventory in his store by purchasing a variety of goods, such as soap, canned foods, sugar, etc... with the aim of growing his revenues. His ambition is to expand his store by adding clothing for men and women.  He is 50 years old, married, and the father of six children, ranging from 6 to 23 years of age.  All of them go to school.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Various goods, such as soap, canned foods, etc... for bolstering his store inventory

loans.name: Yraida

texts.es:
La señora Yraida, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Mujer Riojana”, Distrito D. Rioja, Provincia D. Rioja, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 39 años y es madre D. 02 hijos, que aun dependen D. ella.

Yraida, lleva 8 años dedicándose a la confección D. vestidos, a pesar D. algunas dificultades, ella sigue adelante y poco a poco, fue generando sus propios ingresos y ahorrando su dinero. Nos cuenta, que sus ventas le va muy bien. Se encuentra ubicada en su misma casa, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado para atender a sus clientes. Trabaja con pedidos D. sus clientes anticipadamente. 

Con este préstamo D. S/. 2,000.00, comprará telas en metros, D. diferentes especies, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, agujas D. coser y D. maquina, alfileres, botones.

Yraida, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas D. alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Sra. Yraida is a member of the Communal Bank “La Mujer Riojana”, which is in the District of Rioja, Rioja Province, Department of San Martín. She is 39 years old, married, and the mother of two dependent children.

Yraida has been producing clothes of 8 years. Despite some difficulties, she continues to work and has gradually been able to generate her own income and save some money. She tells us that her sales are doing very well. Her business is located in her home, which is well-equipped to accommodate her customers. Her work is based on the orders she receives from her customers in advance.

With this loan of 2000 soles, she will buy meters of fabric in different styles, and tools such as scissors, hand needles, sewing machine needles, pins, and buttons. Yraida feels like today she is a very accomplished woman and has more desire to achieve and fulfill her other dreams. She thanks Manuela Ramos for helping her start her business and also supporting other women who want to grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sewing materials & supplies

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is forty-nine years of age, married, and has four children who are all currently in school. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a tourist attraction community in the central region of Ghana. The community is one of the coastal towns in Ghana and, as a result, the major occupation of the people is mainly fishing.

George is a trader. He trades in hardware such as bags of cement, roofing sheets, building materials, etc. He sells in a store by the roadside in the community. George procures his goods from Accra. He has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to increase his stock.

loans.use: To buy hardware

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace O. is 50 years old and she is married with one child. She sells cooking oil at wholesale prices to her customers. She has been in this business for three years. She hopes to expand her business, so she is requesting a loan in the amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more cooking oil to sell. She is a LAPO client. "Lift above poverty organization"(LAPO) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.  Grace says thanks to LAPO and Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Toem

texts.en: Mrs. S. is a 42-year-old farmer with many years of farming experience. She is a married mother of six children, four of whom are students. One of her childre is married and another one is a fruit plantation worker. She has a partner in her husband who allows her to plant crops. S. is requesting a loan to buy supplies for her crop-growing activities.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her farm

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras 2 Group

texts.es:
Este comité se encuentra en pleno desarrollo, con las actividades que las mismas realizan, se puede decir que las capacitaciones de las asesoras sirvieron bastante para que estas señoras hoy en día se sientan mas seguras para desempeñar una actividad que no este relacionado solamente con las labores de la casa.
