Son señoras que trabajan en su mayoría como empleadas domesticas que, en temporadas anteriores al programa comité de mujeres no desarrollaban ninguna actividad comercial., por eso es que en estos días, al formar parte del programa de Comité de mujeres emprendedoras,  existe una actitud de sentido de pertenencia de las mismas para mantenerse al tanto de los requerimientos que les exige la fundación a modo  de que sigan siendo beneficiadas recibiendo un capital para satisfacer sus necesidades invirtiendo en pequeños negocios que les generara un ingreso adicional.

Las mismas están agradecidas por tan valiosa oportunidad que les brinda la Fundación , y esperan cada día capacitarse adquirir experiencias dentro del programa y cumplir sus obligaciones como socias.
Cada una realiza su trabajo con mucho esfuerzo y satisfacción ya esta actividad nos comentan las señoras sirven muchísimo para el sustento de la casa así como la señora Silvina A. quien se dedica ala venta de comestibles en una pequeño negocio que posee frente a su casa y cuando la venta disminuye en el local ella sale y visita casa por casa a sus clientes para ofrecer sus productos..
Se citan la actividad que realiza cada integrante:.

1
Silvina A.
Vta de Comestibles.
2
Ines M.
Empleada Domestica.
3
Mercedes A.         
Empleada Domestica
4
Marta G.
Empleada Domestica .
5

Empleada Domestica.
6

Vta de Joyas .

13

Elaboracion de Collares.
14
Maricela G.
Elaboracion de Cadenas.
15
Deisy E.
Vta de comestiblesV
texts.en:
This committee is very active with the work that the members are involved in. That is to say that abilities of the women serve them well in these days to make them feel confident to begin an activity that is not only related to housework. The majority of the women work as domestic servants, that in the past never led to any outside business by the women‘s committee. But in today’s world, by being part of a committee of entrepreneurial women, there is an attitude of feeling of their belonging, and of being able to fulfill the requirements demanded by the foundation. Thus they can continue receiving capital to satisfy the needs of their small businesses so that they will generate more income. These women are grateful to the foundation for giving them a valuable opportunity and every day they hope to have more experience in the program to fulfill their obligations as members. Each one does her work with a lot of determination and satisfaction since, as the women tell us, these businesses help them support their households. One such woman is Silvina A. who works selling foodstuffs in a small business that she has in front of her house. When business drops off in her stand, she goes out house to house to offer her products to her customers. Each business is listed here: Silvina A. Food sales. 2 Ines M. Domestic servant. 3 Mercedes A. Domestic servant. 4 Marta G. Domestic servant. 5 Dany O. Domestic servant. 6 Salvadora C. Seamstress 7 Ariana G. Domestic servant. 8 Matilde O. House manager. 9 Bernarda O. Domestic servant. 10 Maria G. Jewelry sales. 11 Lucia G. Domestic servant. 12 Lidia A. Domestic servant. 13 Nancy C. Making necklaces 14 Maricela G. Making chains 15 Deisy E. Food sales

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make food such as meat, vegetables, noodles, rice, bread  and more

loans.name: Cipriana

texts.es: La Sra. Cipriana Baldeón tiene 48 años de edad. Es casada vive junto a su esposo,y sus 5 hijos todos mayores, tres de ellos están comprometidos, sólo dos hijos solteros se encuentran viviendo con ellos. Tienen un pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes y bebidas en su casa desde hace 1 año apróximadamente. Además su cónyuge labora como obrero de campo en distintas empresas agroindustriales de la zona de Santiago, Ica. Cuenta con casa propia la cual han construído con mucho esfuerzo. Además se dedican a la crianza de animales como vacas y ovejas. No cuentan con endeudamiento en ninguna institución. Su sueño es hacer crecer su negocio para incrementar ingresos en su familia y mejorar su calidad de vida. Ambos agradecen el apoyo que les podamos brindar a través de estos financiemientos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Cipriana B. is 48 years old, married and lives with her husband. Her five children are all grown up; three of them are engaged and only two sons are single and live with them. They have a small business where they have been selling groceries and drinks in their home for approximately a year now. Furthermore her spouse works as a field worker in different agro-industrial companies in the Santiago, Ica. zone. She has her own home that they have built with a lot of effort. They are also dedicated to raising animals such as cows and sheep. They don't have any debts with any institution. Her dream is to make their business grow to increase the earnings for their family and to increase their quality of life. They both are very grateful that we can provide help with this financing.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Turibamwe Womens Group, Ibanda

texts.en: K. Florence is a 39-year-old married woman with four children, all of whom attend primary school. She has been operating a retail shop in Kitongore, Ibanda district for close to two years and she currently generates profits to the tune of 50,000 UGX per week.  In a month, she believes that her profits could triple. Since the inception of her business, her set goal has always been to dispense with poverty. K. Florence is a hard working and diligent woman who hopes to expand her retail trading activities once she can get a loan. She is the leader of her lending group and appears in the small photo at the top left of the group photo.

loans.use: to buy more goods to increase the stock of her retail shop

loans.name: Colette

texts.fr: A. Colette est née en 1983 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Colette vit depuis 7 ans à Agbodjèdo, un quartier de Cotonou. Mariée à AVAHOU Fulbert, Colette est mère de deux enfants tous scolarisés. Le couple vit ensemble avec ses enfants. Colette est secondée par son mari pour assurer les dépenses familiales. Pour venir en aide à son mari, Colette exerce comme activité la gestion d’une cafétéria. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Colette mène son activité. Colette s’approvisionne également à Dantokpa. Colette exerce son activité depuis bientôt quatre ans bien que n’ayant pas fréquenté l’école. Colette est une cliente fidèle de ALIDé qui a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits qui ont tous été bien remboursés. Colette souhaite développer son activité afin de répondre aux nombreuses attentes de sa clientèle, c’est pour cela qu’elle veut bénéficier d’un troisième concours financiers chez ALIDé.
texts.en:
A. Colette was born 1983 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  She has been living in Agbodjèdo, a district of Cotonou, for seven years.  Married to AVAHOU Fulbert, she is the mother of two children who are both in school.  The couple live together with their children.  Colette backs up her husband to ensure that family expenses are covered.  To help out her husband, she runs a cafeteria as her business located at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin.  She also gets her supplies from Dantokpa.  Colette has been in operation for almost four years, even though she did not attend school.  She is a loyal ALIDé client who has already benefited from two loans, which have been repaid.  She wishes to develop her business in order to respond to the numerous expectations of her customers.  This is why she wants to obtain financial assistance from ALIDé for a third time.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sugar, concentrated milk, etc.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia A. is from the village of Talakag Bukidnon. She is 55 years old and married. To make a living, Olivia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling food and daily use products in the local community. Olivia has been engaged in her business for over 27 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Olivia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Olivia is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Olivia from HSPFI. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jose Baciliso

texts.es:
Jose de 43 años de edad es soltero, vive en union libre con la Sra. Maria Lilliam Lopez con quien procreo 2 hijos: Yudeisi de 5 añitos estudiando el preescolar y Franklin de 3 añitos, que aun no estudia.  Jose Baciliso trabaja para la Alcaldia de Juigalpa desde hace 2 añoa como policia municipal.  

Esta solicitando su 3er credito con el objetivo de mejorar su vivienda construyendo un cuarto para contar con mayor comodidad y si el dinero lo permite comprar los protectores de hierro (verjas) para las ventanas y asi contar con mayor seguridad en su casa.  

El mayor deseo que tiene es poder tener una casa bonita, con las condiciones basicas, para que su familia se sienta comoda.
texts.en:
Jose 43-year-old, single. He lives with Ms. Maria Lopez Lilliam who bore two sons. Yudeis is 5 years old and in preschool and Franklin is 3 years old and is not yet in school. Jose Baciliso works for the city of Juigalpa as a municipal police officer since 2 years ago. He is requesting his third loan in order to improve their home by building another room so they are more comfortable. If the loan is sufficient, they will also buy buy protective iron (gates) for the windows so they will feel safer in their home. His greatest desire you have is to have a nice house, with the basic necessities to make his family feel comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build an extension and buy gates

loans.name: Jose

texts.en: Jose C. is a 55-year-old married man from the town of Sta. Josefa. He has six school-aged children. Jose owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over three years now. Jose joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Jose is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase seed, fertilizer, and diesel fuel for his tractor. This loan will be his seventh from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income and pay for his children's school fees. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer, and diesel fuel for his tractor

loans.name: Marilinda

texts.es: Marilinda, tiene 31 años, está casada con Emilio, D. 46 años con quien tiene 4 hijos, está noble familia vive en su casa propia, ubicado en una zona céntrica D. la Merced. Quiso ayudar a tener mayores ingresos en su casa, por eso desD. hace 5 meses, venD. dulces, galletas, caramelos, bebidas gasificas, productos comestibles y D. primera necesidad, mientras que su pareja trabaja como técnico enfermero. Durante los fines D. semana, ambos van a trabajar al campo, pues poseen plantaciones D. café y plátano. Todas estas actividades son muy rentables, ya que les permite tener una vida cómoda y sin preocupaciones, además gracias a sus oficios compraron terrenos agrícolas, en donD. desarrollan sus cultivos D. manera muy fructífera. Para Marilinda, no le incomoda despertarse todos los días muy temprano porque está segura que todo sacrificio tiene su recompensa, su meta ahora es incrementar su producción, además D. construir habitaciones en su casa para alquilar y así generarse mayores ingresos. Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y se muestra muy entusiasta porque sabe que podrá continuar compartiendo gratos momentos con su grupo, pues a ella, le gusta laborar con los integrantes D. su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará algunos productos comestibles que necesita en su bodega, además D. contratar operarios para que dejen limpio su chacra D. café.
texts.en:
Marilinda is 31 years old. She is married to Emilio, 46, and they have 4 children. This noble family lives in their own house, located in a central area of La Merced. Marilinda really wanted to help earn more money for the household, so for five months she has sold sweets, cookies, candies, soft drinks, foodstuffs and basic necessities, while her husband works as a nursing technician. On the weekends, they both go to work in the countrysiD., where they have coffee and plantain fields. All these activities are very profitable, since they permit Marilinda and Emilio to have a comfortable, worry-free life. Besides this, thanks to their jobs they bought farmland where they grow their crops very productively. For Marilinda, it is no problem to wake up very early everyday because she is sure that every sacrifice has its reward. Her goal now is to increase her production. She also wants to build rooms onto her house to rent them out and earn more income. This is Marilinda's third loan with MFP, and she is very enthusiastic because she knows she can continue to share good times with her group, since she likes to work with the members of her communal bank. With the credit she is requesting, she will buy some food items that she needs in her grocery store, as well as hiring workers to clear her coffee fields.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to stock her store and hire workers to clear her coffee fields

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle P. is from the village of Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 42 years old. Michelle is married and has three adult children. 

To make a living, Michelle owns a business which provides motorcycle services to local community members wherein her husband drives the motorcycle and transports passengers in their village. Michelle has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Michelle joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Michelle has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase materials needed to provide service. Michelle is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Michelle from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to further expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Sheria Group

texts.fr:
Vumilia N. A. est  entrepreneur, productrice de boisson locale communément appelé  « Rutuku », elle lève sa main sur la photo, avec une petite sourire aux lèvres, excellente cliente de groupe de crédit Sheria (qui signifie lois, règlements),  âgée de 50 ans, veuve, mère de 5 enfants dont 4 filles et 1 garçons, le cadet, qui fait la 6e primaire.   Les 4 filles ont leurs propres foyers. Vumilia  N.  A.  réside dans le village  Kiziba II, périphérie et  bidon ville de la ville de Goma, commune de Nyiragongo. 
Son mari est décédé dans les années 2006 suite à une longue maladie de diabète. De façon sommaire, Rutuku est une boisson  alcoolisée d’environ 47% produite en base de solution ou mélange des moisissures des Farine de manioc, maïs, sorgho, etc. chauffée au feu à plus de 180o C , à travers une vase connectée à un cheminé d’évacuation de technologie locale. Les goutes raffinées d’évaporation issues de ce cheminé sont accueillies dans une cuvette et  refroidies pour donner un gout d’une liqueur forte de Whisky apprécié par les buveurs. 
La veuve  Vumilia N. A.  a commencé son business  avec  son fonds propre avec un capital initial de 20$, un peu  après, elle fut informée de  l’IMF Hekima,  et bénéficia son premier crédit de 50$ pour renforcer son business. Avec  le crédit  de  l’IMF Hekima, la veuve  Vumilia N. A. souhaite augmenter son chiffre d’affaire en achetant  2 sacs des Maïs, 2 sacs de farines maniocs, une dizaine des  tas de bois de chauffages, etc. 
Vumilia N. A., explique le défi majeur de son activité de production de boissons locales Rutuku est lié aux ventes en  crédit, le manque ou rareté des bois de chauffage surtout comme l’Etat a déjà pris de mesures pénales aux destructeurs de l’environnement (vendeurs de bois de parc national). En plus parfois lorsque le mélange des intrants n’a pas bien être solutionné, on produit une boisson (liqueur whisky) non appréciée par les consommateurs, ils se réservent de l’acheter.
Vue l’avancement de son âge et les dures conditions de production de cette boisson, la veuve  Vumilia N. A. souhaite changer  son activité  en vendant aussi les habits et  produits divers de commerce général  en provenance de Kampala(Ouganda).  En outre, elle compte construire une maison confortable dans sa parcelle.
La veuve  Vumilia N. A. remercie l’IMF Hekima pour  les crédits  qu’elle reçoit sans aucune garantie matérielle car grâce à ces crédits, elle parvient à subvenir à ses besoins personnels et aux besoins de ses enfants et petits fils. Elle reconnait de l’IMF Hekima sa banque de proximité qui œuvre pour les pauvres et  veuves. 
Le groupe Sheria est composé de 17 membres femmes. Les membres  portent une tenue uniforme d’union et d’unité dans les affaires en  mémoire de la journée internationale de la femme du 8 mars 2010.
texts.en:
A. Vumilia N. is an entrepreneur who produces a local drink known as "Rutuku". On the photo, she is the one raising her hand, with a little smile. An excellent client of the Sheria solidarity group (Sheria means laws, regulations), she is 50, a widow and mother of five children, four girls and a boy. The boy is the youngest and he attends 6th grade. The four girls have their own homes. A. lives in the village of Kiziba II, a shantytown on the outskirts of Goma, a commune of Nyiragongo. Her husband died in 2006 after a lengthy battle against diabetes. Rutuku is basically an alcoholic beverage about 47% proof, brewed from a mixture of fermented cassava flour, maize, sorghum, etc. It is heated to more than 180C in a vessel connected to a locally-designed chimney pipe. The droplets resulting from the evaporation process are collected in a bowl and cooled to achieve the taste of strong Whiskey liquor, which the customers enjoy. A. started her business with her own money, an initial capital of $20. Soon after, she found out about the Hekima MFI and received her first loan of $50 to strengthen her business. With a new loan from the Hekima MFI, A. hopes to increase her sales by buying two bags of maize, two bags of cassava flour, about ten stacks of firewood, etc. A. has explained that the main challenges of producing the local beverage Rutuku are the sales on credit and the lack or scarcity of firewood, especially now that the state has already taken steps to impose criminal sanctions on anyone who harms the environment (people selling wood from the national park). Moreover, when the mixture of ingredients doesn’t dissolve properly, the customers don’t like the beverage and are reluctant to buy it. Given her advancing age and the harsh conditions surrounding the production of the beverage, A. wants to make changes to her activities by adding a new business selling clothes and various items from Kampala, Uganda. She also plans to build a comfortable house on her plot. A. is grateful for the loans that the Hekima MFI grants her without any material guarantees because these funds allow her to support herself and provide for the needs of her children and grandsons. She recognizes the Hekima MFI as the local bank dedicated to helping the poor and the widows. The Sheria group consists of 17 female members. All members are wearing a uniform in solidarity and unity to commemorate the International Women’s Day of March 8, 2010.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase two bags of maize, two bags of cassava flour, about ten stacks of firewood, etc.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline B. is from the village of Estefania, Amulung, Cagayan. She is 56 years old and is married with four school-aged children. Evangeline owns and operates a general store, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 6,700 PHP a month. In 2005, Evangeline joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI. Evangeline is requesting a new loan of 27,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her seventh from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
El Señor B. R. Miguel Angel es un joven de 27 años que vive junto a sus padres en la zona conocida como Villa Candelaria, la cual queda en la zona Norte de la Ciudad de Cochabamba. Miguel es una persona joven que mientras estudia trabaja, y en el tiempo libre acude en las noches a clases de idiomas. Miguel es soltero y por lo pronto sigue estudiando la carrera de Administración de Empresas.

Miguel es Ejecutivo de Ventas de la Empresa BEICRUZ S.A. desde el 09 de abril del 2008 según certificado de trabajo presentado demostró en este tiempo eficiencia, eficacia y puntualidad en su trabajo. Por otro lado el cliente también se dedica a la Comercialización de repuestos electrónicos y otros relacionados. EL crédito que solicita es para poder comprar repuestos electrónicos para poder venderlos con cierto margen de ganancia.

Miguel nos cuenta que su primera meta es poder salir profesional y como segunda meta el poder abrir una tienda de repuestos electrónicos y de esa manera no trabajar para nadie y poder generar sus propios ingresos.
texts.en:
Mr. B. R. Miguel Angel is a young man of 27 years. He lives with hsi parents in the well known region of Villa Candelaria, located north of the city of Cochababma. Miguel is a young man and he works while he attends school. On his spare time in the evenings he attends languages classes. Miguel is single and he is a student completing his studies in Business Administration. Miguel is a sales executive for Beicruz, the company where he has worked his April 9, 2008. Through his work he has demonstrated an aptitude for efficiency, efficacy, and punctuality. Miguel also sells parts and accessories for electronics. The loan that he requests will be used to purchase accessories and parts for electronics so that he may resell them with a good margin of profit. Miguel's goal is to have a carer and he would also like to open an electronics store so that he can be his own boss and make his own money.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital for his business.

loans.name: Chum

texts.en:
Chum T., 54, is widowed and resides with her three children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for its quality palm products. She appears in the photograph with her daughter.

T. is employed as a construction worker for an income of USD 2.50 per day. Her daughter is a garment factory worker, earning an income of USD 2.50 per day.

T. is requesting a loan of USD 600 to buy a new motorbike for the family’s use. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the family's use

loans.name: Maria Enedelia

texts.es: La Señora María Enedelia es pensionada, enviudo desde hace muchos años, vive con ella uno de sus hijos, el cual trabaja y le ayuda con los gastos de la casa, con el pago de su pensión le han hecho muchas mejoras a su vivienda, pero en esta ocasión les hace falta mas dinero para colocar el Vitro piso de uno de los cuartos de la casa, La señora María esta muy agradecida por la ayuda que le puedan brindar.
texts.en:
Maria Enedelia is retired and she was widowed many years ago. One of her sons still lives with her but he works and contributes towards the household expenses. She has carried out a number of improvements to her home with her pension but she is lacking some resources to install tile flooring in one of the rooms in the house. Maria is very grateful for the support she receives.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install tile flooring.

loans.name: Hamuduni

texts.en:
Hamuduni is 43 years old and married with five children between 12 and 1 year old. He takes care of one dependent relative who is 15 years old. Hamuduni is a businessman and his wife does not work outside her home. That's the reason why he works with a great deal of effort so that he provides all the basic needs for his big family. 

Hamuduni is experienced enough because he has two years of experience in his business selling various products such as: cooking oil; rice, bread and so on. The hours of his business are from 6 in the morning to 9 in the evening every day except Saturday.

Hamuduni is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding his business through purchasing more products for his store. With this expansion Hamuduni expects to earn more profits to be used in his business and for his family as well.

loans.use: Expanding his business

loans.name: Fanta

texts.fr:
Madame Fanta Kanté est  une femme mariée de 49 ans et mère de 5 enfants. Elle vit avec ses enfants chez son époux dans le quartier Torakabougou de Bougouni.
Madame Fanta Kanté a vite abandonné l’école au profit des activités génératrices de revenus. Elle a tenté pendant des années différentes activités  telles  la vente des jus de fruits, de cosmétiques mais sans succès. C’est ainsi qu’elle décida d’apprendre auprès de sa sœur la vente des pagnes wax,  de bazins et  de chaussures.
Avec une expérience de plus de 10 ans, elle maîtrise son activité.
Après 12 prêts  solidaires, elle décide de passer au prêt  individuel où elle est à son premier prêt. Tous les autres prêts ont été correctement remboursés. 
Fanta Kanté compte utiliser ce premier individuel pour acheter,  des pièces pagnes wax et quelques pièces de bazins (riches et moins riches). Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako auprès des grossistes.
Sa clientèle est composée pour la plupart de femmes. Elle vend généralement au comptant.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 60 000FCFA. Elle  ambitionne ouvrir une boutique.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fanta Kanté is a 49-year-old married woman and mother of five children. She lives with her children in her husband’s home in the neighborhood of Torakabougou, in Bougouni.

Mrs. Kanté left school early on to earn a living. Over several years, she attempted various activities such as selling fruit juices, or cosmetics, but without success. She then opted to sell wax pagnes (colorful cloth), bazins (highly-prized damask), and shoes, a trade she learned from her sister. With ten years of experience in this business, she has a good command of her activity. 

After 12 group loans, she decided to seek her first individual loan. All previous loans have been fully repaid. 

Fanta intends to use her first individual to buy pieces of wax pagnes and various grades of bazins. She gets her stocks from Bamako wholesalers. She usually sells for cash to a clientele consisting mostly of women. 

She expects to make a monthly profit of 60 000FCFA, and hopes to open a shop.

loans.use: To buy clothing fabrics

loans.name: La Merced (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El Banco comunal La Merced esta formada por 10 mujeres quienes viven en la parroquia de Santa Ana,  sus actividades más importantes son la agricultura, la ganadería y pequeños huertos frutales, estos productos son para el autoconsumo, lo poco que resta se comercializa en la ciudad de Cuenca. Otros habitantes salen por las mañanas a trabajar en la ciudad de Cuenca y retornan por las tardes a sus hogares. Nuestras socias son mujeres quienes trabajan día a día con una sonrisa en los labios y le ven en cada amanecer la mejor oportunidad de superarse y entregar a sus hijos un mejor futuro.

La Señora. María M. vive en la parroquia de Santa Ana, es el noveno crédito que realiza en la banca comunal, beneficiándose con los créditos en su hogar. Se dedica a trabajar como empleada domestica labor que ya lleva 25 años y labora de lunes a viernes desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, en su hogar se dedica a la cría de pollos, inició este negocio gracias al primer crédito que  realizo en la banca comunal.
Doña María tiene 49 años, es soltera y tiene 2 hijos de 30 y 28 años de edad que son casados, uno de sus hijos vive con ella en la casa que han construido en conjunto. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de alimento para sus pollos Su sueño es seguir conservando su salud para continuar con su trabajo.

La Señora. Blanca A. vive por la parroquia del Valle. Tiene 46 años, es divorciada hace 18 años, tiene 4 hijos de 29, 27, 24 y 22 años de edad, su primer hijo es casado y vive  independiente, su segundo hijo está en la casa con proyecto de ponerse un negocio y sus dos últimos hijos trabajan y le ayudan económicamente. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando. 
Doña Blanca se dedica a trabajar en un pequeño restaurante que es de su propiedad en el cual  labora hace un año, trabaja todos los días de lunes a viernes desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde, también en sus tiempos libres se dedica a la elaboración de artesanías o cuando le hacen pedidos sus amigas y familiares. Este es el primer crédito que realiza en la banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de productos para su restaurante como: víveres, colas, aguas etc. Su sueño es tener su casa propia
texts.en:
The La Merced communal bank is made up of 10 women who live in the parish of Santa Ana. Their most important activities are in agriculture, keeping livestock and small orchards. What they produce is to sustain themselves and thier families, with a little left over to sell in the city of Cuenca. Others who live there go each morning to work in Cuenca and return home in the evenings. Our members are women who go to work each day with a smile on their lips and who each morning see an opportunity to improve their lot and offer their children a better future.

Señora María M. lives in the parish of Santa Ana. This is her 9th loan with the communal bank, and her household has benefited greatly from the loans. She has worked in domestic service for 25 years, Monday to Friday from 8am till 6pm. At home she raises chickens - a business she started thanks to her first loan with the communal bank. Doña María, age 49, is single and has 2 children, aged 30 and 28, who are both married. One of her children lives with her in the house they built together. The money she borrows will be invested in feed for her chickens. Her dream is to stay in good health and be able to continue working.

Señora Blanca A. lives in the parish of del Valle. She is 46 ears old, has been divorced for 18 years, and has 4 children, aged 29, 27, 24 and 22. Her eldest son is married and living independently, her second son lives at home and is setting up his own business, and her 2 younger children work and help her with the household expenses. She rents, rather than owns her own house. Doña Blanca works in her own small restaurant, which she has had for one year. She works every day Monday to Friday from 7am until 3pm, and her free time is taken up making handicrafts or making up orders from friends and acquaintances. This is her first loan from the communal bank and she is going to invest it in products for her restaurant, such as staple ingredients and soft drinks. Her dream is to own her own home.

loans.use: To buy chicken-feed, staple foods, soft drinks, and other items

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy G. is a married woman who lives in Purok Alugbati, Brgy. Palaka Sur, Pulupandan, Negros Occidental.  She earns her living by operating three business ventures:  general store, recycling materials and pig fattening businesses.  Her husband Rolando G., who is 50 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have five children who are 11 to 30 years old. 

Mercy joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 20 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Mercy  has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 8,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, thus lifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 21st cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000 which she intends to use to buy stocks for the general store and rice to sell so that she could continue to save up for the future education of her children.  Mercy  G. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Americo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “LOS LIDERES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Americo; el tiene 36 años de edad y es soltero; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con servicio de taxi, el tiene un carro donde hace servicio de taxi a las diferentes calles del cusco, el socio quiere ahorrar y por medio de este trabajo poder salir adelante, el socio quiere mejorar el carro para que pueda brindar un mejor servicio de taxi. El  socio solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento de su carro.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the village bank "Los Líderes" [The Leaders] which is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province and department of Cusco. 

The member is Americo who is 36 years of age and single. The member intersperses his daily activities with taxi services. He has a car with which he provides taxi services in the various streets of Cusco. The member wants to save and get ahead by means of this work. He wants to make improvements to the car in order to be able to offer a better taxi service. The member is seeking the loan for the maintenance of his car. 

The member appreciates those who make up part of this dream in this way and promises to make his payments within the established time period.

loans.use: For maintenance of his car

loans.name: Nyamdorj

texts.en:
Nyamdorj L. is a 49-year-old and lives with his wife and daughter in Hovd province, Mongolia. The family lives together in a 'ger', a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His daughter, age 6, attends a local primary school while his wife works as an accountant for the university and during her free time, helps Nyamdorj by preparing financial reports for his business.

 Nyamdorj owns and operates a tailoring factory called " Buteelch Zuu" (meaning Productive Needle) which was started in 2010. Before he began his current business, he used to operate two kinds of businesses including raw materials and flour trading businesses and has gained much experience as a businessman.

 For the future, he hopes to expand his business and remodel both his workplace and house using his future business earnings. With his loan, he is planning to purchase a large amount of materials and supplies in order to meet the high demand for upcoming Mongolian and European New Year holidays. 

Nyamdorj is a very modest man. He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more clothing fabrics and materials for his growing business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing fabrics and materials

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea S. is a 26 years old and married, living in Kampong Tom Province. Her husband, Kim Chanmieng, 29, is a local construction worker for nearly ten years. They have two children who are in school. Chea S. is looking for a loan of US$ 500 to buy a wooden flat mold and a set of construction wood for local housing construction for her husband. What they hope for in the future is for their children to get bachelors degrees and support them when they grow old. 

Note: Chea S. and her husband appear in the photo.

loans.use: To buy wooden flat mold and a set of construction wood for local housing construction for her husband.

loans.name: Ballivian Group

texts.es:
El Banco D. emprendimiento "Ballivian" esta en su segundo ciclo ha tenido un buen desempeño en su primer ciclo ha cumplido con el pago D. sus cuotas con mucha responsabilidad las socias D. dicho banco son comerciantes minoristas D. venta D. comida y servicios, la presidenta es la Sr. María que se dedica a la venta D. comida es una persona muy trabajadora se levanta desD. muy tempranas horas D. la mañana para preparar sus deliciosos platos y después lo va a vender en su puesto D. venta donD. le va muy bien ya que tiene mucha clientela por el buen sazón D. sus platillos, con el dinero del  crédito comprara insumos como aceite, papa, fideo, por mayor para la elaboración D. sus platillos, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
Las socias sacaron el crédito para aumentar su capital para sus actividades y se fueron muy satisfechos con el crédito
texts.en: The Ballivian bank is in its second cycle and had a good performance in its first cycle, paying its quotas with great responsibility. The members of this bank are merchants who sell food and proviD. services. The president is Maria, who sells food. She is a very hard-working woman who gets up very early in the morning to prepare her delicious dishes, and after she goes to her sales stall. It is going very well and she has many customers because of the good flavour of her dishes. With the money from this loan she will purchase wholesale inputs such as oil, potatoes, and pasta for making her dishes. She is grateful to the institution for the support offered. The members have taken out this loan to increase their capital for their businesses and have been very satisfied with the loan.

loans.use: the purchase of inputs

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Life can be simple, but never uninteresting. Imelda D. L. S., 45, proves this to be true in her life. As a CCT* Community Partner, she makes her business everything but stagnant. She is married to Jose, a van controller. Together they live in Baseco, Manila.

Imelda owns a sari-sari (variety) store, where she sells merchandise essential to busy people in her community. There are times when her neighbors are too busy to go to the market or grocery store to purchase their needs. Coming to the rescue, Imelda provides them with what they immediately need such as a bottle of vinegar for cooking, a sachet of shampoo, or a bottle of cold soft drink to quench their thirst. Other than the sari-sari store, Imelda also buys and sells bananas, a favorite fruit of Filipinos, and operates a water refilling station. Being twenty years in business, she earns around Php 750/day.
 
To help her continue the operation of her growing business, she would like to apply for a Php 29,000 loan. She plans to use this money to boost her banana buying and selling business. She will also invest the money in her sari-sari store to further meet the varying needs of her community. She believes that her entrepreneurial skills are being honed and her businesses are becoming more profitable.

There are problems Imelda faces at present, but she considers none of them worth emphasizing. She believes that these are twists and turns in her life that make it more interesting. She is praying for an increased capacity to earn in order to be able to make her business flourish.
	

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: purchase of essential ingredients for banana business

loans.name: Iimad

texts.ar:
عماد متزوج وله اربع اولاد يعمل في النقل العام من خلال امتلاكه لفان خاصته له في عمله نحو 8 سنوات يسعى جاهدا الى زيادة مدخوله وتحسين وضع عائلته المادي والتعليمي والاجتماعي يحب عائلته وتعليم اولاده هو كل اهتمامه متطور طموح لا يجد صعوبة
في العمل لكن يجد صعوبة في المستوى المعيشي حيث ان كاهل الاقساط كبير عليه لذلك فهو يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى 
دفع الاقساط المدرسية وتسديد ما تبقى منها
texts.en: Iimad is married and a father of 4 children. He owns a van and has been working in public transport for 8 years. He is happy with his work. Iimad works hard to increase his income and improve his family's educational, financial and social conditions. He loves his family and cares much about his children's education. His financial conditions are bad as he has to pay many installments. Imad wants to get a loan from Al Majmoua to pay the rest of his children's tuition installments.

loans.use: Pay the rest of  his children's tuition installemts

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
Roxana, tiene 22 años de edad, es soltera y viven en la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Actualmente, Roxana está estudiando la carrera profesional de Turismo y curso de Ingles. Su actividad económica de Roxana es la venta de comestible, ella alquila una pequeña tienda donde vende sus productos. Ya es un año que se dedica a este negocio y le va  muy bien, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar y otras cosas más que se necesita. 

Roxana pertenece al banco comunal “Kantus” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Roxana is 22 years old, single, and lives in the city of Cusco, Peru.  She is currently studying for a degree in tourism and is studying a course in English.

Roxana's business activity is selling groceries.  She rents a small store where she sells her products.  She has been in this business for one year and it is going very well.  On this occasion, she requires a loan to buy merchandise such as rice, sugar and other products that she needs.

Roxana is a member of Asociación Arariwa's "Kantus" community bank.  She is grateful for the opportunity she is being offered with this loan and she pledges to make her repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as rice, sugar and other products that she needs

loans.name: Huon

texts.en:
Everyone knows that fish is the main vital fresh food, especially for families who depend on fishing and fish selling, from the local river, where the best place for sheltering is. Huon Y., one of those people, currently depends on selling fish at the local busy market. She sells fish that she either gets from her husband’s fishing or buys from her wholesale supplier. 

Huon Y. is a humble mother who has been blessed with four kids. Two of them are working, in Phnom Penh, as sewing workers. Because her house is too old and so narrow, it is not comfortable for her whole family to live in. To deal with this problem, Huon Y. would like to request a loan from Kiva to build a new, bigger wooden house.

loans.use: To build a new, bigger wooden house

loans.name: Emelito

texts.en:
Emelito M. is from the village of Villa Victoria Echague, Isabela. He is 36 years old. Emelito is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Emelito owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Emelito has been engaged in his business for over 8 years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP per harvest.

In 2011, Emelito joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emelito is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Emelito from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Ammabille

texts.en:
Ammabille F. lives in the village of San Simon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 35 years old, married, has two school-aged children and makes a living by raising livestock, including pigs and goats. She has been in this business for more than five years and earns about 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Ammabille joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid seven previous loans from HSPFI and has applied for a new one to buy feed and medicines for her livestock. She plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to continue expanding her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicine for her livestock.

location.town: San Simon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Francis Kimani

texts.en:
Francis has operated his retail shop in Naivasha town for the past three years. He is 39 years, married to Grace Mugure and they have two children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan to buy more goods to sell in his retail shop.

In future, Francis hopes to grow his retail shop to a wholesale business.

loans.use: to buy more retail goods for sale

loans.name: Mwari

texts.en:
Mwari is a single woman with four children, two boys and two girls, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees, clothing and food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a tailoring business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Mwari faces a major challenge of competition from other tailors in her area. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase a sewing machine and cloth. Mwari decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and cloth.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is from the village of Lusot, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 54 years old. Aida is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $70 a month for these activities.

In 2011, Aida joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional noodles, sugar and canned goods for resale. This will be her 1st loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional noodles, sugar and canned goods for resale.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a 31-year-old married woman living in San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur. She has been running a rice farming business for 5 years. This business earns 5,000 PHP per month.

This loan will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs. 

In the future, Analyn hopes to improve her business and to earn bigger income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 22 years old and single. He has operated a business selling secondhand clothes door-to-door in Milango Saba, Mombasa, for one year and is doing well. 

Charles was introduced to KADET LTD recently and this marks his first loan to finance his business. He plans to purchase secondhand shirts and women's clothes to resell. The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to expand his business. Charles' dream is to become a very successful businessman and improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase secondhand shirts and women's clothes to resell

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Revendeuse de charbon de bois à son domicile, AKOUVI est mariée et a 03 enfants. Elle veut assurer un avenir meilleur à ses enfants et sollicite ce prêt pour acheter de la marchandise à BASSAR et SOKODE. Elle a démarré en 2007 et est à son premier  cycle de prêt. Son mari est jardinier.
texts.en: Akouvi, a retailer of charcoal out of her home, is married and the mother of three children. She wants to ensure a better future to her children and applies for this loan to buy goods in Bassar and Sokodé. She launched her business in 2007 and is now in her first loan cycle. Her husband is a gardener.

loans.use: to buy charcoal.

loans.name: Bernardita

texts.en:
Bernardita is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children.
 
Bernardita has a retail shop that sells snacks, breads and canned goods. She has had this business for eight years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy beverages, snacks and noodles.

Bernardita is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Bernardita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy beverages, snacks and noodles to sell.

loans.name: Paulino

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES EN ACCION”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Paulino; el tiene 53 años de edad y es casado y tiene 5 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de agricultura y ganadería, el es propietario de unas tierras de cultivo donde siembra papa y maíz y también se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado, ella vende el ganado en las distintas ferias que existe en el distrito de Anta, por medio de estos negocios el socio saca adelante a sus hijos. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar semillas para su tierra de cultivo y una vaca.
                                            
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Paulino, 53, belongs to the “Mujeres en Acción” (Women in Action) communal bank located in Anta District that belongs to Anta Province and Cusco Department.

Paulino is married and has five children.  He alternates his daily chores with farming and raising livestock.  He owns some farmland where he grows potatoes and corn and he also is a livestock merchant.  He sells livestock at the various markets that take place in Anta district.  He is able to support his children through these businesses.  He is asking for a loan to buy seed for his farmland and to buy a cow.

He’s happy with the loan and commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to buy seeds and to buy a cow.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph, 27, is married. His spouse works as an assistant in their community. Joseph has raised pigs for two years.

Joseph  is asking for a loan of P 5,000 that he intends to use to buy feed concentrate to fatten up his pigs. He has several pigs in his possession and he intends to feed them concentrate to fatten them up more quickly. He wants his animals to reach ideal weight to sell them locally and in nearby markets. He wants to earn higher profits for his family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for his piglets.

loans.name: Anjeline

texts.en: Anjeline is 35 years old, married and has 5 children. She does tailoring to earn a living for her family. She has retained her business for 7 years because of her good services. She also runs a green grocery for extra income. Anjeline has gained a lot of business management skills through the trainings conducted by Faulu Kenya. She hopes to expand the business and employ more people. She has requested a loan of 30,000 KES to buy a sewing machine and fabric.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and fabric

loans.name: Las Talentosas Group

texts.es: Rómulo tiene 64 años de edad, es casado y tiene 8 hijos actualmente sigue apoyando a dos de ellos ya que están estudiando. El señor Rómulo se dedica a diversas actividades, actualmente brinda servicio de jardinería y carpintería, son trabajos eventuales que el cumple ya que nos manifiesta que no cuenta con un trabajo estable, es por ello que ha tenido que esforzarse  mucho para sacar adelante a su familia, para obtener un ingreso mas, como actividad segundaria y con los conocimientos que tenia decidió dedicarse   a la apicultura (crianza de abejas), gracias a su trabajo a podido mejorar su vivienda y darles educación a sus hijos. Su mayor deseo  es que sus hijos sean profesionales y seguir trabajando positivamente. Con el último crédito que solicito va invertir en la crianza de abejas comprando cajones, mascaras, ceras y panales. Rómulo es integrante de  la Alcancía Comunal “Las Talentosas” la cual cuenta con 07 socios que  son personas empeñosas que su mayor deseo es de seguir progresando cada día, ellos agradecen al Programa- Prosperidad.Flor  tuvo que retirarse temprano por motivo de trabajo es por ello que lo adjuntamos  a la fotografía.
texts.en:
Rómulo, 64, is married and has 8 children; he currently has two of them dependent on him since they are still in school.  Rómulo does a variety of things; he currently provides gardening and carpentry services.  These are occasional jobs that he carries out because he tells us that he does not have steady employment.  Because of this, he’s had to exert much effort to support his family.  

In order to have an additional source of income, as a secondary activity and thanks to knowledge he had, he decided to go into apiculture (beekeeping).  Thanks to his work he’s managed to improve his house and provide his children with an education.  His greatest wish is that his children become professionals and to continue to work positively.

With this most recent loan he requested he will invest in his beekeeping buying boxes, masks, wax and hives.  Rómulo is a member of the “Las Talentosas” (The Talented Ones) communal bank which has 7 members who are dedicated people whose greatest wish is to continue making daily progress.  They all thank the Prosperidad Program.

Flor had to leave early because of work so that’s why we added her picture.

loans.use: to buy boxes, masks, wax and hives.

loans.name: Libertad San Francisco Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LIBERTAD SAN FRANCISCO” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Germán Busch.  Está compuesta por nueve integrantes las que están dirigidas por una mesa directiva  a la cabeza de la señora  Verónica.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de gelatina, tejido de mantas, tejido de chompa de alpaca, compra y venta de ovejas, venta de verduras, tejido a máquina.
 
La señora Verónica indica que es el primer año que integra una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de un asesor. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de mantas, que viene trabajando hace años atrás, este oficio lo aprendió de sus amigas.

El crédito que sacará ahora es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) los que compra de la feria 16 de Julio y posteriormente lo venderá en su puesto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella esta casada y tiene cuatro hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las reuniones.
texts.en:
The group “LIBERTAD SAN FRANCISCO” is beginning their first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Focal Center of Germán Busch.  The group is composed of nine members, directed by a managing board headed by Señora Veronica.  The members of the communal association carry out various businesses, among them we have: sale of gelatin, weaving of blankets, weaving of alpaca sweaters, buying and selling of sheep, sale of vegetables, and machine weaving.  Señora Veronica indicates that this is the first year that she has started a communal association in Pro Mujer, entering at the invitation of an advisor.  Currently she has a blanket weaving business, that she has been working for several years.  She learned her position from her friends.  

The loan that is requested now is for the increase of capital to pay for the purchase of wool that she bought at the market on July 16 and that she will later sell in her position at the market.  This form of work permits her to generate resources to support her family.  She is married and has four children.  

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the meetings.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Rosa Etelvina

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa es socia del banco comunal La Esquina, vive por la parroquia de Miraflores, esta parroquia tiene hermoso lugares en donde se puede observar la naturaleza, una gran variedad de platos típicos, su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones, se caracterizan por ser personas amables y gentiles.

Doña Rosa tiene 60 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos quienes son mayores de edad, uno es casado e independiente y su hija soltera trabaja y le ayuda  económicamente. Su esposo labora como jornalero, la casa en la que habita es de su propiedad.

La Señora. Rosa se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y como pasa en casa cría pollos, cerdos y cuyes. También tiene una tienda de comestibles en la cual trabaja sin un horario fijo y de domingo a domingo.

En el banco comunal se encuentra en su cuarto crédito y lo va a invertir para la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, fideos y otros productos de primera necesidad para su tienda.

Su meta es crecer y agrandar su tienda.
texts.en:
Señora Rosa is a member of the communal bank La Esquina. She lives in the parish of Miraflores. This parish has some beautiful spots where you can observe nature, a great variety of local dishes as well as friendly and kind people who maintain their culture and traditions.

Doña Rosa is 60 years old, married and has 2 children who are both adults; one is married and independent whilst her daughter is single and works, helping her mother economically. Her husband works as a daily labourer. The house they live in is their own property.

Señora Rosa takes care of her household chores and so as she spends time at home she raises chickens, pigs and guinea pigs. She also has a grocery store where she works without a fixed schedule Sunday to Sunday.

She is in her 4th loan cycle with the communal bank and with it she is going to purchase rice, sugar, oils, detergents, noodles and other staple products for her store.

Her goal is to grow her business and enlarge her store.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oils, detergents and other staple products

loans.name: Habibullo

texts.en: Born in the town of Istaravshan in 1963, Habibullo lives with his wife and their eight children. Recognized by the people of his neighborhood as a serious man, Habibullo, a farmer, would like to expand his crop production so that it becomes a viable source of income. To do that, he needs a loan of $3000 USD to buy seeds and fertilizer. The income from it will then help him to cope with the needs of his large family and give all of his children a higher education. Habibullo is very grateful to everyone who can help him achieve his dreams with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Selling fish at the public market occupies Florentina's daily schedule. She had been doing this for almost 10 years. She earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month. She had to generate an income because she had three children going to school. She had eight children but due to financial problems, she was not able to send them all to school. 

Now, she wants to improve her sales. That is why she is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy crabs, shrimp and milkfish to sell to increase her sales. 

She wants to continuously educate her two children to acquire a degree and someday improve their lives.

loans.use: to buy crabs, shrimp and milkfish to sell

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela de 24 años de edad, soltera, vive en una aldea de Tela Atlántida. Vive  con su madre.
Es una persona muy emprendedora. Comenzó su negocio  con los compañeros de estudio de la universidad, vendiéndoles productos de fantasía fina como, aretes, cadenas, relojes,  y como le fue muy bien, se motivó y empezó a comprar perfumes, lociones, joyería fina, ropa, productos de belleza y otro tipo de mercadería que le  encargan y así ha generado sus ingresos para cubrir gastos de su casa y ha cubierto todos sus gastos de la universidad, ya está por graduarse. 
Compra alguna mercadería que traen del extranjero y la vende a mejor precio, todo por encargo.
Su meta es terminar sus estudios y llegar a  tener una tienda ya establecida de mercadería en un lugar estratégico para la venta.
texts.en:
Graciela is 24 years old and single.  She lives with her mother in a village in Tela Atlántida.  She is a very enterprising person.

She started her business selling costume jewelry like earrings, chains, and watches to her school colleagues at the university.  As that went very well for her she started to buy perfume, lotion, fine jewelry, clothes, beauty products, and other types of merchandise that she has orders for.  This has generated income to cover her household expenses.  It has also covered all of her university expenses; she is about to graduate.

She buys some merchandise that is from abroad, and she sells it for a better price.  This is all done by order.

Her goal is to finish her education and to have a store that is well-established with merchandise in a place that is strategic for sales.

loans.use: to buy products to sell like clothes, shoes, jewelry, and beauty products, etc.

loans.name: Eloy

texts.es: El señor Eloy es empleado en una empresa fabricadora de cera ubicada en la ciudad de El Alto. El crédito lo requiere para la refacción de su casa ya que hay filtraciones en los muros. Vive en casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona Llojeta  de la ciudad de La Paz es casado y tiene un hijo. El  cliente se encuentra muy contento con los créditos que se le otorgaron anteriormente y esta es la segunda vez que su crédito será canalizado a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Sr. Eloy is employed at a wax factory in the city of El Alto. The loan he is requesting will be used to renovate his home since the walls are leaking. He lives at his parents’ house in the District of Llojeta in the city of La Paz. Eloy is married and has one child.

He is very pleased with the loans he received previously. This is the second time that his loan request is being referred to Kiva.

loans.use: to repair the walls of his house.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy stock for the shop.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is a twenty-seven-year-old lady from Ranen in Migori County, which is situated on the shores of Lake Victoria, Kenya. She is married to George and they have two sons.

Anne runs a retail shop selling household goods. She has been in this business for the last four years. She is taking her second loan which she will use to buy more household items to sell in the run-up to the December festive season. Her profits will go towards paying school fees for her children and paying back her loan 

Her dream is to open a wholesale shop and also educate her children.

loans.use: To buy a stock of home products to sell.

loans.name: Jose Rolando

texts.es:
José, vive con sus padres y una hija, administra una tienda de productos de primera necesidad, este negocio inicialmente lo administraba su padre, le enseñó para que luego él se hiciera cargo de la administración, no tiene horario establecido para la atención de los clientes.
Actualmente solicitó un préstamo para la compra de productos necesarios en la canasta básica, arroz y frijoles, aceite, huevos, detergentes y jabones, está compra le ayudará para fortalecer el negocio y mejora la atención a los clientes.
Él quiere manejar muy bien este préstamo, mejorar las ganancias familiares, y que su negocio crezca.
texts.en:
José lives with his parents and a daughter. He runs a convenience store. Initially, his father ran it, and taught him, so that later he could take it over.

He doesn't have fixed hours for serving customers. Now he has applied for a loan to buy basic household necessities, such as rice and beans, cooking oil, eggs, detergents, and soaps.

This purchase will help to build up his business, and improve service to his customers.  He wants to manage this loan very well, improve the family earnings, and see his business grow.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, cooking oil, eggs, detergents, and soaps.

loans.name: Tukorrehamu Kijweka United Group

texts.en: Kato is a thirty-year-old hardworking man living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He has been dealing in the produce business for the last ten years and he got the initial capital after selling off his Irish potato garden. He has challenges with price flactuation and inflation and his dreams are to educate his children and to hire employees to help in expanding his business. Some of the members did not take a portion of the loan but because of the group's policy, they had to guarantee the others.

loans.use: to buy beans for sale

loans.name: Aloys

texts.en:
Aloys aged 31 years. He is married with 2 children aged between 1 and 6 years. 1 of them go to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing maize for the past 8 years. Also his wife is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizers of maize and pay workers. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of his children and to buy a piece of land.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers of maize and pay workers.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Meet Joyce a young farmer from Nandihills area in Kenya who has defied the common thinking of most Kenyans about farming. Joyce is a proud owner of a small parcel of land on which she has been practicing mixed farming for the past five years and also she keeps dairy cows. 

Joyce passionately loves farming. From farming, she has been able to earn a decent income and she attributes all this success to hard work and determination. Although she makes a profit, she has always wanted to increase her farming and start a cereal-selling business. 

The main challenge she has been facing is lack of funds. She is seeking a loan to buy cereal to sell. Demand for cereals is overwhelming in Nandihills and through your loan, she intends to buy different varieties of cereals and be able to satisfy the demand in her village and local market. 

Joyce has been practicing agriculture by employing youthful energy, enthusiasm and knowledge attained through training. There is no doubt that through your loan Joyce’s life is permanently going to change and she will assure her school-going children of a secure future.

loans.use: to buy cereal to sell.

loans.name: Izafa

texts.en:
Izafa is Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Lachin. She settled with his family in Sumgait city. She is 41. She married and has 3 children. Izafa is the only breadwinner in family. Having borrowed the loan amount of $500 from Normicro she built the grocery store. The second time she borrowed $800 to rent a shop. The loans were paid back timely.
She applies for the loan $1000 to expand the area of shop and to increase the food assortments.

loans.use: To expand the area of shop and to increase the food assortments

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 39 years old and married with 4 children. She completed basic education and did a catering course at the vocational level. With this background, she began a fast-food joint some 7 years ago. This has grown steadily and she has added a general store also.

The KRABAN 'TEACH' learning sessions further increased the desire to improve customer satisfaction. She has therefore decided to use the KIVA assistance to improve the environment in which she operates in order to give value to her teeming clients.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Sok Lin

texts.en: Sok Lin was married 1991 and has 3 children, 2 sons and 1 daughter. All of her children attend school. Her husband is a policeman. She learned to make scarves from her parents when she was 18 years old. She has borrowed loans from MAXIMA for 2 cycles and she used the money to buy more looms. The current loan amount is $1,000, which she will use to set up 2 more looms, bringing the total to five. Her business is getting better day to day and she can afford for her children to attend school. In addition, she has the ability to repay the loan.

loans.use: Purchase 2 more looms.

loans.name: Vohida

texts.en:
Vohida has her own beauty salon. She has been engaged in this business since 1995. Before, she taught mathematics in school for 15 years She loved her work, but her salary was not enough for her family’s needs.

She rented the second floor of a little shop for her beauty salon. Today she has many clients and her business is going well. In the future, she wants to open a wedding salon near her beauty salon. She has free room for this purpose. She has also ordered wedding dresses from her friend from Dubai. She needs in $600 for purchasing mannequins for her wedding salon.

loans.use: Purchase of mannequins for wedding salon

loans.name: Phun

texts.en:
Mrs. Phun, 45, is a wedding planner and earns $10 a day. She has 4 children, two of whom are students, one is a garment worker and one is a photographer. Her two working children earn a combined income of $10 a day. Her husband, 48, is a fisherman who earns $7 a day.

She would like to borrow $400 to purchase more decorations for her wedding planning business to meet growing client demand. Her future goal is to open a photography shop to complement her wedding planning business.

loans.use: To purchase more decorating tools to meet her clients' demands.

loans.name: Emelina Del Socorro

texts.es:
Emelina has made great efforts to improve her life and to give the best to her son. She is not married but lives with her partner. Her dedication to improve her life has led her to progress with her business. Before starting her business selling milk products, she sold clothing which she realized wasn't sufficiently profitable to cover all her household expenses. At that point she decided to start her own business which she has been running for about 5 years. She didn't start off selling cheeses, but instead started selling coffee and bread until finally she started her business selling milk products. Five years later her business is profitable and she has experienced the importance and support of working with CEPRODEL; in just 1 1/2 years of working together her business has prospered. Thanks to this she has been able to make improvements in her store and her home.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

Emelina es una mujer que se ha esforzado por salir adelante en su vida y tratar de darle lo mejor a su hijo. Es soltera sin embargo vive con su pareja. Su dedicacion por salir adelante la llevo hasta donde esta logrando llevar hacia el progreso su negocio.

Antes de iniciar con su venta de lacteos, ella se dedicaba a vender ropa y chinelas, pero esto no era suficiente para cubrir lo gastos en su hogar. De ahi nace la idea de colocar su propio negocio el cual ya tiene de existir alrededor de 5 años. Sin embargo no comienza con la venta del queso, sino mas bien vendiendo cafe y pan, hasta despues se metio en el negocio de los lacteos.

Cinco años despues su negocio le es rentable, y ha sentido la importancia y el apoyo en cuanto al trabajo de CEPRODEL, ya que en 1½ año de trabajar en conjunto ha propsperado su negocio, y gracias a esto ha logrado realizar mejoras tanto en su local como en su hogar.

loans.use: To purchase products and raw materials

loans.name: Banda B9B Group

texts.en: She expects to increase on her income, expand more than her level now.  She also thinks she can various entities of bussinesses in various locations.

loans.use: to open a retail shop

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Mrs. Victoria E. has a business of selling provisions and drinks. She is 45 years old and married with 6 children. She is an LAPO client from Edo State, Nigeria.

Victoria needs a loan of $875 to buy more drinks and provisions for sale. She has been in this business since 1997.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and other provisions for sale

loans.name: Carlos Esteban

texts.es:
Along with his wife, Don Carlos dedicates himself to selling used clothing through a traveling store in the strees of the city, in strategic locations rarely in competition with markets and public squares [plazas]. They have been doing this activity for three years, which has helped them support their two sons and cover house expenses. They do not count on a fixed place from which to offer their goods, this movement is more effective and they are able to sell more rapidly.

Every two weeks they purchase a package of varied clothing which includes pants, shirts, blouses, skirts, shorts. They sell this variety of clothing, styles and sizes by counting on their very accessible/affordable prices.
