Don Carlos wishes to purchase a package of used shoes, so that their customers have the option of also acquiring products of good quality at low prices. Their customers are people who do not count on sufficient resources to enable them to purchase new products.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Don Carlos junto a su esposa, se dedican a vender ropa usada de manera ambulantes en las calles de la ciudad, lugares estratégicos donde estén mayormente concurridos como los mercados, plazas, llevan tres años en esta actividad la cual les ha ayudado a mantener a sus 2 hijos y mantener los gastos de la casa. No cuentan con un lugar fijo en donde ofrezcan su mercadería, esta forma de moverse es más efectiva, por lo que vende con mayor rapidez. Cada dos semanas compran una paca de ropa variada en donde sacan pantalones, camisas, blusas, faldas, short, una variedad de ropa, estilos y tallas, vende al contado ya que los precios que dan son muy accesibles. El señor desea comprar una paca de zapatos usados, en donde también sus clientes tenga esa opción de adquirir productos de buena calidad a bajos precios, sus clientes son personas que no cuentan con suficientes recursos para adquirir productos nuevos.

loans.use: Purchase a package of used shoes.

loans.name: Sharif

texts.ru:
Sharif Safarovich S. lives in the city of Qurgan-Tube in Tajikistan. He is 44 years old, married and has three children. He has a professional degree as a chef. Sharif has been managing a cafe at the central market of the city for the last 4 years. He is planning to use the loan money to purchase additional equipment for his cafe, so that he can improve the quality of service, expand his menu and increase his profits. New equipment will allow the patrons of the cafe to dine there more often as well. Sharif is planning to pay back the loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Салиев Шариф сафарович проживает в городе Курган-тюбе . Возраст 44 года , женат имеет 3 детей.Образование средне-специальное. По профессии повар. Имеет частную столовую на центральном рынке города. Занимается этим видом бизнеса около 4 лет. Планирует получить кредит для того , чтобы купить новое оборудование.Это необходимо для того чтобы улучшить качество обслуживания, увеличить меню , тем самым увеличивая свой доход. Кроме того, улучшение качества обслуживания даст возможность клиентам пользоваться данной столовой чаще.Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of equipment

loans.name: Amna's Group

texts.en: I am Amna S.. I am 40 years old and I have lived all my life in Mian Channu, a small town in Pakistan. I am married and I have six children: four boys and two girls. My husband buys and sells fruits and vegetables in a nearby food market and my eldest son has a cloth dying business. Currently, my husband wants to start a vegetables shop and needs loan. I have been joined in my loan group by a few other women who are: Halima A.’s , Ghulam F. B. , Samina B. and Rukhsana B..

loans.use: Open a Produce store

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Isatu is 41 years old and has four children. Her husband is a retired police officer and does not have any other source of income.

Isatu sells cigarettes, bread, fried fish, bananas, and biscuits by the roadside in Makeni town. With the rainy season approaching, she will move her business to a shelter near her homestead where she does not have as many customers. Isatu would also like to increase her stock to generate more income for her family. Isatu is requesting a loan of $350 (Le.1000,000) for that purpose.

loans.use: Construct a shelter and increase her stock.

loans.name: Morn

texts.en:
Mrs. Morn D. is a 50 year old widow who lives Prey Chap Lich Village in Kampong Speu Province. She has five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory, one is attending school and the other two remain at home because they are too young to work or enroll in school.

Mrs. D. is currently in grocery business. She would like a loan to expand and increase profits from her business. As the value of land is going up, Mrs. Morn D. would like to use profits from her grocery business to invest in a piece of land in order to re-sell in the future.

loans.use: Expand grocery business

loans.name: Etse

texts.fr:
Etse Z. is 32 years old, is married and a father of 2 children. He lives in Assahoun, a village located approximately 50 kilometers from Lomé, the Togolese capital. Etse has been a textile artisan for the past 3 years and this trade is his main source of income. With this second credit from FECECAV he would like buy strings necessary for the textile manufacturing and also to build his workshop.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Translator

Etse Z. est âgé de 32 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. Il réside à Assahoun, un village situé à environ 50 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Etse est tisserand depuis 3 ans et ce métier demeure sa principale source de revenu. Il désire par ce deuxième crédit de FECECAV améliorer la capacité de son activité en achetant des ficelles nécessaires à l’exécution de son activité et aussi procéder à l’aménagement de son atelier.

loans.use: To buy strings for his textile trade and to build his workshop

loans.name: Agness's Confidence Group

texts.en:
Agness is 45 years old. She is married with five children between the ages of 8 and 21. She has been a rice seller since 2008. Every day she works from 9am to 7pm at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $550 from her sales.

Agness has previously taken out a loan to expand her business. She is applying for a second loan to purchase more rice inventory. She will share this loan with her group member Magreth, who has a business dealing in clothes sales.

loans.use: To buy more rice for her business.

loans.name: Giovani

texts.es:
La Señora Giovanni, socia del Banco Comunal “Las Orquídeas”, vive en la región y provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes. Giovanni está creciendo poco a poco en el negocio, porque no tiene mucho tiempo en el negocio, apenas 1 año y le va bien. El negocio está ubicado en su propio domicilio en el Jr. Bolognesi Nº 1102, lugar donde acuden diariamente a comprar los clientes que son mayormente los vecinos de su  barrio.

Con este préstamo de S/. 800, el cual cancelará en 6 cuotas, comprará  productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar en saco, leche, aceite, conservas en cajas de diferentes tamaños, papel higiénico en paquetes y otros productos de mayor rotación y así surtir bien el negocio y que los clientes encuentren lo que buscan. 

Giovani vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos que aún están pequeños. Ella que a sus 28 años es una mujer trabajadora, carismática y con muchas ganas de seguir trabajando para crecer en el negocio porque le gusta lo que hace, también quiere darle una profesión a sus hijos. Su meta es crecer en el negocio y llegar a vender al por mayor.
texts.en:
Mrs. Giovanni, a member of the Communal Bank “Las Orquídeas," lives in the region and province of San Martín in the Tarapoto district. She sells groceries. Giovanni is growing little by little in her business, because she hasn’t been open for very long, barely 1 year and her business is going well. The business is located in her own home at Jr. Bolognesi Nº 1102, a place where her customers gather daily to shop as they are primarily her neighbors from her neighborhood. With this loan for S/. 800, which will be repaid in 6 payments, she will buy basic needs products such as rice, bagged sugar, milk, oil, different sizes of canned goods, packages of toilet paper, and other products that sell quickly and in this way stock her business well so that the customers find what they are looking for. Giovani lives with her husband and 2 small children. She is 28 years old, hard-working, charismatic, and with a great desire to continue working to grow her business because she like what she does, and she also wants to provide a profession to her children. Her goal is to grown the business and become a wholesaler.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic needs products such as rice, sugar, milk, oil, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To start a small business selling fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Assitan

texts.fr:
Conciliant ses études coraniques à une activité génératrice de revenu en l’occurrence la couture, Assitan est de nos jours un maître tailleur couturier confirmée et reconnue. Après dix ans d’expériences elle jouit d’une notoriété et d’une réputation sans égale dans la ville de Ségou. Elle est une femme divorcée de 35 ans qui vit dans la famille paternelle avec son enfant adoptif et plusieurs autres de ses parents dans le quartier Missira de la ville de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Après une formation en couture auprès de l’organisation non gouvernementale Mali Enjeux, elle décida d’ouvrir un atelier de coupe et de couture ou elle forme aujourd’hui une vingtaine de jeunes filles. Bien qu’elle ne soit pas une styliste reconnue toutes les dames de Ségou rêvent de porter les habits confectionnés dans l’atelier de Assitan D.. 
Pour agrandir son activité, elle fait recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Après 3 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) avec une association de son quartier, tous correctement bien remboursés elle est à son deuxième prêt individuel. Ce prêt servira à acheter, une machine à coudre supplémentaire pour son atelier. Cette machine permettra d’augmenter la production et de respecter les délais de livraison. Sa clientèle est composée d’hommes et de femmes de tout age.
Avec ce prêt, elle compte avoir un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui lui permettra d’agrandir son activité et de subvenir à ses propres dépenses et de son enfant adoptif (qui fut abandonné devant son atelier par sa mère biologique).
texts.en:
Reconciling her Koranic studies with income-generating work, in this case, sewing, Assitan is these days a confirmed and renown master seamstress. After ten years of experience, she enjoys unmatched fame and reputation in the city of Ségou. She is a 35-year-old divorced woman who lives in her father's house with her adopted child and several other relatives in the Missira district of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After getting training in sewing from the non-governmental organization Mali Enjeux, she decided to open a fashions workshop, where today she is training over twenty girls. Even though she is not a recognized stylist, all the women of Ségou dream of wearing clothing made in her workshop of Assitan D.. To expand her business, she is turning to the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. After three solidarity loans (group loans), all correctly repaid with an association in her district, she is on her second individual loan. This loan will serve to buy an added sewing machine for her shop. This machine will enable her to increase her production and to meet delivery deadlines. Her customers are composed of men and women of all ages. With this loan, she intends to make a monthly profit of 100,000 francs CFA that will allow her to expand her business and to cover her own expenses as well as those of her adopted child (who was abandoned in front of her shop by his biological mother).

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Clara

texts.en: Clara A. sells clothing. She has been in this business for many years. She is 47 years old and married with 4 children. Clara purchases her clothes from Lagos and Onitsha to sell in Benin City. With the festive period fast approaching, she hopes to increase her stock. She needs the loan amount of N40,000 to purchase more clothes to sell. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 19-year-old man who lives in Tyre, in southern Lebanon. Mohamad has owned a coffee shop since 2006. He sells coffee and other types of hot beverages and “narguileh,” also known as “shisha” in Egypt. 

The nargileh is an ancient tradition enjoyed by the people of the Middle East. A tall (or short) water pipe is used to smoke fruit-flavored tobacco. Nargileh is enjoyed in cafes across the Middle East, and is beginning to gain popularity in the U.S., Europe and other countries. 

Mohamad has requested a loan of $1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua to purchase a new coffee machine and some merchandise for his shop. This is the first time that Mohamad has requested a loan.

Mohamad's business is distinguished by its good quality, and he is known for his polite behavior toward his clients, who are friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he had a partner, but that relationship did not work well, so now he is on his own. He decided to do this business, because he wanted to work on his own. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: Mohamad needs the loan to purchase merchandise for his shop.

loans.name: Jardin De Rosas Group

texts.es: El grupo “Jardin de Rosas” se encuentra cursando su primer ciclo representado por la señora Nelcy ella al igual que sus compañeras residen en el mimo barrio de la ciudad de El Alto y se dedican a actividades comerciales de venta de ropa, zapatos, mantas artesanales en ferias de la ciudad. La competencia en el rubro comercial de prendas de vestir es muy fuerte por las importaciones de ropa de otros países, por lo que las socias requieren de materiales de primera calidad para poder competir en el mercado, es por esta situación que requieren el financiamiento de la Fundación Agrocapital para poder elabora con su apoyo productos de mas alta calidad y mejorar de esa forma sus ingresos para poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Los socios (as) tienen experiencia en grupos solidarios ya que participaron en otros grupos con anterioridad dentro de la misma Fundación, por lo que conocen la forma de trabajo y la puntualidad que se requiere para estar en un grupo bien conformado.
texts.en:
The "Rose Garden" group is in its first cycle represented by Nelcy, who lives in the same neighborhood in the city of El Alto as her fellow group members. They sell clothes, shoes, and handcrafted blankets at fairs around the city. Competition in the garment business is very strong because of the importing of clothing from other countries, therefore the members require high quality materials to compete in the marketplace. They need financing from Foundation Agrocapital to make high quality products and thus improve their incomes and give their families a better quality of life. The members have prior experience in supportive groups, as they have participated in other groups within the Foundation; they know the type of work and the time it takes to be a well-formed group.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to produce high quality clothing products.

loans.name: Mrs. Hun Seng Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank, which consists of twenty people, is located in Tropang Buon village in the Kampong Chhang province. Mrs. Hun S. is a village bank president who has been selected by the members. All the members will use the loan obtained for different purposes. For instance, Mrs. Hun S. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land and cultivates rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Nort PhS., is a firewood seller. Since Mr PhS.'s business is doing well, he would like to expand so Mrs. Hun S. has decided to ask for a loan to buy more firewood. Mrs. Hun S. is 44 years old and the mother of two children, one of wH. is a farmer while the other is attending the local school.

Fifteen members in this village bank loan are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase more firewood for her husband's business.

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
Dora vive en la calle Mundo de la zona Villa Exaltacion de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Vive junto a su  esposo el cual trabaja como mecánico en un taller de reparaciones automotrices, tiene  tres pequeños hijos.
 
Se dedica al comercio de ajíes, condimentos y tunta en su puesto de venta fijo ubicado en la zona de villa dolores.

El crédito lo destinara en la compra de mercadería al por mayor y así mejorar su margen de ganancias.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgar el crédito.
texts.en:
Dora lives on Mundo Street in the Villa Exaltacion neighborhood of the city of El Alto.

She lives with her husband, who works as a mechanic in an automotive repair shop. They have three young children.

She sells chili peppers, spices and tuntas (freeze-dried potatoes) for a living in her permanent stall, located in the Villa Dolores neighborhood.

The loan will be used to purchase wholesale goods so that she can increase her profits.

This is her first loan with Impro. Her credit check qualifies her for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chili peppers, spices and freeze-dried potatoes

loans.name: Sarvar

texts.en:
A. Sarvar is 35 years old, and married to Gafurov Askarali who is an entrepreneur. They live in their own house with the basic necessities. They have three children.

Sarvar has been the owner of a small general store for more than three years. She sells foodstuff for everyday use such as rice, flour, macaroni, soft drinks, sweets. etc. Sarvar runs her business from her home and her children help her. The motivation for requesting a loan is to be able to purchase more merchandise to stock the business. A larger selection of goods will attract more clients and generate a good monthly income to help her family. Support this woman who has much strength and courage to keep working.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and for it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after Tajikistan’s independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to increase the range of goods

loans.name: Juan Rene

texts.es: El Señor Juan Rene Gracia Cáceres tiene la edad de 46 años, su estado civil es soltero. Don Juan no tiene hijos. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es una pulpería. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio, y que ha logrado mantener con mucho esfuerzo y surgido por la necesidad de tener otros ingresos. Los propósitos de Juan son de obtener los ingresos necesarios para salir adelante. Es por este motivo que Juan solicita financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo y así aumentar en los productos de su pulpería como granos básicos, leche, refrescos naturales, pan y golosinas para que sus clientes no tengan que recurrir a la competencia. El deseo de Juan es poseer otro negocio y lograr adquirir la experiencia necesaria para mantenerlo.
texts.en:
Juan Rene G. Cáceres is 46 years old and single. Don Juan does not have any children. The business that he runs is a small grocery store. For over 4 years he has dedicated himself to this business, which he has been able to maintain with great effort, and which sprang from his need to have an extra source of income. Juan's resolution is to obtain the necessary income to be successful. It is on account of this resolution that Juan asks for funding to serve as capital for his work. With this funding, he would be able to buy more products to sell at his grocery store, such as simple grains, milk, sodas, juices, bread, and sweets, so that his customers do not turn to his competitors instead. Juan's wish is to own another business and to be able to acquire the necessary experience to maintain it.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Lealtad Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Lealtad, inicia su cuarto ciclo con 18 socias.
	
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. verduras, carne, artesanía, abarrotes en general, tubérculos, ropa, bebidas, leña.

Como es el caso D. Ana es conviviente tiene 42 años y 2 hijos, Ana tiene un puesto en el mercado F. Vivanco en donD. venD. carne, los animales los compra en las ferias y los beneficia en el camal, actividad que realiza con la ayuda D. su hijo.

Por otro lado Susana es casada, tiene 30 años y 2 hijos, integrante D. la junta directiva D. su Banco Comunal, Susana junto a su esposo son artesanos en piedra D. Huamanga, realizan tallados, sus artesanías los venD. en el mercado artesanal D. la ciudad. Además Susana venD. golosinas y leña en su casa.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles  haciendo un total D. 10,400 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. piedra D. huamanga, arroz, azucar, verduras, animales menores y ropa.

Los sueños D. las socias son que sus hijos sean profesionales, ampliar su negocio, sacar adelante a sus hijos y tener otras sucursales.
texts.en:
The community bank Lealtad (Loyalty) is beginning its fourth cycle with 18 associates. The members have various businesses such as sales of vegetables, meats, crafts, general groceries, root vegetables, clothing, beverages, firewood. In the case of Ana; she lives with her spouse and has two children. Ana has a stand in the F. Vivanco market where she sells meats. She buys the animals at markets and butchers them. Her son helps her with this. On the other hand, Susana is married, 30 years old and has 2 children. She is a member of the board of directors of her community bank. Susana and her husband are craftspeople, working with stone in Huamanga. They make sculptures and sell their works in the crafts market in the city. Additionally, Susana sells sweets and firewood out of her home. The members need differing amounts of credit, such as 300 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles, adding to a total loan of 10,400 soles for the community bank. Their loan proceeds will be invested in the purchase of stone from Huarnanga, rice, sugar, vegetables, small animals and clothing. The dreams of the members are to see their children become professionals, grow their businesses, move their children ahead and have other branches of their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of Huarnanga stoen, rice, sugar, vegetables, small animals and clothing.

loans.name: Richar

texts.es: Richar es un joven muy responsable y trabajador, tiene 21 años, es soltero y vive en cuarto alquilado, tiene muchas ganas de sobresalir en la vida y mejorar su futuro. Se gana la vida llevando clientes en la combi que maneja, junto a su inseparable amigo y cobrador, recorren las calles de la ciudad de Juliaca en busca de personas que deseen tomar la ruta número 12 para llegar a su destino. A Richar le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que puede recorrer las calles de la ciudad y distraerse, le gusta tanto conducir, que apenas cumplió la mayoría de edad, decidió ponerse a trabajar en una empresa de transportes y ya lleva 3 años en este negocio. Anhela tener algún día su propia combi y administrarla él mismo, considera que lo más difícil de su trabajo es permanecer todos los días sentado manejando, dejando de lado las cosas que desearía hacer, aun así, sigue trabajado todos los días sin descanso, en busca de alcanzar sus metas y está dispuesto a hacer todo lo posible para lograrlas. Es el segundo préstamo de Richar con MFP, y sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, en su banco comunal es muy responsable, ya que siendo uno de los pocos varones, no quiere quedar mal ante el resto de sus compañeras. Los mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita los aportará en el arreglo de la combi en la que trabaja, para así brindarles un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Richar is a very responsible and hardworking young man. He is 21 years old, is single, and lives in a rented room. He would really like to stand out in life and improve his future. He makes a living transporting clients in the minibus he drives. With his inseparable friend that collects money, he travels through the streets of Juliaca city in search of people that wish to take route number 12 to arrive at their destination. Richar really likes his work since he can travel through the city streets and enjoy himself. He likes to drive so much that as soon as he was old enough, he decided to put himself to work at a transportation company. He already has worked in this business for 3 years. He wishes to one day have his own minibus and to manage it himself. He believes the most difficult part of his work is to stay seated every day while driving, leaving behind the things he would like to do. Even so, he continues working every day without rest, in hopes of realizing his goals. He is ready to do everything possible to achieve his goals. This is Richar's second loan with MFP, and he knows that he has to pay all of his installments on time. In his community bank, he is very responsible. Since he is one of the few males, he does not want to look bad in front of the rest of his partners. The one-thousand five-hundred nuevos soles that he is asking for will support them [Richard and his friend] in fixing the minibus in which they work in order to offer a better service to their clients.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair the minibus that he uses for work

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy has been a taxi driver for 5 years, since a friend suggested the idea to her. She enjoys the scheduling freedom her job gives her. She is a single mother and the head of her family. She has 2 daughters, 24 and 18 years old. One daughter is finishing high school this year and the second one is attending college. 

She has had a total three loans through ACCION USA. The first two were to purchase cars and this last one was to repair the car and to pay for the insurance down payment. Taxi drivers generally have to pay their insurance in an annual lump sum. ACCION USA helped her to be able to drive her own car rather than renting one, which is expensive and as not profitable for the taxi driver.

loans.use: Car Insurance and some vehicle repairs

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina B. is forty-one years old. She is widowed and has given birth to six children: three daughters and three sons who are all still in school – senior high, junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region of Ghana.

Georgina is a trader, trading in jewelry such as earrings, necklaces, chains, rings, etc. She buys her goods from Kumasi. Georgina also deals in all kinds of ladies’ wear. She sells at the market square in her community. She also hawks (goes door-to-door) and treks to other markets to sell as well. Georgina has been in business for six years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy jewelry in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To grow corn

loans.name: Bilquis Muhammad Amen Group

texts.en:
Bilquis baji is the wife of M. A. who has been living in Chichawatni, Pakistan for the last 15 years. Her husband is a farmer by profession. He takes land on rent and grows vegetables on it. He grows seasonal vegetables, sells to the vegetable market and earns an income. Bilquis baji is applying for a loan to take land on rent to advance her husband’s vegetable business.

This loan consists of four additional people:

Majeedan baji wants a loan to buy mason tools. 
Sajida parveen baji and Arshad baji each want a loan to buy seasonal fruits to sell. 
Mumtaz baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. 
 
This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: “Bilquis baji is standing second from the right in this photo”.

loans.use: To buy land on rent for growing vegetables

loans.name: Mr. Khom Tuon Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank loan which consists of seventeen people is located in Serei Duoch village in Takeo province. Mr. Khom T. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. He is a cow middleman. His wife, Mrs. Uoch Sung, is a farmer who owns 2-hectar field of land to cultivate rice. In this plantation, she does not have enough money to expend on the rice field. Thus, Mr. Khom T. decided to ask for a loan to expend for plowing and to buy fertilizer to support the field. He is 37 years old and the father of four children, two of whom are enrolled in the local school while the others are too young to work or study. 

Four members in this group loans are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to expend for plowing and to buy fertilizer to support the field.

loans.name: Mathew

texts.en: Mathew A. T. is married and has three children. He has junior high school background.  Mathew sells fire wood, goes to the forest cuts old and weak threes and sells them at Brodiwrom near Sham-kedzi, which he has been doing since 2005. His wife is a farmer.  Mathew uses his income to pay school fees and utility bills.  Mathew will use the loan to finance his firewood business by purchasing equipments for to enhance the efficiency of his work. With the new profits from his expanded business, Mathew plans to save to educate his children to a higher educational level.

loans.use: Mathew will use the loan to finance his firewood business by purchasing equipments for to enhance the efficiency of his work.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa L. is from the city of Tinago Ozamis City. She is 46 years old. Marissa is married and has 10 adult-aged children. To make a living, Marissa owns & operates an agricultural business, raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Marissa has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2009, Marissa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marissa is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marissa from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it. About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Luisa Yessika

texts.es: Luisa Yessika S. Sánchez tiene 28 años de edad. Es una joven que ha sabido defenderse, en esta vida. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de cosméticos, con el tiempo es que decide dedicarse a la elaboración y venta de repostería. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio, ella ha logrado trabajar de muchas cosas ofreciendo muchos productos. Ella dio inicio a su negocio poco a poco por lo que logro recoger algo de ganancias e invertir en materia prima. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo que será utilizado para la compra de huevo, harina, mantequilla, leche, vainilla y otros productos. El deseo de esta joven es proporcionarle una educación digna a su hija.
texts.en:
Luisa Yessika S. Sánchez is 28 years old. She is a young woman who has learned how to take care of herself in life. Previously, she worked selling cosmetics, but over time she decided to dedicate herself to preparing and selling cakes and other baked goods. She has operated this business for more than 6 years and has succeeded in working in many different areas and offering a wide range of products. She built up her business gradually, saving the profits to make further investments in supplies. The loan she is currently requesting will provide working capital to purchase eggs, flour, butter, milk, vanilla and other ingredients. The desire of this young woman is to provide her daughter with a proper education.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Genith

texts.es:
Genith es una socia activa y perseverante, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali, tiene 31 años, es madre de tres hijos menores de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogos, su esposo es obrero. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Solteritas” desde hace dos años, ella empezó con un crédito de 300 soles que le permitió invertir en colonias y talcos para bebes.
Ahora necesita un crédito de 1500 soles que será invertido en la compra de productos de belleza como perfumes, cremas, talcos, y otros, para luego ser vendidos a sus clientes. La meta de Genith es llegar a tener un bazar bien surtido y salir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
Genith is an active and persevering businesswoman. She lives in the city of Pucallpa, located in the Ucayali region. She is 31 years old and has three young children. She sells beauty products through catalogs and her husband is a laborer. She has been affiliated with the communal bank, “Las Solteritas” (The Young Single Women) for the past two years. Her first loan was for 300 PEN (~$100 US) which she used to invest in colognes and baby powders. She needs a loan for 1,500 PEN ($525 US) which she will invest in other beauty products, such as perfumes, creams, talcs, and other products which she will sell to her customers. Genith’s goal is to have a good selection of products in order to advance her business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in beauty products for resale

loans.name: Makabe Group

texts.en:
Dotto Mohamed, age 30, is married with one daughter 10 years of age.  She has had a medical store since 2006 and works daily from 8am until 8pm. She is able to earn a monthly profit of around $96.

This will be Dotto’s 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her stock by buying more medicine and has paid back successfully. She hopes for a loan to still increase on her stock of medicine.
	
Dotto will share this loan with her loan group, Makabe, which totals 21 members. The members of the group help each other in paying back the loan.  In the picture, Dotto is 4th from the right in the front row behind the desk, wearing white with a white headscarf.

loans.use: Increase pharmarcy stock by buying more medicine

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La Señora Juana es socia del Banco Comunal “Azangarinas Valientes” del distrito y Provincia de Azangaro es casada y madre de 08 hijos, tiene 50 años de edad y viene trabajando con el Banco Comunal desde hace 03 años, estudió hasta el tercer grado de primaria.

Doña Juana se dedica a la venta de verduras, negocio que inició hace mas de 10 años, el cual lo desarrolla en un puesto que tiene en el mercado de Azangaro.

El primer préstamo que solicitó fue de S/. 500.00, el cual invirtió en la compra de mercadería  como: tomates, habas, zapallo y otros, los cuales expende todos los días.

Ahora requiere un crédito de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, el cual lo invertirá en la compra de  mas productos como: cebollas, tomates, coliflor, rocoto, para poder vender todos los días.

Su mayor sueño es  tener una tienda mayorista muy grande en su casa para poder vender con facilidad.

Lo que mas le gusta  su Banco Comunal son las charlas   que se dan en todas las reuniones
texts.en:
Juana, 50, has been a member of the “Azangarinas Valientes” communal bank, which is in the district and province of Azangaro for three years. She's married and has 8 children. She finished third grade. She has been a vegetable merchant for 10 years; she sells in a stall she has in the Azangaro market. Her first, 500 sol loan, was used to buy merchandise like: tomatoes, broad beans, pumpkin and others which she sells daily. Now she needs a 1000 new sol loan to buy more product like: onions, tomatoes, cauliflower, peppers to sell daily. Her greatest dream is to have a large wholesale store in her home in order to sell with ease. What she likes most about her communal bank are the chats that are imparted at the meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy onions, cauliflower, broad beans, tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: Karina Del Rocio

texts.es:
La señora Karina del Rocío, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Creativas”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia de Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 38 años y es madre de 03 hijos, los 03 que aun dependen de ella.

Lleva  03 años dedicándose a la confección de vestidos y fue por iniciativa propia quien decidió desarrollarse en este tipo de actividad y contando con un pequeño capital, no dudo en implementar su propio taller de costura, ubicada en su misma casa, un local muy bien acondicionado, para atender cordialmente a sus clientes que día a día, acuden a su taller para ser atendidos y es ella misma, quien  les recibe amablemente y con el carisma que siempre le ha caracterizado. 

En la actualidad, trabaja con pedidos de sus clientes anticipadamente, nos cuenta que le va muy bien. Una de sus metas por lograr es tener un taller  de alta costura e implementarlo con maquinas industriales modernas. Es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con la amabilidad y el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, comprará una maquina y una remalladora por que la que tiene ya no funciona bien, además si sobra el dinero comprará alfileres tijera y papel molde. 

Karina del Rocío, hoy en día se siente una mujer realizada, con  ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Ms. Karina del Rocio is a member of the Mujeres Creativas (Creative Women) Communal Bank in the Moyobamba district and province, department of San Martin. She is a 38-year-old married mother of 3 dependent children.

She has been making dresses for 3 years. She started this business on her own initiative. Once she had the capital, she started her own sewing workshop, which is a well-equipped space located in her home. There, she cordially attends to her customers day by day, welcoming them with the charm for which she has always been noted.

She currently works with special orders in advance, and she states that her business is prosperous. One of her future goals is to have her own haute couture workshop that is filled with cutting-edge industrial sewing machines.

With this 1,500.00 PEN loan, she will purchase a sewing machine and an overlock machine because the ones she currently has do not function properly. If she has any money left over, she will also purchase pins, scissors, and patterns.

Karina del Rocio feels like a fulfilled woman with the desire to realize the rest of her dreams. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her launch her business, and for helping so many women who wish to grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sewing supplies

loans.name: Niger Armando

texts.es: El señor Niger Armando T. G. tiene 45 años de edad vive en el Barrio Maria Auxiliadora es soltero y se dedica a la venta de mariscos tales como chacalines, camarones y ostiones etc...   Tras la muerte de su madre le ha costado el poder sentirse que sobrevive de manera independiente, en estos momentos el atraviesa una etapa de inseguridad hacia los negocios tras el fallecimiento de su mama es por esta razón que ahora desea realizar un cambio en su vida y obtener un crédito que le permita reinvertirlo en su negocio en  la compra de una mayor cantidad de mariscos que le favorezcan a su economía, espera que se le brinde un apoyo pues está decidido a trabajar duro para poder valerse por sí solo.
texts.en:
Niger Armando is 45 years old and lives in the Maria Auxiliadora neighborhood. He is single and sells seafood such as prawns, shrimp, oysters, etc... , He has had a hard time feeling self sufficient following his mother's death. Sometimes he can feel insecure about his business after his mother's passing, but is looking to change his life. He wants to get a loan to invest in his business by purchasing a greater amount of seafood in order to increase his income. He hopes he can receive your support since he has resolved to work hard to be self sufficient.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seafood to increase inventory

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia C. P. de 35 años de edad, reside en el departamento de San Salvador. Ella es madre soltera de cuatro hijos, todos menores de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Lucia es una mujer la cual trabaja de lunes a domingo en su propio negocio en el cual elabora y vende desayunos y almuerzos, y en las noches hace pupusas. Su ubicación es bastante buena ya que en el lugar en el que se encuentra transitas muchos empleados y estudiantes. Lucia solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar un horno, esto debido a que el que tiene en la actualidad no es de ella, y debe pagar mensual por su uso, es por ello que Lucia desea contar con uno propio. Lucia vela a diario por el bienestar de sus hijos y se esfuerza mucho por poder brindarles todo lo mejor, ya que son ellos el motor que hace que Lucia se esfuerce a diario por un mejor estilo de vida para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Lucia C. P., 35, lives in San Salvador department. She is a single mother of four, minor children, who are all in school. Lucia works seven days a week in her eatery where she sells breakfasts and lunches; in the evening she sells pupusas (maize dumpling). Her location is quite good because it has a lot of employees and students that pass by. Lucia is asking for funding to buy an oven because the one she currently uses is not hers and she must pay a monthly rental for its use so she would like to have her own. Lucia works every day to insure her children's well-being and makes an effort to provide them with the best since they are the motivating force for Lucia's daily efforts to improve her family's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy an oven.

loans.name: Justina

texts.en: Justina T. is from the village of Naawan, Misamis Oriental. She is 60 years old. Justina is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Justina sells balut, a boiled duck egg said to be nutritious and yummy to eat when paired with spiced vinegar and salt, in the local community. Justina has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Justina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Justina is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Justina from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Jazmines De Los Lagos Group

texts.es:
Este banco comunal es llamado “Jazmines de los lagos” y es conformado por 15 socios, pertenecientes a la población de Los lagos, ubicada en la ciudad de Angol, a una hora y media de Temuco. Ellos se dedican principalmente al comercio de frutas, venta de humitas, papas fritas, ropa, lencería, al trabajo de pintor (de casas, piezas, etc.), confección de vestuario y arreglos de bicicletas.

Viviana es la presidenta de este banco comunal, en la foto se ubica en la última fila a la izquierda y viste polera café. Ella hace confección y composturas de ropa y accesorios del hogar en su casa. Invertirá este préstamo en géneros, hilos, agujas y aceite para su máquina de cocer, para fabricar accesorios para el hogar, como por ejemplo juegos de baño y cortinas. Su sueño es tener un negocio en el centro de la ciudad, y su motivación es pagar sus estudios de trabajo social, que empezará este año. Para Viviana ha sido muy importante trabajar con Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha servido mucho la educación emprendedora que recibe y el trabajo en equipo para su desarrollo personal.

Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile) y posee una serie de balnearios lacustres y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
The “Jazmines de los lagos” (Lake Jasmines) Communal Bank consists of 15 members from the community of Los Lagos, located in the city of Angol, an hour and a half from Temuco. For the most part, the members sell fruit, humita (a type of corn cake), French fries, clothing, linens, but some of them paint (houses, rooms, etc.), make clothes, and repair bicycles. Viviana is president of this communal bank, and in the photo is in the last row to the left, wearing a brown t-shirt. She makes and alters garments and household furnishings. She will use this loan for fabric, thread, needles, and sewing-machine oil, to make furnishings, for example, bathroom sets and curtains. Her dream is to have a business in the center of town, motivated by the wish to cover the cost of studies in social work, which she will begin this year. Viviana has found her work with Fondo Esperanza to be significant, for its business education and team work have benefited her in her personal development. Temuco is the capital of the Araucania region. The city is located 670 km. south of Santiago (Chile’s capital), and offers lake resorts as well as interesting native flora and fauna. It should be mentioned that 50% of the country’s Mapuches (indigenous people) live in this region.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fabric, needles, thread, sewing-machine oil

loans.name: Los Tesoro Group

texts.en:
The Tesoro Group is a group of three woman entrepreneurs. This group is very familiar with ADIM and has participated in the development programs ADIM offers. The program focuses on gender differences, business development, and is intended to help entrepreneurs, especially female ones, to value themselves as business owners and to be very successful.

The coordinator of this group is Señora Deyanira D. C. M. M.. Two years ago, at the insistence of her son Charly, Deyanira began a video game arcade called “Club de Nintendo Charly”. When she began this business she only had one Nintendo; now, thanks to the loans with ADIM, she has three PlayStations and the business has grown a lot. She would like to have a more diverse array of gaming devices, but for now she will use this loan to buy one more PlayStation and to maintain those she has.

The other group members are Yaneth Sánchez Medieta and Flor de María Q. Sevilla. Yaneth sells lingerie and Flor makes and sells tortillas. Both of them will use this loan to buy merchandise and ingredients for their respective businesses.

loans.use: To buy another PlayStation gaming console and maintain the ones she already has

loans.name: 02.1.5 Nam Ngan Group

texts.en:
Thien H. T. is a 52 year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hoa.  Thien is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 02.1.5 Nam Ngan.


Thien is married and has 2 adult-aged children.  To making a living, Thien operates a family member's business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business.  WhiL. not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing construction services to local community members.  Thien has been engaged in this business for over 6 years and earns approximately 2.000.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2008, Thien joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Thien has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3.079.800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6.000.000 VND which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service.  The loan will be the 4th loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Thien plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  N. T. Huong (23) is a 48 year-old woman who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a manufacturing business.


2.  T. T. Minh (24) is a 51 year-old woman who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


3.  N. T. Tam (25) is a 33 year-old woman who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a bakery.


4.  L. T. Huyen (26) is a 50 year-old woman who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.


5.  N. T. Quyet (27) is a 52 year-old woman who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Thien H. T.  (22) là 52 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa.  Thien là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 02.02.1.5 Nam Ngan (02.02.1.5).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ xây dựng cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Thien thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 6 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Thien kiếm được khoảng 2.000.000 VND.  Vào 2008, Thien đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Thien đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3.079.800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua vật tư cần T.ết để cung cấp dịch vụ.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.000.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  N. T. Huong (23) là 48 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh sản xuất.


2.  T. T. Minh (24) là 51 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  N. T. Tam (25) là 33 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh lò bánh mì.


4.  L. T. Huyen (26) là 50 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


5.  N. T. Quyet (27) là 52 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Kalyanawathi

texts.en:
Kalyanawathi is a 53-year-old married woman living with her husband and two daughters. One daughter is an undergraduate at one of the universities in Sri Lanka. Kalyanawathi is an educated woman. Her husband has a wood carving business which Kalyanawathi supports. They started the business six years ago. The business started very small but now it has grown considerably. Kalyanawathi has a lot of experience in this field. She is a hardworking woman and very happy about her present family situation.  She handles the responsibility of managing a family very well.  

Additionally, Kalyanawathi is the secretary of this Village Organization – a group of about 40 women who form a village group within the BRAC organization. Kalyanawathi is seeking a 25,000 Sri Lankan rupee loan from BRAC to help expand the wood carving business. Ultimately she hopes to use her additional income to help pay for her children’s education.

loans.use: For a wood carving business

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane S. is the 26-year-old mother of a seven-month-old baby. She lives along with her husband and child in the house of her husband’s parents. Mary Jane dreams of having a house of their own where her family can have their privacy and enjoy their freedom. Her husband, who receives a small daily income as a hired baker, doesn’t make enough money at present to be able to afford construction of their own house. Moreover, she herself has no current source of income to augment her husband’s income. 

However, Mary Jane has a business plan. She would like to buy a fishing boat in order to start up a fishing business that can be regularly managed by her husband, who has fishing experience. She will take care of her child and help her husband sell their fish to people in their village, or in the market if the volume is large. To attain this goal, she joined ASHI and is now requesting a loan which will be used to purchase the fishing boat. Once their child has grown, Mary Jane would like to start her own business.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing boat

loans.name: Las Canelas Group

texts.es:
Florentina M. es integrante de la Asociación Comunal Las Canelas que a su vez pertenece al Centro Focal Panamericana, tiene 28 años y es vecina de la ciudad de El Alto, indica que ingresó a Pro Mujer a invitación de sus amigas.
 
Ella se dedica a  tejer mantas hace más de 10 años y con el préstamo tiene planificado comprar materia prima como la lana.

Las demás integrantes de esta  Asociación tienen actividades económicas como: venta de quinua, trenzado de mantas y venta de aguayos (tela colorida que se utiliza para cargar bebes).
 
Todas necesitan el préstamo para adquirir mercadería, insumos o materia prima, según el negocio que tengan.
texts.en:
Florentina M., 28, is a member of the Las Canelas communal bank which, in turn, is a member of the Panamericana focal center. She is from the city of El Alto and she tells us that her girlfriends invited her to join Pro Mujer. She has been a blanket weaver for over 10 years and she plans to use the requested funds to buy raw materials like wool. The other members of this communal bank are involved in a variety of commercial activities, such as: quinoa sales, blanket braiding, sale of “aguayos” (colorful cloths used to carry babies). They all need funds to acquire merchandise, ingredients or raw materials according to each type of business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw material (wool).

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina M., 32, is making sure that her family has adequate provision for their daily needs. She is married to Alvin M. and they are blessed with three children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been managing her own food, accessory and ready-to-wear clothing stall for quite some time now.

Marina has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings* and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times from CCT’s cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her accessory and clothing business.

To ensure the success of her business, Marina would like to apply for a PHP 11,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business by buying more quantities of accessories and clothing to be incorporated into her current product inventory and also by buying raw ingredients for her food stall.

Marina dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide a good, high quality education for her children.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more accessories and clothing to sell and fruit and raw ingredients for her food stall

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn A. is from the village of CAWA-CAWA. She is 27 years old. Jonalyn is married and has 1 infant-aged child. To make a living, Jonalyn owns & operates a butcher shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from butchering & selling a variety of meats in the local community. Jonalyn is just starting this business.

In 2006, Jonalyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jonalyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide her services. Jonalyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to start up her meat butchering business. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Jonalyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to start up a meat butchering business

loans.name: Cercio

texts.en:
Cercio L. is from the village of Salvacion, Kadingilan Bukidnon. He is 41 years old. Cercio is married and has 2 children. To make a living, Cercio owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing transportation services to local community members. Cercio has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Cercio joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cercio has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan went to repair his motorcycle used in the business. Cercio is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase a set of tires to continually provide service. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Cercio from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a set of tires

loans.name: Kafui

texts.fr: Kafui est une résidente du quartier d’agoè zongo, elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de charbons de bois, elle a près de 4 ans d’expérience dans ce commerce. Elle s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays dans la ville de bassar. Actuellement une partie de son stock est épuisée, elle voudrait se réapprovisionner raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de 40 sacs de charbons de bois et assurer le transport de la marchandise.
texts.en:
Kafui is a resident of the Agoè Zongo district and is married with two children. She has an income-generating activity selling charcoal, and she has nearly four years' experience in this trade. She gets her supplies inland in the town of Bassar. Her stock is currently low and she would like to get fresh supplies. For this reason she is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 40 sacks of charcoal and to cover the costs of transporting the merchandise.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of charcoal

loans.name: Merasol

texts.en:
Merasol C. is from the village of Dabong-dabong, Mailag, Valencia City, Bukidnon. She is 40 years old. Merasol is married and has one adult child. To make a living, Merasol owns & operates a business making curtains for local community members. Merasol has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Merasol joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merasol is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fabrics & materials. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Merasol from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics & materials

loans.name: Milta Cristina

texts.es:
Milta de 55 años, vive en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, rodeada de un estero salado), ella tiene una tienda variada. 

Ella comenzó con una vitrina vendiendo cuadernos y artículos para papelería, poco a poco fue surtiendo su local con víveres, hasta ahora que tiene una pequeña tienda surtida con víveres y papelería, trabaja sola todos los días. 

Para surtir mas su negocio ella quiere comprar productos de uso personal Yambal para poder vender en su tienda, como perfumes, cremas, desodorantes etc. En el futuro quiere tener mas grande su tienda y surtida.
texts.en:
Milta, 55, lives along Guayaquil’s beltway (a periurban area surrounded by a salty estuary). She owns a general store. She started out with just a display case selling notebooks and stationery items. Gradually she stocked up on foodstuffs and now has a small store that’s stocked with foodstuffs and stationery items. She works unassisted every day. To better stock her store she wants to buy Yambal brand personal use items like perfumes, creams, deodorants, etc. In the future, she’d like her store to be larger and better stocked.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For perfumes, creams and deodorants.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
This is Nenita G., 50, who lives in Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Ediom G. and they have five children ranging from a college whiz to an elementary-school youngster. By the grace of God, Nenita has managed to support her older child's college education. She is working hard to be able to send her children all the way through college. A dream for most Filipino parents like Nenita is a college education, as she herself has. She believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents can leave to their children.

Nenita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Juanita's profit comes from buying supplies wholesale and selling in piece rate. Aside from the usual products, Nenita also managed to incorporate meats and cooked food, like her popular lunch and dinner fare, into her business. Commuters, students, and people who don't cook at home, flock to her store to buy adobo (soy chicken or pork), menudo (liver and pork cutlets in a rich tomato sauce with carrots and potatoes), sisig (liver, ear, and other face meat of a pig, grilled then chopped and tossed in vinegar, chili and a little mayonnaise). Nenita’s store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She makes a minimum of Php3500 in sales every day.

Nenita is requesting a Php18,000 loan to buy more groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her inventory. She also will invest some of the loan to buy raw ingredients for her lunch and dinner fare. She expects to boost her income as she expands her business.
  
Nenita dreams of being able to give her children a high-quality education through all her hard work. She also hopes to have her own stall where she could sell her products someday. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to expand her inventory and to buy raw ingredients for her lunch and dinner fare

loans.name: Aqueliza

texts.es: Aqueliza, D. 54 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Florencio D. 50 años y sus 5 hijos menores, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad D. vida. Para Aqueliza las abejas es una fuente D. ingresos económicos, ya que gracias a la miel que ellas producen, pueD. llevar el dinero necesario para mantener a su familia, tiene 1 año en esta actividad y la miel que venD. es rápidamente comprada por sus clientes a quienes provee con este delicioso néctar. Ella Disfruta D. su trabajo, ya que cuando tiene hambre no duda en abrir unos D. sus recipientes D. plástico y saborear el producto que venD., pero lo que menos le gusta es tener que caminar tanto durante todo el día para vender su producto, aun así sabe que tiene que trabajar duro y espera poder abrir un negocio más estable. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo y se siente en la responsabilidad D. hacerlo, en su banco comunal es muy solidaria y preocupada. Con los quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, planea incrementar su capital D. trabajo y comprar más miel.
texts.en:
Aqueliza is 54 years old. She is a very unpretentious and hard working woman. She lives in her own home together with her husband Florencio, 50 years old, and their 5 young children. She wishes to proviD. them with a better quality of life. Aqueliza has an apiary and it is a source of income and thanks to the honey they produce she has been able to earn enough money to support the family. She has one year in the business. She sells the honey very quickly, a product highly sought out by her clients. She really enjoys her work especially because when she feels hungry all she needs to do is open one of the plastic recipients and eat her product. Her least favorite part is having to walk long distances to sell the product. She knows she has to work hard and one day be able to open a more stable business. This is her fourth loan through MFP (Kiva Field Partner). She is aware of the responsibilities of the loan and she is ready to fulfill them. She is a very attentive and involved member in her community bank. With the five hundred nuevos soles she requests she plans on supplementing her working capital to purchase more honey.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase honey.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Madres Trabajadoras”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Santiago, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Francisca; ella tiene 51 años de edad y es casada  y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  negocio de venta de verduras como tomate, cebolla, zanahorias, vainitas y lechuga, ella vende en el mercado llamado Huancaro desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, su esposo trabaja como chofer, la socia quiere tener un local donde pueda vender las verduras.  La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar toda clase de verduras al por mayor.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
A member of the community bank “Mujeres Trabajadores” (Working Mothers); The bank is located in the district of Santiago, in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

The member is Francisca. She is 51 years old, married and has 3 children. She alternates her daily activities with the sale of vegetables such as tomato, onion, carrots, peas and lettuce. She sells at the Huancaro market from 6:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m. Her husband works as a chauffeur. She wants to have a shop where she can sell her vegetables. The member asks for this loan to purchase all types of vegetables in bulk.

The member is grateful to everyone who makes up this dream and promises to complete the payments according to schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase all types of vegetables in bulk

loans.name: Hope Group

texts.es:
La señora Lorena P. Hernández, vive en Copainala Estado de Chiapas México, vive en unión libre con el señor Jesús Antonio López Velasco,  en la cual procrearon una hija de nombre zohe samanta  de dos años y cometa que es muy feliz en sus hogar ya que por ellos a decidido trabajar y salir adelante.

    Ella se dedica a vender catálogos de perfumes, labiales, desodorantes, maquillajes entre otros. Como también cortar cabello, poner uñas acrílicas en donde cometa que le va muy bien con esta dos actividades ya que obtiene buenos ingreso en  sus hogar. 
 
   Se inspiro en esta actividad por una compañera que la invito a vender catálogos para que  pueda aportar en la casa con los gastos pequeños en su familia, para así ganar su propio dinero y lograr pagar sus estudios de belleza.

   Con las ganancias que obtiene de sus actividades se surte con materiales  que le son útiles en su trabajo de belleza y su venta de catálogos. Para que con ello apoye a  su esposo a sostener su hogar y así los dos aporten y le den lo mejor a su hija.

   Su sueño es que pueda ahorrar para construir su casa y pueda vivir con su familia, como también tener su propia estética y así tenga más clientela y mejores ganancias en su hogar.

    Lorena formo el grupo con su hermana Guadalupe Nayeli y otras, vecinas   más  que se interesaron en el préstamo. El grupo se llama la esperanza, la razón del nombre es porque con el crédito que fundación realidad les otorga tiene la esperan lograr lo que desean y salir adelante.

   El grupo se integra de cinco señoras quien cada una tiene su respectiva actividad:

   Reinalada Días Hernández: invierte el préstamo en la copra de ingredientes para la elaboración de comidas como son: carne, chile ancho, aceite, queso, pasas, hojas de guineo para los tamales.
    Lorena P. Hernández: invierte el préstamo en la compra de cosméticos por catálogo como son: labiales, perfumes, desodorantes entre otros.
     María Neófita Sánchez A.: invierte el préstamo en la compra de cosméticos por catalogo como son: desodorante, esmaltes, perfumes, entre otros.
     Guadalupe Nayeli P. Hernández: invierte el préstamo en la compra de ingredientes como son: carnes,  tortilla, queso, verduras, para la elaboración de tacos fritos.
    María Magdalena C. O.: se dedica a la compra de frutas y legumbres, como son: chayote, papas, repollo, tomate, papaya, manzana, entre otro, para venderlo en la misma región.
texts.en:
Lorena P. H. lives in Copainala in the state of Chiapas in Mexico. She lives with her partner Jesus Antonio Lopez Velasco and together they have a daughter, Zohe Samantha; she is 2 years old. She is very happy with her home and it is for them that she decided to work. 

She sells catalogues of perfumes, lipsticks, deodorants, and makeup, among others. She is also a hair stylist and she also does acrylic nail work. These two businesses have been a good source of income for their home. 

She was inspired to start up this business from a colleague that invited her to sell catalogues to give her a source of income for her family, to earn her own money and to fund her way through beauty school.
