With the profits she earns from her businesses she stocks up of the merchandise she needs and to purchase more catalogues. This way she is able to contribute with her husband to maintain the household and to jointly provide their daughter with a better quality of life. 

Her dream is to save enough money to build a house where she will live with her family. She would also like to have her own spa and gain more clients and improve her profits. 

Lorena was a founding member of the group, together with her sister Guadalupe Nayeli and some neighbors. They got together to access a loan. 

The name of the group is "Hope" and the reason they chose the name is that with the loan they receive they hope to achieve their goals and find success. 

The group is made up of five other women and each has her own business: 

Reinalada Dias H.: she will invest her loan in the purchase of ingredients to made foods:  meats, chili peppers, cooking oil, cheese, raisins, banana leaves. 

Lorena P. H.: she will invest her loan in the purchase of cosmetics such as:  lipsticks, perfumes, deodorants etc. 

Maria Neofita S. A.: will invest her loan in the purchase of cosmetics such as deodorants, nail polish, perfumes, etc. 

Guadalupe Nayeli P. H.: will invest her loan in the purchase of ingredients such as: meats, tortillas, cheeses, and vegetables, to make deep fried tacos. 

Maria Magdalena C. O.: buys and sells fruits and vegetables, such as: Chayotes, potatoes, cabbage, tomatoes, papayas, apples, etc. She will resell in the same region.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics and perfumes.

loans.name: María Luzmila

texts.es:
La Señora. María C. es socia del banco comunal Mujeres de Trabajo, vive en la comunidad de Sagueo a 10 minutos de la ciudad de Azogues, esta ciudad se halla localizado en las suaves estribaciones y declives que en contraste a los encuentros de los diferentes ramales conforman gargantas y cañadas muy apretadas con fuertes inclinaciones y diferencias de nivel muy pronunciadas, siendo una ciudad muy hermosa y bella por su gente y su cultura.

Doña María se encuentra en su primer crédito que realiza en la banca comunal, fue invitada por una amiga quien es socia activa de la banca comunal. Se dedica a la venta de billetes de lotería hace 12 años, labora de 7 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde todos los días sin descansar uno solo, también se dedica a lustrar zapatos.
 
La Señora. María tiene 43 años, es casada y tiene 6 hijos de 25, 24, 20, 17, 10 y 7 años de edad, tres de sus hijos se dedican a trabajar y ayudar en la economía del hogar, su tercera hija estudia en la universidad y sus dos últimos hijos estudian en una escuela de la ciudad, con su trabajo han logrado construir una casita pequeña. Su esposo también se dedica a lustrar zapatos en la ciudad.

Su primer crédito lo va  a invertir en la compra de más billetes de lotería. Su meta es crecer en este negocio.
texts.en:
Maria C. is a member of the community bank named "Working Women". She lives in the downtown area in the city of Azogues. The city is located among the soft hills and valleys in an otherwise mountainous geography with pronounced cliffs and canyons. The city is a very beautiful city especially for its people and its culture. 

This is Maria's first loan through her community bank. She was originally invited to join by a friend, an active member of the group. She has been selling lottery tickets for the past 12 years, working 7 days a week until 5pm every day while never taking a day off. She also offers shoe shines. 

Maria is 43 years old, she is married and she has 6 children, aged 23, 24, 20, 17, 10 and 7 years. Three of her children work and contribute towards the household finances. Her third daughter is in university and the two youngest children attend a school in the city. Through her work she has managed to build a small house. Her husband also offers shoe shines in the city. 

She will invest her loan in the purchase of more lottery tickets. Her goal is to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase lottery tickets.

loans.name: Suyun's Group

texts.en:
Kyrgyzstan is actively seeking overseas partners to modernize its industry and introduce new technology. Foreign investments have become a significant advantage for the Kyrgyz economy. Recently, it has enacted a number of laws that protect investors’ rights. The most popular sectors for investments are natural resources, water and educational and cultural programs. Livestock has also attracted much attention recently. The quality of local meat is good, so it also has good chances for export. 

Suyun A., 51, is a butcher in a local meat pavilion in the town of Tokmok in the northern part of Kyrgyzstan. It’s been fifteen years since she made her first steps into the business, following the advice of her relatives. Suyun is married and has three grown children. Her husband contributes to the family budget by working as a private cab driver. He also manages to find the time and strength to help in the meat business.

Suyun hopes for this loan to be a success, because she’s planning to invest some funds in broadening her business and the assortment of meat for sale. The family plans to open its own small pavilion and save some capital to arrange a nice wedding for their son.

Kuluira J., 52, is also a resident of Tokmok. She is married and sells vegetables in a local market. The purpose of her loan is to purchase goods to diversify the assortment of products she sells. 

Nurjamal M., 47, is a butcher in a food market of Tokmok.  Her husband helps her out too. Nurjamal applied for this loan in order to be able to rent additional space for selling meat.

Kumush T., 34, has followed her mother’s steps in meat selling. She is married and applied for this loan to increase the assortment of goods she sells.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously).

MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase meat for resale

loans.name: Mayra Marlene

texts.es:
Mayra de 41 años, tiene una pequeña papelería muy variada con juguetes y ropa. Vive con sus dos hijos en una zona urbana llamada Guasmo y caracterizada porque la mayoría de sus habitantes son comerciantes. 

Comenzó con un pequeño capital para tener su propia papeleria y poder mantener a sus hijos ya que es madre soltera. Compro cuadernos, plumas, papelería y los comenzó a vender en un local. Trabaja desde las 06h30am hasta las 22h30pm en su papelería. Vende los juguetes a $ 5.00 en adelante, ropa segun sea la talla, cuadernos a $ 0.80 c/u.  

Con el préstamo quiere comprar juguetes, cuadernos, papelería. En el futuro quiere tener otra papelería y la que tiene ahora que sea la central de papelería mas surtida.
texts.en:
Mayra is 41 years old.  She has a small stationery store which sells a lot of different products including toys and clothes.  She lives with her two children in an urban area called Guasmo which is noted for the fact that most of its residents are salespeople.

She started out with a little bit of capital to obtain her own stationery store and be able to support her children since she is a single mother.  She bought exercise books, pens and stationery items and began selling them from a business premises.  She works from 6.30am to 10.30pm in her store.  She sells toys from $5.00 upwards, clothes according to size and exercise books for $0.80 each.

She will use her loan to buy toys, exercise books and stationery.  In the future, she would like to own another stationery store and for the one she has now to be the best-stocked stationery store.

loans.use: To buy toys and gift bags

loans.name: Lundaa

texts.en:
Lundaa H. is 68 years old and lives with his wife and adult son in the province of Hovd, Mongolia. He and his family live in their own ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent and fence. His son, age 19, currently attends university while both he and his wife are retired.  He is a talkative and open-minded person.  

Since 2006, Lundaa has been operating a business selling pure water. After working for the social insurance department of his province between 1996 and 2002, he started his own business in 2002, operating a grocery shop called "Guchingiin Gol", which he gave to his son-in-law in 2008.  In the future, he plans to expand his current business to the production of concrete blocks using well water. He is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to renovate the equipment for his water-selling business and purchase the necessary equipment and tools for starting his concrete business.

loans.use: to start a business producing concrete blocks from well water

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo P. is from the village of Benito, Soliven, Isabela. He is 24 years old and single. To make a living, Alfredo raises crops. His main source of income is from planting and harvesting corn for sale. Alfredo has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 32000 PHP per harvest.

In 2010, Alfredo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services. Alfredo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Alfredo is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be his second loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Odelio's Group

texts.en:
Odelio A. is from the village of Brgy. Lantap, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 42 years old. Odelio is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Odelio is single. To make a living, Odelio owns & operates a business preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Odelio has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Odelio joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Odelio has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Odelio is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Odelio from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Manuel B. is from the village of Tabuan, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. He is 55 years old and married. To make a living, Manuel owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over four years and earns approximately $68 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Manuel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand his product offering. 

Manuel is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be his 2nd loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand his business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Kamel

texts.ar:
كامل في عمر 43 سنة يعمل في دهان السيارات + حدادتها له في عمله 25 سنة متزوج وله 5 اولاد يحب عائلته وعمله اولى اهتمامه
يسعى دائما وراء لقمة العيش ودعم عائلته وتحسين وضعها المادي والاجتماعي يريد دائما التطور والتجديد في العمل له تاريخ
جيد مع المجموعة حيث كان يلقى دعم كبير من عائلته وساهم في تحسين وضع عمله يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة الى شراء عدة للعمل + بضائع جديدة
texts.en: Kamel, 43, is married with 5 children. He has been working in the autobody repair and painting business for 25 years. He loves his family and cares a lot about his work. Kamel always works hard to earn his living, support his family and improve its sociA. and financiA. conditions. Kamel has a good credit history with A. Majmoua. He was fully supported by his family during his previous loan cycle. His previous loan helped him improve his business. Kamel always seeks to improve his working conditions. He wants to get a loan from A. Majmoua to buy tools for his work and new goods.

loans.use: To buy new tools for work and new goods

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 26 years old and has three children aged 11, 7, and four months. She is a member of the communal bank "Kausachun", and has been a member of FINCA for two years now, after being invited by her cousin. 

She has been involved in the production of bricks for many years, and sells them in Ayacucho. She plans to use her loan of 1,250 PEN to buy more land to expand her brick production business.

loans.use: To buy land for brick production

loans.name: Laura Concepción

texts.es: Laura Concepción M. D. P. D. 51 años D. edad, resiD. en el  municipio D. Armenia, en el departamento D. Sonsonate, ella es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora, la cual se dedica a su propio negocio, el cual está ubicado en su casa D. habitación, mismo lugar en el que vive junto a su esposo. La señora Laura posee una panadería, en la cual se dedica a trabajar desD. hace 16 años atrás, es por esta razón que ella es muy conocida en la zona ya que siempre ha sido una mujer muy trabajadora la cual entrega todos los pedidos a tiempo y que cuenta con muy buenos estándares D. calidad. Laura solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar harina, manteca, miel, azúcar y otros ingredientes más, los cuales son necesarios para la elaboración del pan. Laura trabaja arduamente día con día para poder contar con una mejor estabilidad económica junto a su esposo, y así también poder mejorar el negocio, el cual ha sido muy rentable para ella.
texts.en:
Laura Concepción M. D. P. is 51 years old and lives in the town of Armenia, in Sonsonate department.  She is a very responsible and hard-working person who owns her own business.  Her business is located in her home where she lives with her husband.

Laura has a bakery that she has run for 16 years.  She is very well known in her area since she is a hard-working woman who delivers all her orders on time and who makes her goods to very high-quality standards.

Laura is requesting a loan to buy flour, butter, honey, sugar and other ingredients that she needs to make her bread.  Laura works hard every day to proviD. herself and her husband with better financial stability and to improve her business which has been very profitable for her.

loans.use: To buy flour, butter and other ingredients for making bread

loans.name: Sreyrath

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreyrath E. (shown in the photo) is 31 years old and her husband, Mr. Vanna Say, is 30 years old. They live in a village off of National Road Number Two, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2000 and have two young children: one son and one daughter.

Sreyrath and her husband are garment factory workers. She is applying for her first loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Sem Y. has been earning her daily income by planting rice on her own farmland which she inherited from her grandparent many years ago. She has a life partner in her husband who is a classical music Khmer player. He earns money by providing Khmer music for wedding parties and other ceremonies. 

They have six children: five are single, and one is married. One of Sem Y.'s children sells food for people who come to visit Teuk Char. Sem Y. will use her loan to help her daughter buy more cooking ingredients to make food to sell. Sem Y. and her husband appear in the photograph.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for food production

loans.name: Gia

texts.en:
Gia N. is 42 years old. He lives in the village of Tsiskhisdziri in the Kartli Region. Gia is married and lives with his wife Lena, two children (8- and 6-year-old boys) and mother. The children go to school. 

The main income of the family comes from Gia’s business, which is a beer pub he started seven years ago. The pub is located in the same village and he works there intensively in the summer and fall period. Now as the season starts, Gia requested credit to purchase beer and other inventories to re-start the pub.

Along with the pub, the family is busy with a dairy farm. They have two milk cows and sell dairy products locally. Lena is in charge of dairy activities, though Gia helps her as well.

Gia hopes that he will have a successful and profitable season. He plans to reinvest the profit in further expansion of both businesses: the beer pub and dairy farm.

loans.use: to purchase beer and other inventories for his pub

loans.name: Mourine

texts.en:
Mourine K. is a single mother of three children who attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past year, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. During the hot summer season, the availability of ground nuts for sale is lower and demand is higher. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the KES 10,000 she is requesting, she wants to purchase sacks of ground nuts for sale.

She dreams of accessing bigger loans and expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of ground nuts for sale.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is from the village of Guinitan, Pagalungan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 35 years old. Cristina is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) shop, selling rice per kilogram, sardines, shampoo, soap and beverages in the local community. Cristina has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $75 a month for these activities.

In 2011, Cristina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase an additional sack of rice, junk foods and canned goods. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase an additional sack of rice, junk foods and canned goods.

location.town: Guinitan, Pagalungan, Cagayan de Oro City

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is an entrepreneur from Talibon, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store business. She sells items like canned sardines and tuna, detergent, soap and soft drinks to the people in her community. Belinda works hard to improve her business and support her family.

Belinda's loan will be used to buy more items to sell such as soft drinks, rice and canned goods. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as soft drinks, rice and canned goods.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a 43-year-old married woman and mother of two children.  Since 2002, she has sold cosmetics and makeup for a living.  Amal helps her husband earn the family income and cover most of their expenses. She requests a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to pay for her children's school fees. 

Amal has borrowed from Al Majmoua for three consecutive cycles.  The organization has helped her to improve her business and family's social and financial situation.  Her main aim is for her children's education and health and she tries her best to work to meet their needs.  Amal hopes to expand her business and open a shop instead of visiting clients homes.

loans.use: To pay for her children's school expenses

loans.name: Mawoussi

texts.fr: Revendeuse de charbon de bois à son domicile, MAWOUSSI  est mariée et a 02 enfants. Elle veut assurer un avenir meilleur à ses enfants et sollicite ce prêt pour acheter de la marchandise à KARA. Elle a démarré en 2004 et est à son premier cycle de prêt. Son mari est mécanicien auto.
texts.en: Mawoussi sells charcoal out of her home. She is married with two children. She would like to ensure a better future for her children and is seeking this loan to stock up in Karra. She launched this business in 2004, and is on her first loan. Her husband is an auto mechanic.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Tirso

texts.en:
Tirso is 49 years old, married, and lives with his family in San Antonio, Ilagan, Isabela. His wife is a domestic helper. Tirso and his three grown children help each other to manage their farm in order to save money for their future.

Tirso is a farmer who grows rice and corn. He also owns a mini store. He makes his purchases at Ilagan market and makes his sales in the community.

Tirso is requesting a loan of 14,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to purchase fertilizer and pesticides for his farm. The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs. His dream is for his family to have their own house and lot.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticides for his farm.

loans.name: Rio Vilcanota Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “RIO VILCANOTA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito D. Calca, perteneciente a la provincia D. Calca y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Concepción; ella es casada y tiene 72 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja con su negocio D. restaurant, ella prepara desayunos, almuerzos y cenas, prepara también platos como pollo al horno, saltado D. carne y sopas, también venD. cervezas y gaseosas, la socia trabaja desD. las 7:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio D. este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio D. restaurant. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, pollo, carne y verduras y también para comprar gaseosas y cervezas al por mayor. 


Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio D. venta D. artesanía, negocio D. venta D. cds, negocio D. venta D. tienda D. abarrotes, negocio D. venta D. platería.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte D. este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The loan recipients belong to the village bank "Rio Vilcanota". The bank is located in the district of Calca, which is in the province of Calca and the state of Cusco.

Concepcion, 72, is married and has one son. She works in a restaurant preparing breakfasts, lunches and dinners. She also makes plates like roasted chicken, beef saltado and soups. She sells beers and sodas. She works from 7:00am until 7:00pm, and through this business she has helped her son to get ahead. She wants to grow and improve the restaurants. She requested a loan to buy ingredients like rice, chicken, meet and vegetables, as well as sodas and beer in bulk.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients like rice, chicken, meat and vegetables as well as sodas and beers in bulk.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 24 years old, married and has one child.

Alaa has been a tailor since 2003. He makes and repairs men's, women's and kids' clothing. He has a long experience in this field and has a deep understanding of local consumer and he is becoming well known in his area.


He decided to apply for a $1200 loan in order to buy a tailoring machine and a split air conditioner. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to buy a tailoring machine and a split air conditioner.

loans.name: Patricia Del Pilar

texts.es:
Patricia tiene 34 años vive en Pujilí cerca de latacunga, vive con sus hijos y con su familia; sus hijos tienen 8 y 10 años de edad. Patricia se describe como una persona alegre y con mucha responsabilidad.

Trabaja en la crianza de cerdos y en la cocecha de chochos junto con su familia. Es la primera vez que trabaja con Fodemi, el crédito que solicita es para la compra de cerdos con esta compra podrá incrementar su negocio.

Su sueño es tener mas cerdos para incrementar considerablemente su negocio y así poder incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Patricia is 34 years old and lives in Pujilí, which is near Latacunga. She lives with her children and her family. Her children are ages 8 and 10. Patricia describes herself as a cheerful person with many responsibilities.

She raises pigs and harvests lupin beans with her family. This is the first time she has worked with FODEMI. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy pigs so that she can increase her business.

Her dream is to have more pigs so that she can considerably increase her business, as well as improve her income and her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Alexandra Elizabeth

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

En este lugar vive la señora Alexandra, tiene 25 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 7, 4 y 1 años de edad, el mayor estudia en escuela. El marido es albañil. Para ella este es su tercer ciclo  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son de gran ayuda.

Es una gran ama de casa que además de cuidar su hogar y sus pequeños hijos también se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y trabaja tres días a la semana y esto lo hace por las tardes cuando su esposo está en casa y cuida de sus pequeños,  sus  productos los deja a crédito y cobra cada fin de semana, lleva con su negocio un año y empezó con el primer crédito que recibió del banco.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia ya que vive en casa de los suegros.

En la fotografía está nuestra socia con su pequeño hijo.
texts.en:
Maria Auxiliadora Community Bank meeds in the La Sequita parish, which is part of Montecristi, a prosperous area in Manabi province. Montecristi is full of hard-working people who are proud of their heritage. People who live in La Sequita are honest, industrious, and care for their families. 

Alexandra lives in this area. She is 25 years old, in a common law relationship, and has three children, ages 7, 4 and 1. Her eldest is in school, and her partner is a mason. This is Alexandra's third term with the Auxiliadora Community Bank, which she likes because the loans she has received have been a big help.  

Alexandra is a wonderful homemaker who not only cares for her residence and her children, but also sells all kinds of clothing. Her business is door-to-door, and she works three days a week. She only works in the evenings, when her partner is home to watch the kids. She takes orders on credit and collects payments every weekend. Alexandra has been running her business for one year, beginning with the first loan she received from her community bank. 

She will use this new loan to buy more merchandise, including pants, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothing.  

Her dream is to own her own home, because she currently lives with her in-laws. 

In the photograph, our new member is holding her youngest son.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothing.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
La señora Patricia esta agradecida por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual pudo comprar otro vehiculo para la venta de tacos por la mañana y con el cual contrato a otra señora para que le ayude a vender en diferentes partes de la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder invertir en comprar mas mercancía que, dulces, chicharrones, tostadas con chile, refrescos y raspados de sabores (helo molido con jarabe de sabores de frutas), y acondicionar el vehiculo para la temporada de invierno. 
Espera contar con su cooperación en este crédito ya que desea mejorar su negocio y así tener más ingresos para la familia, con el cual planea pagar el crédito.
texts.en:
Patricia is grateful for your cooperation on her previous loan which helped her to buy a vehicle to sell tacos in the mornings and to hire another woman to help her sell in different parts of the city of Nuevo Laredo. 

She is asking for a loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise like sweets, pork rinds, chili tostadas, sodas and flavored shaved ice (ground ice with fruit-flavored syrups), and to do maintenance on the vehicle for winter. 

She hopes to have your cooperation on this loan since she wants to improve her business and have more income for her family, which she will use to pay back the loan.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and do maintenance on her sales vehicle.

loans.name: Alegria Group

texts.es:
El comité “Alegria” tiene 1 año de formación y trabajo con la Fundación Paraguaya, todas las miembros son vecinas y amigas de esa ciudad. Ellas anhelan un futuro mejor para sus hijos es por eso que se esfuerzan el doble para facilitarles los materiales para su desarrollo y formación.
La señora Faustina es modista, se desempeña en este oficio hace ya un buen tiempo, comenta que ella realiza muy buenos trabajos, por lo cual personas del barrio y zonas aledañas acuden hasta ella para hacerle pedidos de costuras o acercarle otro tipo de trabajo. Ella dice que gracias a este trabajo y al sacrificio diario ella logra mantener a su familia y cubrir los gastos diarios.
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de telas, hilos y demás insumos necesarios para su taller de costura. Está muy agradecida con la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da, a ella y a todo su grupo.
texts.en:
The “Alegria” committee was formed a year ago and works with Fundación Paraguaya.  All the member are neighbors and friends from this city.  They crave a better future for their children, which is why they are working with doubled efforts to put in place what they need for their development and training.

Señora Faustina is a dressmaker.  She has been working in this trade for quite a while, and comments that she does very good work, so that people from the neighborhood and the surrounding neighborhoods come to her with their orders for sewing or bringing her other types of work.  She say that thanks to this work and her daily self-sacrifice, she has been able to support her family and cover her daily expenses.

She is requesting the loan to buy fabric, thread, and other necessary supplies for her sewing workshop.  She is very grateful to the Fundación for the opportunity they are giving, both to her and to the whole group.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread and other supplies.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 34 years old, married and has five children.  

To earn a living, he makes metallic doors, gates and window frames. He has been in the business for ten years. He works hard in his business so as to provide for his family. His desire is to have a well established business within five years.

Richard has requested 100,000 KES to buy a welding machine.

loans.use: To buy a welding machine.

loans.name: Rahmatkhoja

texts.ru: Рахматходжа женат имеет троих детей. На протяжении 11 лет занимается обувным ремеслом. Он привозит обувные материалы, кожу и меха. Занимается обработкой и ручным пошивом обуви. Он хочет получить займ для закупа искусственного меха для пошива к зиме зимних сапог, маcхи (национальная обувь). Он надеется получить займ и увеличить объем производства обуви к зиме.
texts.en: Rahmatkhoja is married and has three children.  He has been involved in shoe repair for 11 years.  He brings in shoe materials, leather and fur.  He is involved in treating and hand-sewing shoes.  Rahmatkhoja wants to obtain this loan for the purchase of faux fur for sewing winter boots, maskhi (national shoes), for the winter season.  He hopes to get this loan and increase the volume of shoe production for the winter.

loans.use: to purchase faux fur for sewing winter boots for the winter season

loans.name: Karol Nohemy

texts.es:
La señora Karol tiene 30 años, vive en unión libre con su esposo, tiene 2 hijos, reside en una comunidad rural de Piladeros en el Municipio de Nueva Frontera departamento de Santa Barbara.
Su actividad económica que le genera ingresos para su familia, es una pequeña pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica (arroz, frijoles, harina de trigo y de maíz, huevos) y productos de higiene.
Su negocio lo inicio con recursos propios y posteriormente ha tenido la oportunidad de administrar varios créditos, lo cual le ha permitido sostener su negocio y su  familia. 
Considera como principales dificultades por enfrentar, los altos precios de los productos alimenticios y las  pocas ventas en algunas temporadas del año.
En la actualidad ha solicitado un préstamo de L.17,000.00 ,  el que invertirá en la compra de productos alimenticios, productos para el aseo y medicinas.
Su meta es ofrecer más variedad de productos a sus clientes, aumentar su negocio y  ahorrar para el futuro de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Karol is 30 years old and in a common-law-marriage.  She lives with her husband and two children in a rural community of Piladeros in the Nueva Frontera municipality, Santa Barbara department.

Her business activity, which generates income for the family, is a small grocery store.  She sells basic needs products (rice, beans, wheat and corn flour, and eggs) and hygiene products.  She started her business with her own resources.  Later, she had the opportunity to manage several loans,  This has allowed her to maintain her business and her family.

She considers the main difficulties she faces to be the high prices of food products and the low sales in some seasons of the year.  

She has currently requested a loan for 17,000 lempiras to buy food products, hygiene products, and medicines.  Her goals are to offer a greater variety of products to her customers, to increase her business, and to save for her children’s future.

loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es: La señora Virginia tiene una movilidad que la usa como taxi y contrata a un chofer de reemplazo para que maneje la movilidad; su esposo es policia. El crédito lo requiere para la el mantenimiento de su movilidad, chequeo de fluidos, frenos, llantas y motor, pues es  la fuente de ingresos que tiene para ayudar al esposo a cubrir los gastos familiares. Vive en  casa en propia la misma queda  ubicada en la zona de Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz; es casada y tiene cuatro hijos. Es la segunda vez que el cliente obtiene un crédito en IMPRO y también la segunda a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Sra. Virginia owns an automobile that is used as a taxi, so she hires a driver to operate the vehicle. Her husband is a police officer. The loan she is requesting will be used for vehicle maintenance, as well as to have the fluids, brakes, tires, and engine checked. This vehicle provides a source of income that enables her to help her husband with covering the family expenses. Virginia lives in her own home in the District of Llojeta in the city of La Paz. She is married and has four children.

This is the second time Virginia has obtained a loan from IMPRO, as well as the second time through Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen Rosa nació en la  ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. Carmen Rosa tiene 38 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos. Carmen Rosa desarrolla sus actividades cotidianas y económicas en la ciudad del Cusco.   

Carmen Rosa se dedica a la venta de libros de forma ambulatoria, ella trabaja desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde de lunes y sábados. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias a al empeño que pone en su trabajo.

Carmen Rosa pertenece al banco comunal “Ñahupacman Purisun” de la Asociación  Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Carmen Rosa requiere el préstamo para comprar libros y revistas. 

Carmen Rosa se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Carmen Rosa was born in the city of Cusco and lives in the same city where she was born.  She is 38 years old and has a common-law relationship from which she has three children.  Carmen Rosa carries out her daily and business activities in the city of Cusco.

Carmen Rosa works selling books as a street vendor.  She works from 9 in the morning until 6 in the afternoon from Monday through Saturday.  She has been working in this business for several years now, and it is going very well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her work.

Carmen Rosa belongs to Ñahupacman Purisun Communal Bank, of Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco.  She needs the loan to buy books and magazines.

Carmen Rosa is grateful for the opportunity offered by this loan, and she also is committed to making her payments according to the schedule.

loans.use: to buy books and magazines.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
At his busy grocery store, 34-year-old Fred sells a variety of foodstuffs in addition to fruits and green vegetables. He practices this trade from Ntungamo. This steadfast father of one has ready supplies of food, week in and week out. This means he is inundated by high demand. His business has been riding high on success with a growing clientele base, month in and month out, and he anticipates better fortunes in the future.

Prior to taking root in this business, Fred was mostly inclined to teaching. He still teaches, though the low remuneration was and is still something he looks at with contempt.

On the side, he also banks on side profits from a retail shop.

Fred says he intends to use his loan money to purchase more foodstuffs such as pineapples, grapes, maize flour, rice, watermelon, etc. to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more foodstuffs such as pineapples, grapes, maize flour, rice, watermelon, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es: El señor Pedro Pablo a sus 46 años de edad es padre de un hijo de 11 años, debido a dificultades personales tuvo que separarse de la madre de su hijo, por lo cual esta solo con la responsabilidad de su familia. El señor Pedro Pablo es propietario de un taller de bicicletas desde hace más de tres años, el cual aprendió como herencia familiar. El señor Pedro Pablo requiere de la compra de repuestos de bicicletas que le permitan tener surtido para suplir la demanda de sus clientes y así mejorar sus ingresos y la calidad de vida de su familia. El sueño del señor Pedro Pablo es poder ampliar su negocio y brindarle a su hijo una buena educación.
texts.en: Mr. Pedro Pablo, 46, has an eleven year old son. Due to personal difficulties, he is separated from the mother of his son, and is now the only one responsible for his family. Pedro Pablo has owned a bicycle shop for more than three years, a trade he learned from his family. Pedro Pablo needs to purchase bicycle parts that will allow him to have an assortment of inventory to supply the demand of his customers and thus increase his income and improve his family's quality of life. Pedro Pablo's dream is to grow his business and ensure that his child has a good education.

loans.use: to buy bike parts.

loans.name: Ana Del Carmen

texts.es: Ana del Carmen de treinta y nueve años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus hijos. Ella posee una librería y papelería donde vende cuadernos, libros, lapiceros, papeles entre otros, es muy conocida en la localidad pues en su negocio las personas siempre encuentran lo que necesitan con productos de excelente calidad y a precios accesibles además de un muy buen servicio; Ana es una mujer entregada a su labor siempre dispuesta a superarse, le gusta estar adelante de la competencia y como empieza la temporada escolar quiere aprovecharla al máximo, ella piensa que la perseverancia la llevara a tener un futuro mejor, lleno de grandes éxitos, es así como se ha decidido a decidido a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar libros, cuadernos, papel, lápices etc. Ana del Carmen tiene la esperanza que de esta forma podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Ana del Carmen, 39, lives with her life companion and their children.  She has a bookstore/stationery shop where she sells notebooks, books, mechanical pencils and paper, among others.  She is very well known in her location because people always find what they are looking for in her store and they are quality products at affordable prices besides very good service.

Ana is a woman who is dedicated to her work and is always ready to get ahead; she likes to stay ahead of the competition and since the school term is about to start she wants to take advantage of it to the maximum degree.  She believes that perseverance will bring her to having a better future that’s full of successes.  This is how she’s come to request a loan from Integral to buy books, notebooks, paper, pencils, etc.  Ana del Carmen hopes to bring economic security to her home this way.

loans.use: to buy books, notebooks, paper and pencils.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes es una emprendedora luchadora que ha salido adelante con mucho esfuerzo ha emprendido este negocio de la pulpería pero además a innovado nuevas líneas de productos como venta de mercadería en general y desinfectante para piso, lo cual ella nos expresa que gracias al financiamiento ha aumentado su mercadería ofreciéndole a sus cliente variedad de producto. Actualmente está solicitando financiamiento para invertir en el negocio en la compra de granos básicos, aceite, jabón, verduras, detergentes entre otros productos.
texts.en: Mercedes is a tenacious entrepreneur who has gotten ahead in life with many efforts. She has opened her grocery store, and on top of this she has also introduced new lines of activities such as selling general products and disinfectants for apartments. She told us that thanks to the previous loan she has bought more products, thus offering her customers a wider variety of items. She is currently requesting a loan to invest it in her activity by buying basic grains, oil, ham, vegetables and detergents among other products.

loans.use: basic grains, oil, ham, vegetables and detergents.

loans.name: Abdurahman

texts.en:
Abdurahaman is 57 years, married and blessed with 6 children. He has a food stall which he has been running for 11 years.

This is his fifth loan term with VisionFund Kenya and he successfully repaid his previous loans. He will use the loan to buy milk,sugar, maize and beans for use in his hotel so as to serve more customers and get more income to support his family. He will use the anticipated profit to educate his children. He future hopes and dreams are to expand his business and be successful.

loans.use: To buy milk,sugar, maize and beans for use in his hotel so as to serve more customers and get more income to support his family.

loans.name: Forzia

texts.en: Forzia is 38 years old and a mother of 5. She operates a chop bar in the Central Business District of the city. Recently, she acqiured a larger store where she currently operates her business. Having benefited from the TEACH sessions of KRABAN SUPPORT FOUNDATION she is putting together a business plan to help grow the business. She is therefore seeking assistance from KIVA to procure bigger cooking utensils to meet the higher demand.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is 34 years old and a mother of 4 children. She had education up to the basic level.S he followed up with a vocation in dressmaking and came out as a qualified seamstress 3 years later. She currently runs her own shop in her community and plans to engage apprentices who want to train as well. She therefore wants the KIVA loan to purchase 4 additional sewing machines so as to be able to get contracts from schools and organisations.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Sun

texts.en: Mrs. Sun B. lives in Kampong Cham with her husband and their 9 children.  Four of the children work at a garment factory, and the other five are still in school.  Sun B. sells snacks and drinks near a local school during the day.  She earns about $2.50/day at this job.  This loan will be used for Sun B. to purchase some hairdressing tools so she can open a hair salon.  She thinks that this business will give her more profits than her foodstall.  In the future, she would like to open one more business growing rubber trees.  If both ventures are successful, she will be able to send her children to university in the city.

loans.use: To purchase hairdressing tools because she would like to open a hair salon

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Mr. Paul E. is a farmer who specializes in the production of fish and turkeys for sale to his community. He is 52 years old, married, and blessed with four children. Paul needs a loan of $1,175 to buy more fingerlings and feed for the fish he farms. He has been in the farming business since 1994.

loans.use: To buy more fingerlings (little fish) to raise and fish feed

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Mrs. Heng N., 46, is a farmer who earns $1 per day. Her husband, 66, earns $2 per day as a village chief. The couple has 6 children. One of their children is a student and three of the others work in a garment factory earning $80 per month each.

Mrs. Heng N. would like to borrow $500 to finance the purchase of a motorcycle for her family’s transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her family's transportation.

loans.name: Eusebia Gertrudis

texts.es:
The dream of these proud parents, Eusebia and Luis, is to provide the best for their nine children, which have been the inspiration for their great and professional work in the production of sculptures and ceramics. The have dedicated more than 32 years into their business, creating beautiful, elegant, and incomparable work for export. Thanks to their daily struggles in their work they have been able to efficiently meet the necessities of their home, with the goal of improvement they hope to export a larger quantity and variety of their products. To make their dream a reality they are now applying for a loan that will be of greatly help them to achieve their goals, which they plan on repaying in a term of 8 months, promising to be punctual and responsible. Let's help this hard working family so that they can continue their efforts and struggles to triumph in life with their insurmountable and incomparable form of art.

Los deseos de estos afanosos padres, Eusebia y Luís, por brindarles lo mejor a sus nueve hijos, son los que los han llevado a esforzarse mucho con sumo profesionalismo en su labor de escultura y cerámica; oficio al que se dedican hace más de 32 años, realizando hermosos, elegantes e incomparables trabajos de exportación.Gracias al desempeño diario de sus labores han podido satisfacer eficientemente las necesidades de su hogar y en su afán de superación desean exportar en mayor cantidad y diversidad su mercadería. Para concretar sus deseos ellos solicitan un préstamo que les será muy beneficioso en el cumplimiento de sus objetivos, ambos se comprometen a reembolsar el préstamo en un lapso de ocho meses, prometen ser puntuales y muy responsables.Colaboremos con esta emprendedora familia para que sigan esforzándose y luchando por triunfar en la vida con su insuperable e incomparable arte.

Translated from Spansih by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Increase in capital to begin the exportation of their beautiful pieces of art.

loans.name: Banda B9 Group

texts.en: She expects to also start outside catering if given the loan. She wants to  expand her business by carrying out outside catering,for example,on parties and other occasions rather than being limited to only a restaurant serving a limited population.

loans.use: To open outside catering service

loans.name: Indalicia

texts.en:
Indalicia is a busy business woman.  She opened a small shop selling groceries from her home two years ago in the town of San Martin, province El Dorado, department San Martin.  The shop was started with $100, a table, and shelves.  Step by step, she patiently grew her business. She now has a larger, well-stocked shop which also sells clothes, and also she started a business baking and selling a variety of delicious breads.

Indalicia is married and has five young children.  She started the businesses with the help of her supportive husband so they could meet their basic needs and provide a better future for their children.  She works very hard to care for all of her children and run her businesses.  She has chosen to save money by not hiring someone to help her balance these duties.  Her husband also works from home and has a carpentry business.  Education is important to the family and Indalicia dreams of sending all her children to University.  Indalicia loves and feels lucky that she gets to work from home and spend time with her family.

Indalicia is a part of the community bank Los Girasoles and is requesting a loan of S/. 2,800 that she will repay in 6 months.  With the money she will restock her store and add new products and services such as shoes, beauty products, and a Chicharia (drink stand). She will also buy ingredients to bake her bread. She says that she is much happier now since starting these businesses. Her family is better off economically and she has made so many new friends. In the future she plans to continue to grow her various businesses.

loans.use: To stock her store and add new products and services

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in more merchandise for her store

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel 27 is married and has two girls and a boy. His wife and children grow tomatoes, beans, potatoes, and cassava on their family land, and he takes the produce to the market in Natete. In addition, he has a barbershop, two motorcycles for commercial use, and a farm supply shop at Kasaamu in Kasanje. He would use the loan to buy pesticides for his farm supply shop and to hire some farm workers. His dream is to buy a car for  transporting the farm produce to market.

loans.use: Emmanuel plans to pesticides for his farm supply shop and hire workers for his farm.

loans.name: Sara's Hiari Ya Moyo Group

texts.en:
Sara is 50 years old and is married with five children, ages 7 to 18 years old. She and her husband also take care of two other children. Sara owns a small animal stock, a business she started in 1998. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more animals to increase her stock. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Elizabeth, Zabira, Pudensia and Monica, who have businesses in fruits sales.

loans.use: To buy more animals to increase her stock.

loans.name: Issa

texts.en:
Issa works for the SOS children's village in Makeni, Sierra Leone. With his meager salary, he cannot save enough money to establish a small business for his wife. Issa thinks that his wife could generate more income for the family from the business and this could supplement his salary.

He is therefore requesting a loan of Le.1,500,000 to help his wife to start a business selling agriculture products such as rice, beans, palm oil and chilli peppers. He will repay the loan from his monthly salay. Issa is 37 years old and married with three children.

loans.use: To assist his wife to establish a food selling business

loans.name: Maisom

texts.en:
Mrs. Maisom L., 42, and her husband, Mr. Hot Yeb, 48, who live along National Road Number Six, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1979 and have six children, four sons and two daughters. Four of their children live with them and help them in fishing. Two children are married and are also in fishing.

Maisom and her husband have been fishing since 1979. They do fishing from Mekong River to resell at the market near the village. CurrentL. it is the low fishing season, and they need one kind of fishing net to use during this season. So, Maisom is requesting a loan of US$700 to purchase that kind of fishing nets and one motor for her business.

loans.use: Maisom would like to purchase fishing nets and one boat motor.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen, 37 years old, is single and lives in a village close to Nabatieh in the South of Lebanon. Helen is very hardworking and determined to make a difference in her family life. She bakes delicious flat bread on a "Saj," the bakery equipment you can see on the picture. She named her business Al Jawhar (Arabic: The Jewel) and needs a loan of US$300 to purchase ingredients and fuel.

This is the first time Helen has requested a loan from Al Majmoua. She promises to repay her loan on time and thereby prove her seriousness.

loans.use: To purchase the ingredients and fuel for breadmaking

loans.name: Constancia's Wema Group

texts.en:
Constancia is 32 years old. She is married with one eight-year-old child. She has been selling clothes since 1999. Every day, she works from 9am to 6pm at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

Constancia will use her loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her group members Farida and Zaina, who have businesses in food sales.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Sam-Orn

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam-orn H., 41, is a widow with one daughter who was married in 2008. Her daughter is a garment factory worker and her son-in-law is a farmer. He grows rice and buys fruit for resale at the market in Phnom Penh. The family lives along national road number one about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Sam-orn has been working in a garment factory since 2000. Currently, her son-in-law lacks the money to purchase mangoes on contract. He pays a cheaper price before the harvest season to the farmers for the mangoes they will grow and he will sell. Therefore, Sam-orn is requesting a loan of $1000 to give to her son-in-law for purchasing mangoes on contract.

loans.use: To purchase mangoes in contract.

loans.name: Im

texts.en:
Im S., 26, is married and lives with her husband and two children in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. She grows many kinds of vegetables and sells them at the market. She is able to make US$2.50 each day. Her husband is a dealer and purchases coconuts from a farm and then distributes them to small sellers in the village market. On average, he makes US$12.50 in revenue each day. He been in this business since 1998. His business was doing better in the past and now he makes less profit because he pays more for transportation.

The couple said they currently have no financial problems because they spend less on their children's education, but once the children are older, they will have to pay more for their schooling.

Mrs. Im S. is requesting a loan of US$1000 to breed a cow to helps with family expenses and use the leftover funds to repair their house. (Her husband is pictured.)

loans.use: To breed cow and make home repairs

loans.name: Chukwujekwu

texts.en: Chukwujejekwu E.,34, is a happy man who is married with three children. He sells flooring, including carpets and foam. The demand for his products are high. He is requesting a loan to increase his inventory of flooring products. He thanks all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more carpet and foam for resale

loans.name: Aliratu

texts.en: Aliratu is 40 years old, married, and the mother of 2 children.  She sells provisions and foodstuffs, as well as  children’s toys and household items. She hopes for a loan in the amount of N30,000 to purchase more provisions and food products to sell to her customers in wholesale and retail.  Aliratu says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Nirmala Riaz Group

texts.en:
Nirmala baji is a 51 year old married lady who resides in an area named Kot Radha Kishan in the city of Kasur, Pakistan. Kot Radha Kishan is 24km away from Kasur. She is a 10th standard pass educated lady. After her education, her parents married her to a person named Mr. R., who is a factory worker on monthly wages. Nirmala baji has one son whose name is Sajid Sohail. Sajid completed his education up to 10th standard and then started to run a shop selling calling cards. In this shop he sells different company calling cards. Nirmala baji has no daughter therefore she spends most of her time making embroidery and knitting clothes. She successfully repaid her four loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more calling cards to increase the profits of her son's business. 

She is a group leader of some more women of her locality. Amna baji and Nasreen baji each want a loan to buy buffalos for their milk selling businesses. Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy calling cards to sell

loans.name: Sandra Lucia

texts.es:
Sandra Lucia Narváez B. tiene la edad de 32 años, su estado civil es casada, Doña Sandra tiene 1 hijo su edad es de 15 años y cursa 5 año de secundaria, su compañero de vida labora como conductor de cabezal, sus propósitos son de idear nuevas estrategias de venta para con su negocio para que este obtenga mas afluencia de clientes sus deseos son de surtir su inventario para guardar reservas de sus productos y ofrecer una variedad para todos los gustos ya que siempre ha luchado con cumplir sus propósitos y metas dispuestas y además quiere guiar a su hijo para que este se instruya en la buena administración del negocio y a la ves sea una fuente de ingresos para su familia sus sueños son que los países que nos brindan ayuda nos sigan apoyando para que sigamos adelante con nuestros negocio ya que ellos son la fuente de inversión para los pequeños microempresarios que tratan de sacar adelante a sus familias.

La actividad económica  a la que se dedica es la venta de mercadería en general, la ubicación de su negocio es en el mercado la candelaria, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 5 años, ella inicio su negocio por cuenta propia por lo que necesita ya que necesitaba cubrir los diferentes gastos de su familia y empieza a ofrecer ciertos productos a sus vecinos y en las diferentes calles pero mas tarde obtiene la oportunidad de vender sus productos en lugar estable y es así como logra obtener un lugar estable para ofrecer sus productos que es en el mercado la candelaria por lo que ahora necesita un financiamiento que será utilizado para comprar productos del hogar, productos de limpieza y útiles escolares ya que se acerca la entrada a clases y necesita prepararse ya que sus clientes llegan en busca de estos productos.
texts.en:
Sandra is 32 years old and married. She has one son who is 15 years old and is completing school. Her husband works as driver. They would like to come up with new ideas to increase their sales and expand their customer base. They would like to increase their inventory so that they have products in reserve, as well as offer a greater variety to their customers. They have always worked hard and want to make sure that their son knows how to run a business so that he can also provide income for his own family one day. They hope that the support they receive from other countries will continue, as these are the source of investment for small businesses and the families they support. Their particular business is a general store, which they've run for 5 years now. Sandra began the business to help cover the household costs, selling a few products to her neighbors in the surrounding area. Later on, she had the opportunity to sell her products from a fixed location in the candelaria market. She is requesting the loan to purchase more household products, cleaning supplies, as well as school supplies because the school term is starting and her customers are starting to make requests.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock more inventory in her general store, including cleaning products and school supplies as the school term is approaching.

loans.name: Iltifat

texts.en:
Iltifat S. is 55 years old and is married with three children. He is a small entrepreneur who sells different kinds of foodstuffs such as: cookies, candies, soft drinks, juices, tea and many others in his grocery store which he built five years ago. Currently, Iltifat has about US$ 1500 of goods in his inventory. His monthly net profit is about US$ 150-200. 

Today, Iltifat is requesting a loan of 1200 USD for a term of 14 months to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. One of his dreams is that his children will progress in their studies. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: Purchase food products for re-sale

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Chavarria Group

texts.es: El Grupo Solidario Chavarría esta conformado por Paula C. y Juana del Carmen M. Chavarría ambas tienen diferentes actividades económicas que realizan son las siguientes: Doña Paula tiene 49 años y tiene 6 hijos de los cuales todos trabajan y estudian, su actividad económica es la venta de refrescos que realiza desde 4 años. La Señora Juana del Carmen tiene 45 años es soltera, tiene 2 hijos y se dedica a una pulpería tiene mas de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio ambas tratan de salir adelante con sus negocios por lo que su ayuda principal es recurrir a los financiamientos por lo que ahora solicitan la cantidad de C$ 4.000 córdobas cada una ya que es necesario para satisfacer las necesidades de sus negocio. en los sueños de ambas esta que cada una posea un negocio estable que le proporciones los ingresos necesarios para vivir.
texts.en:
The Solidario Chavarría group is made up of Paula C. and Juana del Carmen M. Chavarría. Both are in different economic activities as follows: Doña Paula is 49 years old and has 6 children, all of whom work and study. She sells soft drinks and has done so for 4 years. Juana del Carmen is 45 years old. She’s single and has 2 children. She has had a small store for more than six years. Both women are trying to get ahead with their businesses, for which financing would be a major help. They ask for C$ 4.000 ($200 USD) each, which is necessary to satisfy the needs of their businesses. Both women dream of each having a stable business that provides them with the needed income to live on.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Amna M. Irshad Group

texts.en:
Amna baji is married to M. I. and has lived in Borewala, Pakistan for five years. Her husband makes a living selling wheat, and has been in this line of work since 2002. Amna has five children, three sons and two daughters. Her older two sons help their father with his wheat-selling business. The other children are all in school. Amna baji is applying for a loan to buy wheat for her husband to sell. 

Amna baji leads a group made up of three other women. Nasira abbas baji wants a loan to buy calling cards for her public calling office, where people come to make calls. Faizan baji wants a loan to buy leather to sell. Salamat baji wants a loan to buy food items to sell in her grocery store.

This is a group loan. The funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy wheat and other items to sell

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline O. is a 44 year old cook who has a food business. Evangeline sells food in her village. She and her husband, Noel O., use the profits to feed and clothe their family. They also deliver food in the island. This has been their business since they were married.

School is quite expensive nowadays. And because the couple has seven children, they want to grow their business more to provide for all their children's needs. Now, Evangeline is asking for a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy additional ingredients, like cooking food, to sell.

CEVI is a non-profit organization and a partner of WorldVision Philippines. It is organized to respond the needs of entrepreneurs to help them start and grow their business. They provide credit, trainings, and insurance coverage to all their clients.

loans.use: To buy additional ingredients, like cooking food, to sell.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha es socia del Banco Comunal Dignidad.
Bertha es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 2 hijos, Bertha tiene una bodega en su casa en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, carne, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su mama e hijo, además Bertha junto a su esposo tienen una mototaxi con el cual trabaja su esposo.
Bertha necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, fideo.
Los sueños de Bertha son tener un negocio mayorista y brindarle una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Bertha is a member of the Dignidad Community Bank. 30-year old Bertha lives with her partner and has two children. She has a small store in her home from which she sells groceries, vegetables, and meat. She does this on a daily basis with the help of her mother and son. She and her husband also run a motorbike taxi service. Bertha needs a loan of 2000 soles which she will use to buy rice, sugar, and noodles. Her dreams are to have her own wholesale business and to provide her children with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy rice, sugar, and noodles

loans.name: Kdep

texts.en: Kdep R. is 34 years old and a resident of Phnom Penh City. She currently earns a living as a rice farmer. Beside her farm work, she is a good mother who is caring for three teenage children. All of her children are students in the local public school. Her husband is Mr. Phat (shown in the picture), who is 34 years old and works as a driver for an organization in Phnom Penh. He gets a specific salary of $120 a month in order to help pay for his family's living expenses. Kdep R. hopes to earn additional income with another suitable investment but she is lacking the capital. Therefore, she would like a $500 loan from Kiva to purchase a trailer-motor (tuk tuk) for her husband so that he can begin running a taxi.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer-motor

loans.name: Anibal's Group

texts.en:
At the age of 63, Anibal has just as much, or maybe more, energy than the young people that typically work in his line of business. He runs a decorative painting, paper hanging, and ceramic tile installation operation. He began work in this industry twenty years ago, working for various construction companies and landlords. In 1998, after 10 years of working for others, he set off on his own and has built a steady business for himself.

Today, Anibal’s business provides an income and enables him to enjoy time with his wife, three children and two grandchildren. His business has steadily grown with the help of four loans from ACCION USA. His most recent loan was used to purchase a tile cutter and a small scaffold.

Anibal began his business with very little, but through his honesty and hard work, he has built a great reputation and sustainable business. Anibal has decided that he will retire in the next three years and is meanwhile working hard to fulfill his goal.

video.title: Kiva Entrepreneur Anibal from  United States

loans.use: Tile cutter and and small scafflold

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia T. is thirty-one years old. She is divorced and has given birth to two children: a boy and a girl who are both currently in the primary school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana.

Cecilia is a trader, trading in bush meat. She buys the game meat from the local hunters and supplies to food vendors and restaurant operators in her community. Cecilia has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy meat in bulk. She desires to expand her business and improve upon her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy meat in bulk

loans.name: Julieth

texts.en: Julieth J. M. is an Tanzanian entrepreneur and a married businesswoman. She runs two businesses in Buguruni Ward in Dar es Salaam. She runs a traditional clothes shop and also is a food vendor. She purchases the business goods wholesale from Mnazi Mmoja Wholesale Traditional Clothes shops and sells them to retail customers in Buguruni. She manages to meet her family's daily demands from her business income. She is requesting a loan of Tshs 600,000 to expand the businesses.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Radwan

texts.en: Radwan is married with two children aged 4 and 3 years old. He owns a small mini-market where he sells groceries. He established this business four years ago in order to have extra income for his family, especially after getting married and having children. In addition to the grocery shop, Radwan is an employee at an insurance company.

loans.use: To purchase products for his mini-market

loans.name: Ainura's Group

texts.en:
Ainura is the leader of this group. She is a dentist. It is quite ironic, that, being surrounded by men (her husband and two sons), she is sole breadwinner for her family as her husband is temporarily unemployed and her two sons are a college student and a high school student respectively.

After she graduated from medical academy, Ainura started working and began saving her earnings. In the process of gaining experience, she already had a firm determination to open her own office. It took her many years of hard work, perseverance and patience until she was able to save US$ 1500. At last she accomplished that and opened a dental office and even bought necessary appliances and equipment.

So, for three years, she has been her own boss. Now she makes US$ 500 a month. Since any loan is a quick access to get what you need, Ainura has decided to get a loan to buy photo-filling equipment. Ainura has some far-reaching plans for making her dental room one of the best in the local area by creating service system for clients and buying high quality materials for dental treatment.

Ainura’s partners are: Dilbarbyu, Syinat and Nargiza. Dilbarbyu, 47, is divorced. Her three daughters and son being married live separately and little daughter goes to school. To make a living she sells cigarettes, mineral water and apples. Dilbarbyu needs a loan to purchase more goods and increase her turnover.

Syinat, a widow of 44, has two daughters. She has her own office/shop, where she provides minor services: opening foreign pages, loading units for cell phones, Xerox. Syinat needs a loan to buy a computer. She wants to provide typing and other computer services.

Nargiza, 23, is married, a mother of one child. She raises sheep and sells milk. Her husband is an odd-job worker on a construction site. Nargiza hopes to get a loan to buy a milch cow. She wants to earn more money from selling milk to save it for building a new shed.

====================================== --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to buy photo-filling equipment to improve the quality of the services provided

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: commerce

loans.name: Khơ's Group

texts.en:
Khơ Thị N.'s main job is farming. She grows rice and raises pigs. Every day, she works at many things: housework, cooking, and care of grandchildren. Her family includes her husband, three children, a daughter-in-law and two grandsons. Her husband is a hairdresser. Her son is an electrician.

Khơ Thị N. was born in 1959. She lives in Xom Mit, Uy No, Dong Anh. Her family has a monthly income of about 5.500.000 dong. She has taken part in SEDA for five years and repaid on time. This time, she wants to borrow 5.450.000 dong to breed pigs and poultry. ID: 010102090020

To borrow with her, is Mrs Thuc. Thức Thị N. is a worker. She was born in 1968. She wants to borrow 4.578.000 dong to buy piglets and feed for them. ID: 010102090021

loans.use: To breed pigs and poultry

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria L. lives in the village of Dacu, Brgy. Ayungon, La Carlota City, Negros Occidental. She is a 59-year-old widow with eight adult children whose ages range from 18 to 37 years old. Some of her children have their own families and seven of them have already graduated from college. Only one child is still studying. 

Candelaria has single-handedly taken care of the parenting responsibilities for all her children and is content with what she has accomplished so far. Her goal now is to have her youngest child graduate and start his own life armed with a good education and the ability to earn his own livelihood and provide for his future family.

When her husband died, she could not imagine how she could support her children by herself. With the help of her older children, they started to adjust to a single-parent family. In 2002, she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon so that she could borrow additional capital that could help sustain her general store and provide a steady income for her family. As her general store business stabilized, Candelaria knew that she needed to diversify her business if she wanted to prevent her family from falling into poverty. She slowly set aside some of her profits to start a food-vending business. Because she was so busy taking care of the living, she also recovered from mourning her loss. As her ventures improved she started to look for more opportunities where she could earn money without too much effort, and this is why she invested in pig fattening, which became part of the chores of her younger kids.

Her business ventures now earn a monthly income of 3,360 Philippine pesos and she is able to support the college education of her children and sustain the needs of her smaller household, now that most of the older children live away from home.
