Candelaria is a member in good standing. She has consistently paid off her loans, which is why she was able to borrow PHP 19,500 for her previous loan, her 13th with NWTF-Project Dungganon. She also paid it off on time without any delays in the weekly installments and now plans to borrow another PHP 19,500 so that she could sustain the stock level of her businesses. She is thankful that NWTF-PD entered her life and allowed her to survive the tragedy of the death of her husband, and continues to support her in achieving her dreams for her children: to have a life that has dignity and opportunities for the future.

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional capital for business expansion

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia is 46 years old. She is divorced with three children. Her children are currently in school.  She is a trader and trades in cosmetics like earrings, make up, perfumes etc. in the neighborhood of her loyal clients. She says selling of cosmetics is very lucrative and therefore she wants to expand her inventory to enable her to make a good income and meet the family’s needs.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics in bulk.

loans.name: Ibtissame

texts.en: Ibtissame is a married woman who has worked as a home-based tailor for 19 years. She's 52 years old. She began tailoring as a hobby and became well known in her town over time. Today, Ibtissame is applying for a loan of $1,200 to buy a new sewing machine and an iron to expand her business and ameliorate her economic situation.

loans.use: Buy a new sewing machine and an iron

loans.name: Don Tino Group

texts.es: El Grupos Solidario Don Tino está compuesto por Constantino de Jesús tiene 78 años, su actividad económica es brindar el servicio de costura. Este señor ha luchado todos los días por mejorar su condición de vida. En cambio Juna José tiene 56 años de edad y su actividad económica es la venta de leña, por lo que labora todos los días de la semana además su hijo le ayuda a conseguir la leña porque su edad no le permite realizar tanta fuerza pero muy humildemente se ganan la vida de esta forma. Ellos sueñan con mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus familias que son lo más importante.
texts.en:
The Don Tino Solidarity Group consists of two gentlemen. Constantino de Jesús is 78 years old and provides tailoring services. He has fought every day to improve his living conditions. On the other hand, Juan José is 56 years old and sells firewood. He works every day of the week. His son is there to assist him with his firewood business because his age does not allow him to work as vigorously as before. He continues to work with great humility because this is his means of making a living. Both gentlemen dream of improving the living conditions of their families since this of great importance to them.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy fertilizer and get more land under the plow.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
En el departamento de León, el señor Juan F. con mucha dedicación atiende a diario su propio negocio de venta de bebidas gaseosas de todo tipo distribuyéndolas a diferentes pulperías que le adquieren el producto a él. 

Es de importancia destacar que el señor Juan es muy trabajador porque inicia a laborar a partir de las Cinco de la mañana y cierra su establecimiento a las Diez de la noche diario siendo esta su actividad a la que con mucho esfuerzo se dedica para continuar mejorando sus ingresos y beneficiando a su familia que tanto ama. 

Con el crédito comprará las gaseosas para ofrecerla a sus clientes y lograr la satisfacción de cada uno de ellos.
texts.en:
In the Department of Leon, Mr. Juan F. daily attends his own business with much dedication, selling soft drinks of all types. He also distributes them to different grocery stores who depend upon him.

It is important to stress that Juan is a very hard worker because he begins work daily at 5:00 in the morning and closes his establishment at 10:00 at night. This is the activity that he dedicates himself to, with great effort, to continue improving his income and benefiting his family which he loves so much.

With this loan he will buy soft drinks to offer his customers and obtain the satisfaction of each one of them.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY SOFT DRINKS TO SELL

loans.name: Viadil Beatriz

texts.es:
Viadil Sánchez de 45 años de edad, vive en una zona periurbana ubicada en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, su esposo es comerciante ambulante con el tiene 3 hijas de 32, 29, 26 años ya todos casados y trabajando.

Viadil comenzó con el apoyo económico de su hija para ingresar a ser vendedora Yanbal, poco a poco comenzó comprando y vendiendo productos Yanbal. Ahora Viadil trabaja todos los días en las tardes vendiendo perfumes, cremas, shampoo, maquillajes todo esto por catalogo. Una de las dificultades que a veces tiene es su salud.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar perfumes, cremas, maquillajes para tener más variedad en sus productos. En el futuro quiere comprar un carro para poder entregar mejor su mercadería.
texts.en:
Viadil Sánchez is 45 years old and lives in a suburban area located in the Perimetral de Guayaquil. Her husband is a door-to-door salesman and they have three daughters aged 32, 29, and 26 years old respectively. All of them are married and working. With financial support from her daughter, Viadil invested in the sale of Yanbal (a line of cosmetics products). Little by little, Viadil has started buying and selling Yanbal products. Now Viadil works every afternoon selling perfumes, creams, shampoo, and makeup by catalog. However, she sometimes had trouble selling her goods because of health problems. With this loan, she wants to buy perfumes, creams, and makeup to increase her variety of products. In the future, she would like to buy a car in order to better transport her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Perfumes, creams, and makeup

loans.name: Yuryi

texts.en:
Yuryi is married with six children, four boys and two girls. He lives in Novomoskovsk but travels all over Ukraine delivering freight and farm produce. Yuryi has been in this business for two years. Presently, he receives over $625 of income each month. 

Yuryi is seeking a 6,000 UAH loan for truck maintenance purposes. He is hoping to keep his vehicle running efficiently which will help him serve more clients and bring him a stable income. Yuryi has a big family and needs to provide for its needs. He is an active and cheerful person and a businessman with integrity.

loans.use: truck maintenance

loans.name: Bruno

texts.es: El Sr. Bruno C. es de la compañia Potrero de la ciudad de Carapeguá, el mismo se dedica a la producción y venta de productos artesanales siendo los artículos que produce sobrecamas y hamacas actividad que desarrolla en forma conjunta con su familia ya que recibe la cooperación de su esposa e hijos. Accedió a un crédito con nuestra entidad que lo utilizó para la compra de materia prima, especificamente hilo y telas  a modo de contar con mayor cantidad de mercaderías que pueda comercializar teniendo en cuenta que tenia o tiene varios pedidos que cubrir.
texts.en:
Señor Bruno C. is with the Potrero company in the city of Carapeguá, producing and selling handicrafts such as bedspreads and hammocks. The whole family enters into this activity, including his wife and children. He has been granted a loan through our organization to buy raw materials, specifically thread and fabrics so he would have a larger quantity of merchandise to sell, as he has several orders to fill.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Essohanam

texts.fr: Cette dame est une résidente du quartier d’agbalépédo, elle vit avec son mari et ses 02 enfants. Elle s’est lancée en 2007 dans le commerce des céréales, plus précisément le maïs qui est très utilisé dans la cuisine togolaise pour préparer la pâte. Elle s’approvisionne à notsè parce que le maïs est moins  coûteux dans cette ville, ainsi elle réalise plus de bénéfice sur ses ventes. Son stock est en baisse, elle veut se réapprovisionner raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 20 sacs de céréales et assurer le transport des marchandises.
texts.en:
Essohanam K. is a resident of the Agbalépédo quarter. She lives with her husband and their two children. She entered the cereal trade in 2007, more specifically trading maize which is used often in Togolese cuisine to make dough. She stocks up on supplies in Notsè because maize is less expensive there; she can thus make a larger profit from her sales. Her stock is diminishing, and she would like to restock. She is asking for her first loan from WAGES to buy 20 bags of cereals and assure the transport of her merchandise.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cereals

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Khalil is a 28-year-old single man living with his parents and 3 brothers. In 2007, he opened a Nargile shop. Nargile is a special Lebanese tobacco very famous in Lebanon. He designed his shop as a café, receiving clients who come to have a good time, and he also offers delivery service to homes. 

Today, Khalil hopes to expand his shop by making it bigger and also building a cigarette stand. He is requesting a loan of $1,000 to achieve this purpose.

loans.use: Expand tobacco shop and add a cigarette stand

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is widowed with two children and both of her children go to school. She rents a one-room house where she stays with three people. The family has access to electricity and piped water. Florence doesn’t take care of any additional family, but she does pay for rent, school fees and feeding her immediate family. 

Florence owns a stall selling charcoal in Mengo-Kisenyi.  Besides this charcoal business, she also sells foodstuffs at her stall  She works seven days a week. Florence receives at least 20 customers a day and sells to all categories of people at retail. Her business challenges including transport costs.  

Florence wants to use this loan to increase her stock by buying more sacks of charcoal and foodstuffs like bunches of bananas, cassava and sweet potatoes. She hopes to see her business grow bigger and to get money to construct her own house. She joined MCDT because she could access loans easily after a group consensus.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and bananas

loans.name: M.talictic's Group

texts.en:
Marites T. is from the village of Molatuhan Bajo. She is 39 years old. Marites is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Marites is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Marites owns & operates a 'sari-sari' (general)  store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Marites has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Marites joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marites has successfully repaid a previous loan  from PMPC. Marites is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Marites from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Koutediomboulou Group

texts.en:
The group "Koutediomboulou" is a solidarity group and part of the "Banc Villageois" TEREMBASSE, a village in the southern part of Senegal. The seven women in this group got together in 2002, when the "Banc Villageois" was founded. They all work in agriculture. In the eight years that they have been clients of Caurie Microfinance, one of Kiva's Fieldpartners in the region, they have always paid back their loans on time.

Motafé Touré is the leader of the group. She is 43 years old, married and mother of three. She is also responsible for six nephews. Motafé Touré sells sugar, palm oil, bananas and much more. She is experienced in this activity and wants to use her loan to buy more of the products she sells. With the earnings from her business she is able to cover some of the costs of her large family such as health care and clothes for the children.

loans.use: increase her inventory

loans.name: In God We Trust Group

texts.en:
Theresa K. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called In God We Trust. She is 57 years old, is widowed, and has seven children who range from 13 to 36 years old. She was only able to attend school through 5th grade due to poverty.

For fourteen years, Theresa has been selling slippers on Mechlin Street, downtown Monrovia, Liberia. She sells in a friendly manner which keeps customers returning.

Theresa plans to use her 10,400 Liberian dollar portion of this 47,600 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more slippers to sell. Her goal is to grow her business and to continue to support her children so that they can have a better future.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Theresa is the one holding the sign, and Rebecca F. is inset because she was absent during the interview.

loans.use: To buy more slippers to sell

loans.name: Nema

texts.en:
Nema G. is a 41-year old married woman who lives in Calumpang, Barangay Mabini, Valladolid, Negros Occidental. She earns her living with her general store business.

Nema’s 43 year old husband, Enrique, is a farmer, and they have 3 children. Two of the children are adult aged while the other child is currently going to school and also helps the parents in the business as part of daily chores.

Nema joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in a general store business. Now she earns an average monthly income of PHP10,000 from her business activities.

Nema is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of PHP10,000 was used to fund operations of her general store, and it had a positive impact in both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing for her 10th cycle loan, the amount of PHP13,000, which she intends to use on her general store business. Nema is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital.

loans.name: Rene Prosper

texts.fr:
Commercant de 42 ans,celibataire avec 3 enfants a commence cette activite il ya de cela 19 ans avec une somme de 50.000f ,quand il a arrete ses etudes puisque n'avait personne pour subvenir et  le soutenir 
 Avec ce pret il compte renforcer son activite en achetant des cravates,des chemises, des chaussettes et des habits a la mode que les jeunes apprecient.
Pour faire croitre son activite il choisit les meilleurs marches pour s'approvisionner en habits et livre ses tenues dans les administrations et a domicile.Il sait faire face aux difficultes sur le marche, A l'avenir il compte effectuer des voyages, epargner pour ouvrir un magasin pour homme et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
This businessman who is 42 years of age and single with three children, began his activity with a sum of 50,000 francs 19 years ago, when he had finished his studies and had no-one to provide for him or support him. With this loan he is planning on strengthening his business by buying ties, shirts, socks, and fashionable clothes that young people like. In order to grow his business he chooses the best markets to buy his supplies of clothing and he delivers his outfits to government offices and to people's homes. He knows how to cope with difficulties in the market. In the future he is planning to travel, save money in order to open a menswear shop and provide for the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of shirts, ties and socks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy another dairy cow to increase his milk production

loans.name: Wendy

texts.en:
Wendy D. C. is from the village of Santa C.. She is 33 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she plants and harvests rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over thirteen years and earns approximately $110 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Wendy joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be her 1st loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Don Juan Antonio  de  44 años de edad es casado, habita junto a su familia compuesta por su esposa y su unico hijo de seis añitos de edad el cual esta cursando su segundo grado de educaciòn primaria en la Escuelita Jan Amos Comenius del municipio Nueva Guinea.  Juan labora como fiscal de campo en el INTA  desde hace 12 años. 

Està solicitando su 6to crèdito para invertirlo en su pequeña casa, comprando materiales de construccion para hacer un corredor en su casa y que su pequeño tenga donde jugar. 

Su mayor sueño en la vida es tener estabilidad laboral y poco a poco ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida y de su familia.
texts.en:
Juan Antonio, 44, is married and lives with his family, which includes his wife and 6 year-old only son. His son is in second grade at Nueva Guinea’s Jan Amos Comenius School. Juan has worked for 12 years as a Field Supervisor at INTA. He is requesting his 6th loan to invest in his home. He will buy building materials and supplies to build a passageway so that his son will have a place to play. His greatest wish is to have job security and gradually improve his family’s living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies to build a passageway.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is a 42-year-old widow and lives in the Pakistani city of Kasur, famous for its leather industry. She owns a small two-roomed house and has lived there with her family for over 21 years. She lost her husband a few years ago and this was a big loss in her life. Bushra is the mother of two sons and a daughter. Her elder son left his education after 8th grade and started helping Bushra in her business. Her younger son works in a motor workshop as a mechanic. Her only daughter also contributes to the family financially by doing embroidery work. 
Bushra is involved in the business of power looms (a machine that manufactures clothes and bed sheets). She manufactures bed sheets by taking orders from different factories and shops and supplying them with finished goods in the given time. She earns a valuable amount each time she sells a bed sheet.  
Bushra has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for the growth of her sheet-making business. She will invest her loan in her business and purchase thread in bulk. She is confident that she will be able to grow her business and income by investing money into it. She has run her business for the last 16 years and she knows that it has the potential to make good profits. Bushra is a regular loan user of Asasah and is on her second loan.

loans.use: To purchase thread in bulk to make bed sheets

loans.name: Frit

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “PADRE URRACA”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de  Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio Frit tiene 50 años de edad y es casado, El socio tiene 5 hijos El socio trabaja principalmente con la agricultura toda la vida, el estudio un curso de carpintería y tiene todas las maquinarias, pero su amor a la política y a la igualdad entre las personas lo llevo a entrar en política y a dirigir el grupo de regantes en todo el sur del Pero, El socio es un político innato y hoy en día el socio cesta postulando para la alcaldía en la ciudad del Cusco, el goza de un excelente sentido del humor y dueño de ideas revolucionarias y justicia para todos; El socio también manifiesta que está en el banco 9 años y siempre acude a estas reuniones porque le gusta confraternizar con sus amigos de antaño; el solicita el préstamo para aumentar un capital y comprar un terreno. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de un terreno (aumentara a su capital).

El socio agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Frit belongs to the communal bank “PADRE URRACA.” This bank is located in the District of Huanchac, Province and Department of Cusco. Frit is 50 years old and married with 5 children. He has worked mainly in agriculture his entire life. He is also taking a course in carpentry and has a lot of machinery. But his love for politics and equality for all people has led him to enter politics and lead a group of irrigation workers in Southern Peru. Jose is an innate politician and today he is running for mayor in the city of Cusco. He has an excellent sense of humor and has revolutionary ideas and believes in justice for all. He also stated that he's been in the communal bank for nine years and always comes to the meetings because he likes to socialize with old friends. Frit is requesting a loan to increase his capital and purchase a field. He is grateful for the loan offered through this organization and promises to complete his payments as scheduled.

Translated from Spanish by Angela Yeh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in buying land

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Virgilia V. is a single woman who lives in Brgy. Dakit, Bogo, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: dried fish sales and food vending businesses. Virgilia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005, because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Virgilia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 6,000 helped her increase her monthly profit to PHP 6,000, improving the family's standard of living. This time, for her fifth cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 12,000, which she intends to use to purchase more dried fish to sell so that she can continue to save up for her future security. 

Virgilia aims to build a new house and buy a motorcycle when she has enough savings. Virgilia V. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more fish for resale

loans.name: Angel

texts.es: Ángel, de 37 años, es un padre de familia muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Noemí de 28 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo al que se dedica Ángel, es la siembra de papas y arvejas, los cuales después de cosecharlos, vende en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Él tiene varios clientes, que sabiendo de la calidad de sus productos no dudan en esperarlo para comprarle todo al por mayor. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y hacerlas fértiles y productivas, lleva 25 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus chacras de la plaga de insectos. En adelante, espera comprar o alquilar nuevas tierras para ampliar su producción. Este es el sexto crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, si desea acceder a otro crédito en el futuro. En su banco comunal, es un socio muy responsable y preocupado por el bienestar de su grupo. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en: Ángel is 37 years old and is the hard-working father of a very simple family. He lives in his own house with his wife Noemí, who is 28 years old, and their three children. He wants to offers his children a better quality of life. Ángel grows potatoes and peas. After he harvests them, he sells them in the largest market in the city of Tarma. He has various clients, and because they know the quality of his products, they do not compare his crops with others. His favorite part of his work is sowing his land and making it fertile and productive. He has spent 25 years pursuing this activity, and the most difficult part of his work is protecting his farms from insects. Going forward, he hopes to buy or rent new land to increase his production. This is his sixth loan with MFP, and he knows that he has to make his repayments on time if he wants to take out another loan in the future. Within his community bank, he is very responsible and is concerned about the well-being of his group. With the 1000 nuevos soles that he is requesting, he will buy more fertilizer to improve his harvests.

loans.use: To buy more bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Dolgormaa

texts.en: Dolgormaa P. lives with her husband and children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent in her sibling's yard. Dolgormaa operates a used clothing retail business in the Narantuul market, one of the largest and most crowded markets in Ulaanbaatar. She began her business in 2004 and has built a stable and successful operation. After years of hard work, she has gained not only a wide range of customers base but also lots of experience as a businesswoman. Today, her working capital exceeds 2,000,000 MNT with 30 percent of net profit. She is a very energetic and honest woman and says, “Soon, we hope to buy our own apartment. We are saving money for that." Dolgormaa is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to increase her working capital.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes.

loans.name: Lelita

texts.en:
Lelita A. is from the village of Sulipat, Calamba, Mismais Occidental. She is 30 years old. Lelita is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Lelita owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products  including fish and shrimp in the local community. Lelita has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lelita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Lelita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Lelita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more locks, cutlasses, nails, paint, hammers

loans.name: Tam's Group

texts.en:
Tam T. N. is 34 years old. She lives in Luc Canh village, Xuan Canh commune, Dong Anh, Ha Noi. She raises pigs and chickens. She has participated in SEDA since 2007. During the last cycL., she borrowed 4.578.000 VND and repaid this loan punctually. In this loan cycL., she would like to borrow 7.630.000 VND to buy food for her pigs. She is the leader of a 6-member group in SEDA.

About other borrowers in her group:
Tam T. N. is 53 years old. She raises chickens. She would like to borrow 7.194.000 VND to buy food for her chickens.

Nhuong T. N. is 49 years old. She would like to borrow 6.322.000 VND to breed pigs and poultry.

Hang T. T. L. is 29 years old. She wants to borrow 7.194.000 VND to raise cows.

Hien T. N. is 35 years old. She sells fruit in the market. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND for her small business.

My T. N. is 62 years old. She wants to borrow 3.270.000 VND to breed poultry.

loans.use: To buy food for pigs

loans.name: Long

texts.en: Long S., 36, is a married woman living in Phnom Penh City. She and her husband are local farmers growing vegetables and ducks. They earn $6.66 a day on average. The couple is blessed with three children, all of whom are in school. She will use some of her loan to buy more ducks to grow, but will use most of it to buy fertilizer and vegetable seed to plant on her farmland after the rains fall and the land is suitable for production.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seed to plant and ducks to raise and sell.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a farmer from Murang'a town in central Kenya. She has been farming for 13 years and employs one farmhand. Her mixed farm produces maize, beans and eggs, which she sells to the local market.

She has requested this loan of 50,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to expand her poultry farming. The extra income from this loan will help improve the livelihood of her family. Her biggest challenge in farming has been diseases, which affects her production. She currently has 12 layers and intends to improve in the future by acquiring at least 3,000 layers.

Lucy is 32 years old and married with three school-aged children who all attend school.

loans.use: To expand her poultry farming.

loans.name: Dilfina

texts.en:
Dilfina M., 56 years old, is from Kakamega. She is married to Ezekiel and they have two children who are both over 18 years old.

Dilfina has a dairy business and has been in it for the past nine years.  She is applying for her third loan from KADET LTD after successfully completing her second one. She will use the money to buy another dairy cow to enable her to be able to supply more milk to her clients. 

The profits made will be used to pay college fees for her two children. Her desire is to see her business grow and be able to have many cows.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to add to her stock

loans.name: Marie-Jeanne

texts.fr:
Femme marié, mère de 3enfants exerçant la petite pâtisserie fabrique des beignets et bouillie de mais.
Elle est dans ce commerce depuis 20ans et avait déjà  bénéficié du premier prêt qu’elle a remboursée avec succès.

Pour améliorer son activité, elle veut tente une deuxième expérience avec le prochain prêt et veut acheter ce qui suit :
 1 sac de riz, 1 sac de sucre, 1 sac de farine, 1bidon de 25litres d’huile, sel, Fagot de bois, paquets de levure pâtissière et les arômes.
Ses revenus avant le premier prêt étaient de 35000F par jour,  avec l’amélioration de la qualité de ses services, elle a des revenus de 60000F maintenant.
Son objectif principal est d’importer  de la farine car elle maitrise bien ce domaine afin de soutenir à l’avenir les études supérieures des ses enfants et neveux.
Elle  est encouragé par son entourage pour cet activité.
texts.en:
A married woman and the mother of three, she runs a small bakery, preparing beignets and corn porridge. She is in this business for 20 years and already had one loan, which she repaid successfully. In order to bolsert her business, she would like to try a second loan, planning to purchase the following: one bag of rice, one bag of sugar, one bag of flour, one 25-liter jug of oil, salt, kindlewood, packs of  yeast and flavorings. 

Her revenues before the first loan used to be 35,000 West African francs per day. After upgrading the quality of her services, she now earns 60,000 francs. Her main goal is to become a flour importer, as she knows this business well, in order to support higher education for her children and nephews in the future. Her friends and family encourage her in this work.

loans.use: Purchases: a bag of flour, a bag of rice, a jug of oil , a bag of sugar, yeast, a bag of [dry] milk, kindlewood, flavorings

loans.name: Senaida

texts.es: Senaida, una mujer de 36 años. Vive junto a su esposo Salomón y a sus 3 hijos, en su casa propia ubicada en la ciudad de la Merced (selva central peruana). Su trabajo se centra en la realización de cajones de madera que sirven para el almacenamiento de la fruta que es vendida al por mayor. Diariamente Senaida, realiza un promedio de 200 cajones, obteniendo una ganancia neta de 90 soles semanales. También se dedica a la venta de gaseosa, chupetes y helados en su casa; ya todos los vecinos la conocen, tanto así que en época de verano tiene gran acogida. Pero la agricultura, actividad que realiza desde niña, es lo que más le gusta a ella. En el terreno que adquirió, comenzó a sembrar café, lo que cuidó y fertiliza durante su crecimiento; y ya muy pronto cosechará. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Las Optimistas”, y este es el tercer crédito que tiene con MFP, donde es responsable y puntual. Senaida, se está preparando para la primera cosecha de su planta de café que sembró hace dos años, por ello con el crédito está pensando comprar abono orgánico para esparcirlos entre sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Senaida, 36, lives with her husband, Salomón, and their three children in her own house located in the city of Merced (Peruvian central jungle).  Her job is making wood crates that are used to store fruit that is sold at wholesale.  Every day Senaida makes about 200 crates earning a weekly net profit of 90 soles.  She also sells soft drinks, frozen fruit treats and ice cream at home.  All of her neighbors know her, so much so that in summer she has a huge welcome.  What she likes best, however, is agriculture – something she’s done since she was a little girl. She started planting coffee on a field she acquired; she cares for it and fertilizes it while it’s growing.  Harvest will be soon now.

She is a member of the “Las Optimistas” (The Optimistic Ones) communal bank and this is her third loan with MFP where she is responsible and punctual.  

Senaida is getting ready for her first coffee harvest from plants she planted two years ago.  She is, therefore, thinking of using the loan to buy organic manure to spread among her crops.

loans.use: To buy organic manure to spread among her crops.

loans.name: Besta

texts.en: Besta is currently in a business of selling mixed goods. She is 40 years old, married to a farmer, with six children and none of them goes to school. Besta took out a loan to stock more mixed goods to sell. With extra profits from her business, Besta hopes to pay to have her children go to  school in the future.

loans.use: stock more mixed goods to sell

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth P. is from the village of Del Pilar, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 47 years old. Lilibeth is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Lilibeth owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as body spray, deodorants and lotions in the local community. Lilibeth has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Lilibeth joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilibeth is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Lilibeth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food production/sales business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production/sales business.

Alejandra has been in this business for 21 years. Alejandra earns more income with hog raising.

Alejandra has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of sending her children to school and doing some home improvements in the future.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to make food products to sell

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen lives in an industrial city of Pakistan known as Faisalabad. She has lived there in a 2-room brick house in the area of Mian Pind for the past 16 years. She is a housewife and does her household works, staying at home. She doesn’t have any children. Her father and brother also live with her and both of them are involved in different jobs. Her father is a security guard while her brother sells vegetables.  

Nasreen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her husband’s business. He is a painter and paints houses and buildings on order. He deals with different companies and individuals and earns good income after completing their work. Using the loan, he will buy different colors of paint and paint brushes to provide better quality service to his clients. 

Nasreen is hopeful that her husband will successfully be able to grow his business to a level where his family can have a better standard of living. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In the previous loan year, she proved herself to be a responsible client by paying her installments on time and by attending every meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with her hand raised is Nasreen”

loans.use: To buy paint and paint brushes for husband's house-painting business.

loans.name: Clemente Esteban

texts.es:
Clemente de 38 años, es un hombre trabajador que inspiras mucho en su trabajo que empezó su actividad hace 15 años en la ventas de hielo helados y varios víveres.

El labora de 10H00 am a 2H00 pm y de 4H00pm a 6H30pm el prepara los helado para venderlos, Esta casado y ella es empleada domestica. Con la ayuda del préstamo desea comprar materiales de construcción como cemento piedras y otros para arreglar su vivienda. . El anhela algún día comprarse y vehículo y terminar de adecuar su casa para darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Clemente, age 38, is a hard worker who is very much inspired by his work which he began 15 years ago.  He sells ice, ice cream and groceries for a living.

He works from 10:00 a.m. to 2:00 p.m, and from 4:00 p.m. to 6:30 p.m. prepares the ice cream to be sold.  He is married and his wife is a house cleaner.  With the help of the loan he plans to buy construction materials such as cement, stone and other materials to renovate his house.  He hopes to one day be able to buy a car and finish upgrading his house so he can give his family a better lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy cement and blocks

loans.name: Nargis' Group

texts.en:
Nargis is married with three children: two sons and a daughter. Her elder son works in the fields and grows different seasonal crops. The 2nd one is a graduate by degree and works in a telecom company while her daughter operates her beauty salon at home and provides beauty services to her female clients. 

Her husband is a retired government employee. He receives a pension from the government every month. Nargis herself is a housewife, staying at home and doing her household responsibilities.  

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the betterment of her eldest son who wants to buy fertilizers, seeds and pesticides for his agriculture business.  He has been operating this business for the past four years and Nargis is hopeful that an investment will help him improve his business conditions further. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Nargis.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticides for agriculture business.

loans.name: Jolly

texts.en:
Jolly is a hard-working father of three young children. He is 31 years old and married.

Jolly is a farmer working in San Jose, Agusan Del Sur. He grows rice and vegetables to sell. He also raises pigs in his backyard. He does his best to improve his earnings for his family. He requested a loan to buy farm fertilizers, piglets and feeds. He hopes to be successful in sending his children to school.

loans.use: to buy farm fertilizers, piglets and feeds.

loans.name: Wend La Yangda Group

texts.fr:
Mme Kalizeta est la représentante du groupe WEND LA YANGDA. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Le plus âgé a 16 ans le moins âgé a 8 ans. Tous les trois vont a l’école et elle a 4 personnes à sa charge.

Mme est coiffeuse et vend parallèlement des sacs à main pour dame. Elle exerce ce métier depuis 9 ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de secteur n°10 de Ouagadougou. Ses clients son les femmes.

Mme veut acheter 5 sacs à main et 12 paquets de mèche, 12 paquets de tissage, 6 grosses boites de défrisant, 6 petites boites de défrisant 2 bidons de 4 litre de champoing et 2 bidons de 4 litre de démêlant pour son salon de coiffure.

Elle utilise ses bénéfices pour aider son mari dans les charges familiales et dans le bon fonctionnement de son salon de coiffure. Mme ambitionne ouvrir une grande boutique de vente de sacs à main.
texts.en:
Kalizeta is the representative of the WEND LA YANGDA group. She is married with three children. The oldest is sixteen years old the and the youngest is eight. The three of them are attending school and besides she has other four kids in her care.
She is a hairdresser and alongside she sells ladies handbags. She has been in this business for nine years. She purchases her supplies at the market of the 10th district of Ouagadougou. Her customers are exclusively women.
Kalizeta would like to buy 5 handbags, 12 packs of hair extensions,12 packs of hair appliques, 6 large boxes of defrizzing lotion, 6 small boxes of defrizzing treatment, 2 bottles of 4 liter shampoo and 2 bottles of 4 liter hair conditioner for her hair salon.
She will use her profits to help her husband with family care and to improve the service in her salon. Her wish is to open a large handbags store.

loans.use: to purchase five handbags and hairdressing supplies

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is widowed and has four children, all of whom are in school.  Joyce has a restaurant business.  She has been in this business for three years and she works seven days out of every week. Joyce has requested  for a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy bunches of bananas, beef, sweet and Irish potatoes and rice. She also generates additional income by frying samosas. The main business challenges for Joyce include seasonality and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked restaurant and build her own house. Joyce lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bananas, beef, Irish potatoes and rice

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. Betty has a retail shop that sells beauty products from Avon and Natasha. She has had this business for 22 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy additional Avon and Natasha products. Betty is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Betty hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional Avon and Natasha products

loans.name: Yolanda Zulema

texts.es:
Yolanda Zulema tiene 42 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos , en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. EL DIVINO NIÑO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Estero Lindo, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto como siembre de maíz y arroz.

Yolanda se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Comercial AGRIPAC y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de semillas y abonos de maiz y arroz.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrenta desafíos como plagas en los cultivos y la falta de dinero para pagar a mas trabajadores. Su sueño es seguir invirtiendo en este negocio para tener mas ingresos y ayudar a los hijos.

Le gusta cocinar en familia y bailar en las fiestas.
texts.en:
Yolanda Zulema is 42 years old, married, and lives with her husband and children in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

The members of the Communal Bank “El Divino Niño” (The Divine Child) meet in the neighborhood of Estero Lindo, which is part of the canton of Ventanas. This Communal Bank consists of short-cycle farmers who grow corn and rice.

Yolanda is a farmer who grows corn and rice. She buys her products at the AGRIPAC Commercial Center and sells at the wholesale market in Ventanas.

The loan she is requesting will be used for planting corn and rice. She will buy seeds and composts for her corn and rice crops. With the financial assistance provided through this loan, she will be able to acquire needed supplies. The challenges she faces include diseases that could impact her crops and the lack of money to pay for more workers. Her dream is to continue investing in her business so that she can have more income and support her children.

Yolanda enjoys cooking for her family and dancing at parties.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and compost for planting corn and rice.

loans.name: Shadrack

texts.en:
Shadrack is 38 years old, married to Susan and they have two school-going children.

He has operated his retail shop for four years. He sells assorted items ranging from clothing and small electrical goods to foodstuffs. 

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officer and this will be his fourth loan. He plans to use the loan to buy more foodstuffs in bulk and later re-pack and sell it in small quantities.

In the future, he hopes to expand his retail shop to wholesale.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, wheat flour and maize flour in bulk.

loans.name: Henry Ely

texts.es:
Henry, es soltero, vive con sus padres, es agricultor, siembra frijol y maíz desde hace 10 años, este trabajo lo aprendió con su padre, colaborándole en las actividades desde que era muy joven, por el momento se encuentra en una nueva tarea de cultivo y quiere comprarse los fertilizantes y herbicidas para aplicarlos al cultivo.
Solicita un financiamiento que le ayude a cubrir el gasto agrícola, esta compra le ayudara para garantizar el desarrollo del maíz, su propósito es ayudar a sus padres con su trabajo, algún día formar su propio hogar y construir su vivienda.
texts.en:
Henry is single and lives with his parents.  He is a farmer, and he has been growing beans and corn for ten years.  He learned this work from his father; they worked together in farming activities since he was very young.

He is now planting new crops, and he wants to buy fertilizers and herbicides to apply to the crops.

He is requesting a loan to help him cover the farming expense.  This purchase will help guarnatee the growth of his corn.  His intentions are to help his parents with their work, to someday form his own family, and to build his house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides for his crops.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 36 years old and lives in the peaceful village of Baculud. She has been residing in this village together with her family for almost 11 years. She is a responsible mother and a wife to her husband. Her husband buys and sell junk in the village. She wanted to supplement her spouse's income; that is why she established a small variety store in front of her house. A minimal net income of 5,000 Philippines pesos (P) monthly from the business goes to the allowances of her two children, electric bills and daily meals for the family. 

With the crisis in life she encountered, she strives hard and doesn't lose hope to lift her family out of poverty. She wants to educate her children to have a degree someday to seek better employment for their own families.

She is asking for a loan of P7,000 to buy instant noodles, coffee, sugar, soap and shampoo to sell in her store and increase her sales.

She wants to strengthen her business to achieve her dream goal for her family.

loans.use: to buy instant noodles, coffee, sugar, soap and shampoo to sell in her store.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “CHICON” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Poblado D. Chicon, en la Provincia D. Urubamba y Departamento D. Cusco.
La socia Florencia; La socia tiene 47 años, la socia es casada y tiene 2 hijos, la socia se dedica a la atención diaria D. sus restaurante, la socia tiene su propio negocio D. alimentos, ella prepara los diversos potajes y se encarga D. la administración D. sus restaurante, la socia invita a todo el público en general a que pasen a degustar si se encuentran por Chicón a su restaurante llamado el Paraíso; la socia es una persona muy trabajadora y año a año está concluyendo con la construcción D. sus vivienda, ella también apoya en los estudios D. sus hijos, la socia desea a futuro muy cercano poder hacer crecer su restaurante y mejorarlo, e implementar, ella ahora D. sea invertir el préstamo e la compra D. arroz, aceite en bidones, papa, fideos entre otros para poder preparar los diferentes potajes. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. insumos para la elaboración D. sus diversos potajes.
La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir D. manera disciplinada con los pagos D. las cuotas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "CHICON" which is located in the village of Chicón in the province of Urubamba and department of Cusco.

Florencia, 47, is married and has two children.  She has a food business and also runs a restaurant called El Paraíso where she makes different kinds of stews.  She invites everyone visiting Chicón to come by and taste her dishes.  She is a hard worker and in the process of building her own house.  She also helps her children with their education.  In the future she wants to expand and improve her restaurant.  The loan will be used to buy rice, oil, potatoes and noodles, among other items, for her different stews.

She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her different stews.

loans.name: Juan De Dios

texts.es:
El Señor Juan es soltero, tiene 35 años de edad, vive en pareja con 2 hijos menores de edad, reside en la ciudad de Curuguaty, en su casa propia. 
Es propietario de una parada de Taxi, cuenta con un auto a su nombre, en cual trabaja todos los días cubriendo un itinerario de Curuguaty – Ciudad del Este. Con una experiencia de 5 años en el rubro en forma independiente, ya que antes trabajaba como personal cumpliendo la función de conductor en el mismo rubro. Los pobladores de algunos lugares optan por el servicio de Taxis ya que no hay colectivos que cubren directo. También por el confort y la rapidez.
El solicita el crédito para el mantenimiento de su taxi, ya que este es el medio de su trabajo y su principal fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Juan is 35 years old and single.  He lives with his partner (unmarried) and his two dependent children.  He lives in the town of Curuguaty, in his own home.  He owns a taxi stand and has a car in his name which he uses for work every day, covering a route between Curuguaty and Ciudad del Este.  He has five years experience of working independently in this line of work.  He used to work as a driver in the same field but as a member of staff, working for somebody else.

The locals in some of these places choose to use a private taxi service as there aren't collective taxis (those with a fixed route and fare) that run direct.  They also choose a private taxi service for the comfort and speed.

Juan is requesting a loan to have his taxi serviced as it is his work tool and also his main source of income.

loans.use: to have his taxi serviced

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is single and blessed with two children who are still in school. She has been managing a salon for the last three years to make a living. She also practices dairy farming to increase her savings. She has retained her business because of her good reputation with her customers. In the next 5 years, she wants to open other outlets of her business. With 60,000 Kenya shillings, she wants to buy hair chemicals and braids.

loans.use: to buy hair chemicals and braids.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
This is Leticia, 53, a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines, a widow and mother to her four children.  She, together with her children, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 
                            
Leticia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She also retails electronic cell phone loads for additional income. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 30,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Leticia hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and  draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Guljainar

texts.en:
Guljainar is 40 years old and lives with her husband and son in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Bayan-ulgii province, Mongolia. Her husband is a public school teacher and her son goes to kindergarten. She started her clothing sales business in 2002 by selling a small variety of products. Now, she sells all kinds of garments such as shoes, pants, and jackets, and her daily income is 80,000 Mongolia Tughriks (MNT). 

Now that winter is approaching, Guljainar needs to buy warm clothes to retail. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says "I started my business from a scratch, I never thought I would go this far, now that I came here, I have bright vision for my business." She is requesting 3,000,000 MNT to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Chi Primus Ngwa

texts.en:
He is 28 years old. He is married and has two children with none of them below fifteen years of age. He lives with his family in a two bedroom apartment in End of Tar, Longla. The death of his uncles who drowned in a river, the death of his mother during childbirth, the death of his sister who left her children in his care and joblessness are some of the sad memories he has.

He joined GHAPE in 2009 and has received and successfully repaid Empowerment Credit just once. He invested this loan in his glycerine business. He used the profit from this business to sponsor his children in school.

Given a loan, he will still invest in the glycerine business. He believes that this business will be a success because he has years of experience in this business. He thinks that this business will be of help to the community in that he will bring the product closer to the people, saving the stress of moving long distances to get glycerine to rub on themselves.

With the proceeds from this loan, he will educate his children, clothe himself and his children and also equip his house. He prefers a GHAPE loan because the interest rates are lower and because of the group system.

loans.use: to buy glycerine, omo (soap) and rubbing oil.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia, de 30 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo y sus 3 menores hijos, Jack, Luis y Beto; juntos buscan que salir adelante a base de mucho esfuerzo y trabajo en la localidad de Carampa, que es donde viven. Cada día Silvia se despierta al amanecer y se dirige hacia sus campos de maíz, junto con su esposo para  vigilar sus  tierras, pues la cosecha futura debe ser  muy productiva, saben que con mucho esfuerzo lo lograrán. La agricultura, según dice es una actividad que le genera ganancias regulares que le permiten brindar a su familia una adecuada calidad de vida  le gusta sembrar las tierras ya que sabe cómo hacerlo, lo que no le gusta son las  constantes plagas que muchas veces arruinan gran parte de la cosecha, por eso es necesario la constante vigilancia. Paralelamente se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno, ya que ante cualquier emergencia que se le presente puede vender alguno y ganar dinero .Como es una dama muy luchadora tiene muchos planes para progresar, entre ellos se encuentra el de comprar mayor cantidad de ganado vacuno para continuar en la comercialización. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “carampa” y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde se siente feliz, pues recibe el apoyo de todos ustedes, quienes le permiten seguir en su negocio. Además promete ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, pues su asociación lo conforman personas responsables y solidarias.
Silvia, de recibir su apoyo invertirá el dinero en la compra fertilizantes para esparcir entre sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Silvia is 30 years old.  She lives in her own house with her husband and their three minor children; Jack, Luis, and Beto.  Together they look to get ahead through much effort and work in Carampa, which is where they live.

Silvia gets up at dawn and heads towards the corn fields with her husband in order to tend to their land.  The future harvest should be very productive.  They know that with much effort they will attain a good harvest.  

Farming, according to her, is a business activity that generates regular income.  This allows her to offer her family an adequate quality of life.  She likes to plant the fields because she knows how to do so.  What she does not like are the constant pest infestations that often ruin a big part of the harvest.  That is why constant vigilance is necessary.

At the same time she raises cattle because she can sell some and make money when faced with any emergency.  As a very tenacious woman, she has lots of plans to make progress.  Among these plans is to buy more cattle in order to continue selling them.

She belongs to the Carampa communal bank, and this is her third loan with MFP.  She is happy because she receives support from all of you, which allows her to continue with her business.  She pledges to be punctual with her payments.  Her association is comprised of responsible and supportive people.  Upon receiving your support she will buy fertilizers to spread among her plants.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph operates a quarry site in Tala town where he has been mining for the last four years. He earns a monthly profit of KES 10,000. He is 33 years old, married to Magdalene, and they have four school-going children, aged between 17 and four years.

He has applied for his fifth loan of  KES 45,000 from KADET LTD. He paid back the previous loans fully and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy mining tools.

He will save his anticipated profits to provide basic needs for his family. Joseph hopes to grow his business and be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy mining tools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy grass, clay and wood in order to make tiles

loans.name: Ronald

texts.es:
El socio Ronald se sigue al negocio de venta de ceviche,el tiene locales donde vende ceviche,el socio atiende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño del socio es ampliar y mejorar los locales donde vende ceviche.El socio solicita el credito para comprar insumos para el ceviche como pescado,limon,camote y lechuga al por mayor.

 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Ronald keeps on selling (marinated seafood cocktails). He sells ceviche in leased locales. He works form 8 am to 6 pm, and thanks to this activity he is able to provide for his children. He dreams of expanding and improving the locales where he sells ceviche. He is requesting a loan to buy ingredients for ceviche such as fish, lemon, sweet potato and lettuce at wholesale price.

He is happy about the loan and he commits to complying with the repayment of his dues.

loans.use: To buy fish, lemon, sweet potato and lettuce at wholesale price to prepare ceviche.

loans.name: María Ángela

texts.es: María Ángela de sesenta años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus hijos en casa propia. Ella posee un taller de costura en el lugar de su residencia, confecciona todo tipo de prendas vestidos, camisas, pantalones entre otros, últimamente se ha hecho de mas clientela pues su trabajo es excelente, con materia prima de primera calidad y con precios accesibles además el servicio es incomparable María siempre es muy amable con las personas q la visitan; Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y activa le gusta salir adelante de la competencia, quiere cumplir cada uno de sus propósitos a futuro y su más grande secreto es la paciencia y el amor que le pone a la labor, quiere ver crecer el negocio y es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar tela por mayor . María Ángela tiene la confianza que de esta forma podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María Ángela, 70, lives with her domestic partner and their children in a house of their own. She has a sewing workshop in her house where she makes all kinds of clothing, such as dresses, shirts and trousers, among others.

Recently she has acquired more and more customers because she does an excellent work, with high quality raw materials and at affordable prices, and also because she offers a service that is second to none.

María is always very kind to visitors; she is a hard-working, active woman who likes to stand out from her competitors. She wishes to reach each one of her long-term goals, and her biggest secret is the great amount of patience and love she puts into her business. 

She wants to see her business grow and so asks INTEGRAL for a loan which allows her to buy fabric from wholesalers. María Ángela is confident this way she will be able to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy fabric from wholesalers.

loans.name: Shatha

texts.en:
Shatha is 20 years old and the oldest sister in her family. She is an accounting student at Al Balqaa University and is in her freshman year for her bachelor degree. She hopes to continue to get a higher degree. 
Shatha has a brother, Saif Aldeen, who is 19 years old. He applied to college to major in crime studies. He is in his third year now and hoping that he will be able to find a job in his field.
Shatha has applied for a youth loan to pay for her semester fees and her brother’s. As she is a conservative person, she asked her brother Saif Aldeen to appear in the photo instead.

loans.use: to pay for her and her brother's semester fees.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy is a hardworking woman living in Masindi-Uganda.She runs a bar that sells soft drinks like water and soda but also sells beers.She started up the business to support her family and ensure  quality education of her children after realizing that her husband's meager income could hardly support.Her business dream is to own a wholesale shop and venture into farming despite inadequate capital to meet the high demand.Joy is requesting for a loan to buy beers and soda to sell ahead of the Christmas season.

loans.use: to beers and sodas to sell ahead of the christmas season.

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Mr. Abraham ADAMAMO is a single, 20-year-old man. As he comes from a large, poor family, he abandoned school early to come to Lomé to work as a porter in the large Lomé market. As this job became more and more tiresome without earning him decent wages, he quickly became an unlicensed street vendor in the large intersections of Lomé. With this job he earned a small amount of savings, which allowed him to study for two years to be a barber. As he did not have the financial means to open his own workshop after his training, he worked in a shop helping a friend, who was only taking advantage of him.

A brave a courageous man, Mr. Abraham ADAMAMO has decided to open his own barber shop in order to take his destiny into his own hands. To do so, he is requesting a loan of $950, which will allow him to rent a shop and buy the necessary equipment, such as mechanical and electric clippers and necessary cosmetic products. This very dedicated young man deserves to be supported in order to allow him to better his life and get out of poverty. He would serve as a good example for other young people who are falling into difficult situations.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur A. Abraham est un jeune célibataire âgé de 20 ans. Issu d’une famille nombreuse et pauvre, il abandonna vite ses études pour venir à Lomé exercer le métier de portefaix au grand marché de Lomé. Ce métier devenant de plus en plus pénible sans gain conséquent, il se transforma rapidement en vendeur ambulant à la sauvette aux grands carrefours de Lomé. Par cette activité, il réalisa une petite économie qui lui a permis d’apprendre la coiffure homme pendant 2 ans. N’ayant pas les moyens financiers d’ouvrir son propre atelier après sa formation, il aida un ami dans son atelier qui ne fait que l’exploiter.

Brave et courageux, Monsieur A. Abraham décide d’ouvrir son propre atelier de coiffure afin de prendre en main sa destinée. Pour ce faire, il sollicite un appui financier de $950 qui va lui permettre de louer un local et acheter des matériels nécessaires tels que les tondeuses mécaniques et électriques et les produits de beauté au besoin son activité. Ce jeune homme très dévoué mérite d’être soutenu pour lui permettre de relever son niveau de vie et de sortir de la pauvreté. Ceci sera un bel exemple pour les autres jeunes en divagation et en situation difficile.

loans.use: To rent a shop and buy barber shop equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase beads in bulk

loans.name: Isaack Odhiambo

texts.en: Isaack is 27 years old, and is a budding entrepreneur. He hopes that with this loan, he will be able to acquire more skills in carpentry, which will allow him he to be able to setup a properly licensed furniture making business

loans.use: To jump start his furniture business

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: "I hope to use this loan for the purchase of a generator, weavon hair cream & relaxer," says Mrs. Florence Chukwuji, who lives in Asaba, Delta State, Nigeria. She is 37 years old, and is happily married with (4) children. She started this business eight years ago.

loans.use: To buy a generator, weavons hair cream & relaxer.

loans.name: Yosr

texts.en:
Yosr, 52 years old, married and mother of 3 children, has a small dressmaking shop in the area of Ras Al Nabeh in Beirut. Yosr is an excellent business woman and a very professional seamstress who makes evening and wedding dresses, but also sportswear designs and does clothes repairs upon request.

When we first met her, Yosr was working alone from a small room underground. With the 7 consecutive loans she has borrowed from Al Majmoua, she has been able to quit this "squalid" place, rent a large atelier on the 1st floor of a much nicer building, buy some new sewing machines, and recruit 3 seamstresses. She has kept expanding her base of clients till a point where 24 hours a day is not enough for her to answer all the requests she receives.

Yosr plans to keep expanding her business till she feels she is financially secure and able to cover the university expenses of her children. Yosr now needs a loan in the amount of US$ 1,200 to purchase fabrics, threads and other accessories.

loans.use: purchase fabrics, threads and other accessories

loans.name: Sandra Elva

texts.es:
Sandra Elva suffered a tremendous illness which left her unemployed for a long time. Before she got sick, she had a small gift store which she had to transfer to keep her clients happy. Now she got the store back and she is willing to move forward, one more time. Therefore, she started selling shoes by catalog.

The fight is still on. In many occasions she has fallen and risen again because catalog sales do not provide a fixed income. Therefore, she is requesting a US $300 loan which she will repay in four months. With this money, Sandra will be able to purchase the orders clients have already requested. She will also be able to purchase Christmas gifts to offer her clients. With your help Sandra will be able to move on after this terrible illness.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Sandra Elva, sufrió de una terrible enfermedad, que la dejó sin poder trabajar por un largo tiempo. Antes de enfermarse tenía una pequeña tienda de regalos, la cual tuvo que traspasar para que esta no perdiera la clientela, y ya que se recuperó, está dispuesta a salir adelante, nuevamente, y por lo tanto comenzó vendiendo zapatos por catálogo.

Sin embargo la lucha sigue en pie, y necesita en muchas ocasiones, caer y volverse a levantar, puesto que el negocio de la venta por catálogo no representa un ingreso fijo. Por lo tanto está solicitando un crédito de US $300 para pagarlos en un plazo de 4 meses, y con este dinero Sandra podrá comprar los pedidos que ya le hicieron y comprar artículos navideños para poder ofrecérselos entre sus clientas. Con tu ayuda Sandra podrá salir delante después de este terrible acontecimiento.

loans.use: Purchase new products for Christmas' sales.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Client History : Rosa sells perfumes and cosmetics by magazine order. She does not have very much capital and her goal is to increase her capital so that she can offer her products on credit.

She lives in Callapa. She does not have a fixed post so she sells her products walking through the markets. This is the second time that she’s requesting a loan and Kiva’s support. She paid her last loan back in December and now she is asking for a new loan. Her file qualifies her as a category 1 client, meaning that she has paid her loans back on time. The amount requested will be used to buy merchandise (perfumes, cosmetics, etc.).

Her work enables her to receive this loan because she has experience in her business, the income from which is enough to cover the loan.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Historia del Cliente: La señora Rosa vende perfumes y cosméticos mediante revista, no cuenta con mucho capital y su objetivo es tener más capital para que pueda ofrecer sus productos a crédito.

Vive en Callapa, no cuenta con un puesto fijo ya que ofrece sus productos ambulando por los mercados. Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito y el apoyo de kiva, su última cuota ha sido cancelada en el mes de diciembre por lo que solicita un nuevo crédito; su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su obligación. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de mercadería (perfumes y cosméticos, etc.)

Su trabajo le permite acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio, el cual le da ingresos para cubrir el préstamo.

loans.use: To purchase perfumes and cosmetics for her business

loans.name: Anita

texts.es:
For 16 years Anita has helped her husband, a painter, with the household expenses with her food stand in the market.

Thanks to the Ceviche (seafood dish) and Chanfainita (traditional beef dish) sales, Rita has been able to provide a better education to her two children and maintain her home.

Now that her children are preparing to go to the university, Anita would like to open a grocery store which would bring her greater income.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Desde hace 16 años, Anita ayuda con la economía a su esposo pintor con su puesto de comida en el mercado.

Gracias a la venta de Cebiche y Chanfainita (plato típico a base de res) , Rita ha podido brindarles una mejor educación a sus dos hijos y arreglar su casa.

Ahora que sus hijos se preparan para la universidad, Anita quisiera poner una tienda de abarrotes que le brindaría mayores ingresos.

loans.use: Open a grocery store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Continue investing in more merchandise

loans.name: Rahma's Raia Mwema Group

texts.en:
Rahma is 44 years old and is a married woman with 5 children, ages 25, 23, 21, 19 and 17 years old. Rahma is a cloth seller. She started her business in 2007. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $78 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more cloth for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in tailoring, food vending, tatique sales, and charcoal sales.

loans.use: To buy more cloth for her business.

loans.name: Mishi

texts.en:
Mishi is 30 years old and is a single woman with 2 children, ages 6 months and 8 years old. Mishi is a clothes seller. She started her business in 2005. Everyday, she works from 8am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Bibi

texts.en:
Bibi R. is a hard working, 57 year old mother of five. She's a resident of Temeke in Dar Es Salaam.

Bibi has been doing business for the past twenty years, and the profits have helped her sustain her family. She runs a restaurant selling all sorts of common seals in the Temeke market. She is in need of a loan to help her expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her restaurant

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr:
Adjo Veronique A. is 41 years old, married and has no children. She is a merchant and has been selling cereals for more than 10 years in Kpalime, a town located around 120 kilometers from Lome, the capital of Togo.
