She would like to purchase 20 bags of corn, 15 bags of meal and 15 bags of beans with this loan in order to satisfy an ever increasing demand from customers. This opportunity will help her to earn more money and to better fund the needs of her family, especially her two young brothers who are still in school.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Adjo V. A. est âgée de 41 ans, mariée sans enfants. Elle est revendeuse de céréales depuis plus de 10 ans à Kpalimé, une ville située à environ 120 kilomètres de Kpalimé, la capitale togolaise. Elle désire avec ce crédit améliorer la capacité de son activité en achetant 20 sacs de maïs, 15 sacs de mil, 15 sacs de haricots afin de satisfaire la demande sans cesse croissante de sa clientèle. Cette opportunité lui permettra de gagner plus d’argent et de subvenir aux besoins de ses deus petits frères encore sur les bancs de l’école.

loans.use: To purchase 20 bags of corn, 15 bags of meal, and 15 bags of beans.

loans.name: Takolo Group

texts.en:
Adama T. is 38 years old and married with children; she has to work hard to supplement her husbands income in order to support the family. Adama's husband runs a small kiosk in the outskirts of Magburaka town, Sierre Leone, while Adama sells utensils in the town. With her previous loan from SMT, Adama is experiencing an increase in her stock and income.

Adama is the leader for a group of entrepreneurs. The solidarity of the group is very strong, and they guarantee each other for loans. Mabinty K. also sells dishes, while Isata J. and Fatmata K. sell palm oil. The members would like to increase their stock and income, and are therefore requesting a loan for this purpose.

loans.use: To purchase more utensils/dishes and palm oil to increase income

loans.name: Scholar's Maendeleo Group

texts.en:
Scholar J. is 31 years old. She is married with two children aged twelve and ten. She has been a clothes seller since 2004. Every day, she works from 8am to 12pm at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $175 from her sales.

Scholar now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes to sell. She will share this loan with her group members Subira and Shamim, who have businesses dealing in juice and oil sales.

loans.use: To buy more clothing inventory.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is 32 years old. She is married with 3 children aged 12, 5 and 2 years old. She has been a potatoes and tomatoes seller since February 2008. Every day, she works from 9am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

Asha now looking for a loan to buy more potatoes and tomatoes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes and potatoes for her business.

loans.name: Uch

texts.en:
Uch S., 43, is married and lives with her husband and one of her three children in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. Since 1998, she has been making small grinding mills from her home and is able to make US$2 each day. Her husband is a worker and makes US$5 per day.

Uch S. would like to take out a loan of US$1000 to purchase more stone to increase the number of grinding mills she has available for resale. (She is pictured with her family.)

loans.use: To purchase more stone for making grinding mills.

loans.name: Mujeres Hacia Al Progreso 1 Group

texts.en:
This group of five women has experienced great success. Each has started her own small business, and the businesses continue to improve with each loan cycle. Some of these women are on their seventh loan cycle and still want to grow. Maria F. is the group representative and a very hard-working mother of one child. She has a business selling clothing in her area. She buys the clothing for very low prices and then sells it in her small store. She started with almost nothing, and today is earning a income sufficient to feed her child and to provide his education. She is very thankful for all the help she has received and wants to continue improving her life. She dreams of traveling some day, and being able to have a nice house.

On behalf of Maria, the group, and Esperanza International, thank you for your support!

loans.use: Purchasing clothing for resale

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is a member of the Nueva Era (New Era) Village Bank. She is married, has one daughter, and lives in the Magdalena neighborhood of Ayacucho. Ana sells clothing, sheets, blankets, and anything else her clients request. She buys her products in Lima (a 9-hour bus riD. from Ayacucho). She travels to Lima every so often, depending on demand. Ana needs a loan of 3000 soles to buy light jackets, sweaters, and sheets.  Ana’s dreams are to stay healthy and to improve her business.

 Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Ana es socia del Banco Comunal Nueva Era. 
Ana es casada y tiene 1 hija, Ana vive en el Barrio D. la Magdalena, Ana venD. ropa para las diferentes edades, sabanas, frazadas, y todo cuanto le pidan sus clientes, sus ventas son al crédito, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad D. Lima a donD. viaja dependiendo D. la demanda. 
Ana necesita un préstamo D. 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. casacas, chompas y sabanas. 
Los sueños D. Ana son que su negocio mejore y estar bien D. salud.

loans.use: Buy light jackets, sweaters, and sheets

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
La Sra. Blanca es madre soltera con  2 hijos menores, ellos son su compañía y el motivo de su lucha de todos los días, procurando poder darles lo mejor.
Ella tiene una despensa bien surtida y muy conocida en le barrio.
Su hijo mayor tiene 12 años y el le ayuda en con las tareas en  la despensa.
Consiguió montar su despensa con un poco de dinero que le había regalado su padre para poder iniciar su negocio.
Sus hijos estudian en la escuelita del barrio.
Ella es una persona muy luchadora y honesta, conocida y querida por todos los que viven en ese barrio. Ella ha demostrado ser responsable con el pago de sus cuotas cumpliendo exactamente con sus obligaciones con la institución en las fechas pactadas previamente.
texts.en:
Blanca is a single mother with two young sons. They are her companions and her motivation to fight each day in order to provide the best for them. She has a well-stocked despensa (small shop that sells basic necessities) that is well known in her neighborhood. Her older son is twelve years old and helps her with all the tasks in the shop. She was able to open her shop with a small amount of money that her father gave to her. Her children study at a neighborhood school. She is a fighter and she is honest, known and loved by the entire neighborhood. She has proven herself to be responsible with her loan repayments, completing all of her obligations with the lender by the agreed-upon dates.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, rice, noodles, breads, flour, and other items.

loans.name: Malika

texts.ru: Гулова Малика жительница города Яван. Возраст 38 лет, замужем и имеет семерых детей. Семья очень большая , поэтому для того. чтобы ее прокормить ей и ее мужу приходится много работать. Она сама занимается земледелием . На участке земли , который они имеют она сажает картофель, урожай которого частично идет на рынок и продается оптом , а часть оставляет себе. планируемый кредит хочет использовать для того , чтобы закупить семена картофеля. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 8 месяцев.
texts.en:
Malika G. lives in the town of Yavan. She is 38 years old, married and has seven children. Her family is very large and to sustain it she and her husband have to work a lot. She is in agriculture. They have a plot of land where they plant potatoes and then they sell part of the harvest on the market and keep the other part for themselves. Malika plans to use the loan to buy potato seeds. She will be able to pay off the loan within 8 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy potato seeds

loans.name: Meas

texts.en: Meas T. is 55 years old and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. She sells used clothes at the market and earns approximately $10 each day. Her husband is a construction foreman. He has been in business for 10 years and makes $20 per day. This couple has two children. Mrs. Meas requests a loan of $1000 to purchase more construction tools for her husband.

loans.use: Construction tools

location.town: Tboung Kmum district, Kampong Cham province, Cambo

loans.name: Mabia

texts.fr: Cette dame habite le quartier d’agoè gbonvié, elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants, son mari est un chauffeur. Elle exerce comme activité la vente de boisson locale appelé toucoutou faite à base de farine de sorgho et très appréciée au Togo surtout au nord. Ce commerce lui permet d’aider son mari car le revenu de son mari est insuffisant pour subvenir aux charges du foyer. Elle fait ce commerce depuis 1999, actuellement son stock de matière nécessaire à la fabrication du toucoutou est épuisé c’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite de wages un prêt pour l’achat d’un sac de sorgho
texts.en:
This woman lives in the Agoè Gbonvié neighborhood, she's married to a driver and the mother of 4 children. Her business consists in selling a local beverage called "toucoutou", made out of sorghum flour and very much appreciated in Togo, especially in the North. This business enables her to help her husband, because his income does not suffice to pay for the household expenses. She's been running this business since 1999, and she's currently out of stock of raw materials required to make "toucoutou". She's thus seeking a loan from Kiva's partner WAGES, in order to buy a sack of sorghum.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy one sack of sorghum

loans.name: Cipriana

texts.en:
Cipriana, 49 years old, is married and lives in San Vicente Bajo. She has 2 children; one of them is studying in college. Her husband is a government employee. Together with her parents, she displays “guinamos” (i.e., salted fish) in the public market. She sells the salted fish during market days in Aloran and Oroquieta City every Sunday and Saturday. She sells it in volume.

On other days, a “sari-sari” (variety) store in their house is her business. Being a MIGS member, she has already accessed 15 loans. Now, for her 16th, she is applying for PHP 36,000 to buy cans of salted fish and additional goods for her sari-sari store. She plans to renovate their house someday.

loans.use: to buy cans of salted fish and goods for "sari-sari" store

loans.name: Talaloa

texts.en: Talaloa M., 26, is married with 2 children.  She has 2 years of experience in the BBQ business. She sells to the village people and the general public 6 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala ($187 USD). SPBD loans are Talaloa’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She plans to use her loan to upgrade the business.

loans.use: Purchase mutton flaps, chicken legs, and soy sauce for BBQ business

loans.name: Flavia Velantina

texts.es: Doña Flavio O. cuenta con 47 años de edad, es casada de oficios Talabartera, “Elaboración de Calzado para dama” cuenta con un taller de 2 maquinas, habita junto a con  su  esposo e hijos,  se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con tres empleados para la misma actividad,  lleva 12 años de elaborar calzado en su residencia que se encuentra en Caserío Xetinimit de la Aldea de Nimasac, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su hija, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Flavio O. is 47 years old and in the leather crafts trade making women’s footwear. She has a workshop with 2 machines, and lives with her husband and children who also dedicate themselves to this craft. They have three employees and have been running the business from their house, in the town of Nimasac, Totonicapán, Guatemala, for twelve years. Currently, they find that customer demand has gone up but they don’t have the financial resources to augment their working capital. For this reason, they turned to the ASDIR Association to request a loan with the intention of using it to purchase raw materials. This would allow them to increase their sales and, they hope, help them support their daughter and afford them all a better standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Handicrafts (Increase of Capital).

loans.name: Muhtorali

texts.ru: Мухторали 43 года. Он женат и отец 3-х детей. Его жена нигде не работает. Она сидит дома и делает домашнюю работу, кормит скот. Мухторали занимается откормом и продажей скота. Наступление лета для Мухторали – это сезон закупа скота, потому, что весной скот и его корм стоит дешево. И для откорма скота не надо много тратиться. Скот ест горную траву, и Мухторали экономит на корме скота. С наступлением зимы Мухторали продает часть откормившегося скота. Но он не покупает скот. Он покупает корм, для откорма оставшегося скота.
texts.en:
Muhtorali is 43 years old. He is married and is a father of three children. His wife does not work. She stays at home and does housework and feeds the cattle. Muhtorali breeds and sells cattle. The summer is the season to buy cattle for Muhtarali because in the spring the cattle and fodder cost cheaper. So he does not have to spend a lot. The cattle eats mountain grass and Muhtorali saves on the fodder. With the arrival of winter he sells part of the grown cattle, but he does not buy more. He buys fodder for feeding of the rest of the cattle.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Feeding and selling of cattle

loans.name: Dionicio Alipio

texts.es:
Dionicio es socia del Bancomunal  Mar del Plata.
Dionicio es casado tiene 66 años, tres hijos , son mayores y están casados.
Dionicio era transportista pero tuvo que dejarlo por la edad, la vista ya no le daba y se cansaba mucho, entonces es cuando hace ochos años  decidió abrir en su casa una bodega, trabaja con su esposa. 
Desde que Dionicio esta en Finca es una  ayuda  para su  negocio, se siente contento.
Dionicio necesita un préstamo de  800 soles, para surtir su bodega y comprar arroz, azúcar y leche. 
El sueño de Dionicio mantenerse en el negocio junto con su esposa.
texts.en:
Dionicio is a member of the Sea of Silver Communal Bank. Dionicio is married, 66 years old, and has three children who are grown and married. Dionicio worked in public transportation, but he had to quit that because of his age - he couldn't see well and he got tired often, so eight years ago he decided to open a store out of his home, working with his wife. Since Dionicio has been working with Kiva partner Finca, which is helping him with his business, he has been happy. Dionicio needs a loan of 800 soles to stock his store and buy rice, sugar, and milk. Dionicio's dream is it to run the business with his wife.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock the store and purchase rice, sugar, and milk

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma tiene 39 años, tiene 3 hijos que viven junto a ella en su casa propia. Hace varios años atrás se dedicaba a la venta de tamales, en este negocio le iba muy bien, con lo que terminó de construir su casa y educar a sus hijos. Pero tras las lluvias constantes del invierno pasado se generaron derrumbes provocando deslizamientos de tierras y perjudicando la parte donde estaba su cocina de leña. Desde entonces ya no prepara tamales, optó por la venta de buñuelos cobrado 1 sol por porción. A Vilma le gusta su trabajo por eso que a partir de las 6 de la tarde está ubicada al costado del puente Paucartambo hasta 9 o 10 de la noche, por ser un  lugar muy transitado por sus vecinos y pobladores de otras zonas aledañas. Vilma ameniza sus ventas con su buen carácter lo que le ha permitido captar mucha clientela, ya que en 3 meses logró que su negocio le sea muy rentable y con estas ganancias espera volver a implementar el espacio que tenía para la venta de tamales, lo cual haría por las mañanas y en las tardes continuaría con sus buñuelos acompañados con miel. Este es el quinto préstamo consecutivo que viene trabajando con MFP, Vilma es muy  responsable con sus cuotas y no le gusta pagar fuera de tiempo; es por eso que anima a sus compañeros de banco comunal para que no paguen a último momento. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de harina y aceite, ingredientes básicos para la preparación de los buñuelos.
texts.en:
Vilma, 39, lives together with her three children in her own house. She has been selling tamales for several years. Because this business went very well for her, she finished building her house and can educate her children. But, the constant rains last winter caused erosion, which cause landslides that damaged the area where her wood stove was. Since then she does not make tamales. She chose to sell “buñuelos” (fritters). She charges one PEN per portion. Vilma likes her work. At six in the evening she is at the side of the Paucartambo bridge until nine or ten at night. It is an area which is heavily traveled by her neighbors and residents of nearby zones. Vilma brightens up her sales with her good character, which has allowed her to get many customers. In three months she was able to make her business very profitable. With these earnings she hopes to return to the space she had set up to sell tamales. She would sell tamales in the morning, and in the afternoons she would continue to sell her buñuelos with honey. This is her fifth consecutive loan working with MFP. Vilma is very responsible with her payments; she does not like to make a late payment. She encourages her colleagues in her Community Bank to not pay at the last minute. The money she is asking for is to buy flour and oil, which are the basic ingredients in making her buñuelos.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients for he buñuelos

loans.name: Nadejda

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Надежде 58 лет имеет одного сына.Сын учится в политехническом институте. Сама Надежда работает кассир-контролером в спец автобазе. Свободное время от работы ездит в районы Согдийской обл. на продажу посуды. В период кредитования она улучшила свой жизненный уровень и на запрашиваемой кредит хочет расширить свой ассортимент товара.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Nadejda is 58 years old, she has one son. Her son is studying in a polytechnic university. Nadejda herself works as a cashier controller at a car dealership. In her free time she travels to the regions of the Sogdiyskaya county to sell china. During her credit history she has improved her living standards and wants to use the loan to increase the assortment of her merchandise.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy china

loans.name: Muhabatkhon

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
      Мухабатхон 56 лет, замужем и мать 4-х детей. Мухабатхон - портниха, она шьет платья а ее дочь продает их на рынке Джума-базари Якшанбе-базар города Худжанда. Мухабатхон шьет женские национальные платья из разных тканей. Она закупает ткани из рынка Атуш и Сомон. Там ткани на много дешевле чем в других рынках. Мухабатхон собирается закупить ткань "велюр" для осеннего сезона. Уже с сентября станет немного прохладно, и все женщины начнут носить платья из велюра. Для этого Мухабатхон просит займ.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Muhabatkhon is 56 years old, she is married and is a mother of four children. Muhabatkhon is a seamstress, she sews dresses and her daughter sells them on the Djuma-bazar and Yakshanbe-bazar in the town of Khudjand. Muhabatkhon sews women's traditional dresses from different fabrics. She buys the fabrics on the Atush and Somon markets. The fabrics are much cheaper there than on other markets. Muhabatkhon plans to buy velour fabrics for the autumn season. Starting in September it will become a little colder and all women will start wearing dresses from velour. Muhatatkhon is requesting a loan for this.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy velour fabrics

loans.name: Ana Lee

texts.en:
Ana Lee G. lives in the village of Pagatpat, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 27 years old, married and has two infants. To make a living, she has just opened a sari-sari (or variety) retail store that sells various products.

Earlier this year, Ana Lee joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. Ana Lee is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy additional products to sell. She hopes that this loan, her first, will generate enough income to improve her family's living conditions. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell

location.town: Pagatpat, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Guido

texts.es: Es un cliente antiguo de banca comunal oriundo del beni , hace muchos años radica en santa cruz  vive  en la casa de su tia; desde hace 5 años se dedica a ofrecer el servicio de mariachi canta para dar serentas , en fiestas, cumpleanos y otros junto con un grupo de compañeros que se dedican a lo mismo. Tiene una hijita de 5 años la cual vive con el. El Sr guido necesita un medio de transporte para poder moverse de su domicilio al lugar de trabajo ya que le contratan a altas horas de la noche y el taxi le sale muy caro , el cuenta con el 50% del dinero y nosotros le financiamos la otra parte
texts.en:
He is an old client of the Oriundo del Beni Community Bank. He has been in Santa Cruz for many years. He lives in his aunt’s house. He has been offering his services to sing Mariachi for five years. He sings together with a group of colleagues to give serenades at parties, birthdays, and others. He has a small five year old daughter who lives with him. He needs a method of transportation to be able to get from his home to the place that he works. They hire him to work until late at night, and taxis are very expensive. He has 50% of the money, and we will finance the other part.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for 50% of a motorcycle

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie has been managing a general store for four years. She is married and they have three children. According to Lanie, having a family is not easy, especially providing them with the best education. They are living in Dalig Viejo, Burgos, Isabela. Her monthly profit from her business is Php 4,000 and it is already a big help to meet the needs of their family.

Lanie would like to request a loan amounting to PHP 27,000 that she can use as additional capital for her general store. This amount will help her to make her business grow as well as improving their living conditions.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Noe

texts.es:
Noe tiene 45 años, es padre soltero y vive con sus 3 hijos, quienes vienen estudiando en el nivel secundario del colegio. Él cuenta con 10 hectáreas cultivadas de arroz y como ya está en temporada de siembra, necesita contratar personal para el cultivo de su producto. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es mantenerse ocupado y velar por el mantenimiento de su chacra. Él considera que su actividad es rentable porque su producto lo vende directamente en el mercado de su zona y sus compradores son generalmente mayoristas quienes están a la espera de su producción. Para más adelante, Noe desea incursionar en la siembra de café.  
Este es su  primer préstamo con MFP, es nuevo en un banco comunal,  pero ya tienen una buena impresión de sus compañeros de grupo, pues ha notado que son personas responsables y muy trabajadoras. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará más granos de arroz para seguir sembrando en su chacra, también contratara al personal necesario para trabajar en sus chacras.

loans.use: Compra de semilla

loans.name: Milagros

texts.es:
Milagros es una mujer trabajadora y dinámica, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali,  tiene 42 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general, pues tiene una bodega en su casa. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Soñadoras ll” desde hace tres años, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que lo utilizó en la compra de bebidas.
Actualmente ella requiere un crédito de 1500 soles que será utilizado para comprar abarrotes (fideos, azúcar, detergente, leche, etc.) y surtir su negocio. La meta de Milagros es tener una tienda mas grande y seguir adelante en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Milargros is a hard-working and dynamic woman. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She is 42. She sells general groceries; she has a convenience store in her house. She has been part of the Mujeres Soñadoras II for three years. Her first loan was for 300 PEN, which she used to buy drinks. She currently needs a loan for 1,500 PEN to buy groceries (noodles, sugar, detergent, milk, etc.) to stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy groceries to stock her store

loans.name: Maria Ivone

texts.pt:
Maria T. nasceu no distrito da Manhiça, Província de Maputo, tem 55 anos de idade, viúva e mãe de 1 filho de 20 anos de idade. Fez o magistério primário e ainda tenciona continuar para o ano seguinte, vive numa casa cedida pelos familiares, porque alugou a sua antiga casa. Sustenta a sua neta e mãe, enviando mensalmente géneros alimentícios e dinheiro para o pagamento de água e luz.

Saiu de manhiça ainda jovem, para Matola rio, na cidade de do mesmo nome, com seus pais, quando estes foram transferidos pelos serviços. Trabalhou nas Linhas aéreas de Moçambique durante 27 anos e reformou ha 2 anos.
Tem uma pensão mensal de 5.850.00mt mais 12.000.00mt provenientes da renda de casa. Poupa algum valor mensalmente no banco comercial BARCLAYS.

Já teve um empréstimo no NOVO BANCO, para a compra de material de construção e depois de terminar, decidiu não continuar devido a vários motivos. 
Conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma amiga vizinha que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 25.000.00mt, com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (tijoleiras, portas e chapas de zinco) para continuar com a sua obra.

Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo, afim de poder aceder a mais empréstimos. No futuro deseja solicitar mais empréstimos para a conclusão da sua obra.
texts.en:
Maria T. was born in the district of Manhiça, in the Province of Maputo. She is 55 years old, a widow, and mother of one 20 year old son. She completed the first year of her elementary teaching credential, and intends to continue through next year. She lives in a house lent to her by relations, since she rented out her old house. She supports her granddaughter and mother, sending them food and money to pay the water and light.

She left Manhiça for the city of Matola with her parents when they were transferred there for work. She worked for the Mozambique National Airlines for 27 years, and retired two years ago. She has a monthly pension of 5,850 MZN, plus 12,000 MZN from renting out her house. She saves something every month at the Barclay's commercial bank.

She received a previous loan from Novo Banco to purchase construction material and after finishing the loan she decided not to continue for various reasons. She learned about Hluvuku through a nearby friend who is also a client of the organization. With this first loan of 25,000 MZN from Hluvuku, she plans to buy construction material (tiles, doors and galvanized sheets) to finish her home.

She intends to pay back this loan promptly, in order to be able to receive further loans. She would like to apply for additional loans in the future to complete the work on her house.

Translated from Portuguese by David Kaisel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials (cement and others)

loans.name: Maximina Angela

texts.es:
La señora  MAXIMINA ANGELA Z. D. V., tiene  59 años, vive en el distrito D. la BUENOS AIRES provincia D. Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS II. Ella presenta estudios hasta 6to  D. primaria, refiere que por motivos económicos ella empezó desD. pequeña a trabajar, es casada  y  tiene 6 hijos, todos mayores quienes la apoyan económicamente a ella y también cuando se encuentra mal D. salud llevándola al medico y comprándole sus medicamentos. La socia se dedica  a venta D. menús en su domicilio y con sus primer crédito D. 300.00 nuevos soles compro: arroz, papas, fideos, azúcar, aceite, pollo, etc. para la preparación D. sus menús.  COn este crédito D. 300.00 nuevos soles comprará mesas y sillas para dar una mejor atención a sus clientes.
Maximina sueña con tener su restaurante.
texts.en:
Ms. Maximina Angela Z. D. Vasques is 59 years old, and lives in the district of Buenos Aires, en Trujillo Province, in the Department of La Libertad, Peru. She belongs to the communal bank “Mujeres Emprededoras II.” She completed her school studies through 6th graD. of primary school, but states that for financial reasons she has worked since she was small. She is married and has 6 children, all of whom are adults and support her economically and also help with buying medicines and going to the doctor. She runs a restaurant out of her home and with her first loan of 300 Peruvian Nuevo Soles bought rice, potatoes, noodles, sugar, oil, chicken, etc for the preparation of the items on her menu. With this loan of 300 PEN she will buy tables and chairs to proviD. better service to her customers. Maximina dreams of having her own restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is 30 years old; she is a single business woman running a shop. She will use the loan to purchase a refrigerator and retail items for her shop business, such as boxes of soap, water, salt, sugar, and so forth, to expand her business. She would like to stock the basics to meet her customers' needs. Her future dream is to renovate her house.

loans.use: To purchase items that will expand her business

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es:
A sus 58 años de edad, el señor Marcelino R. se dedica a su actividad de triciclo trasladando personas de un lugar a otro en su propio triciclo laborando a diario desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana con el fin de obtener el ingreso para llevarlo a su casa de habitación y así beneficiar a su familia que tanto requiere de su apoyo.

El crédito lo está solicitando porque necesita comprar materiales de construcción porque ha iniciado a mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y para ello le urge obtener dichos materiales porque ha decidido beneficiar a su familia compuesta por su esposa y sus cinco hijos que están bajo su responsabilidad.
Espera que el crédito le será otorgado sin problemas y de esta manera mejorará las condiciones de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
At 58 years old, Marcelino Ramirez works transporting people in his three-wheel from one place to another, working everyday starting early in the morning with the purpose to obtain income to bring home and help his family in need. The loan requested is to buy construction materials to make improvements to his house and this way benefit his wife and five children that are his responsibility. He hopes the loan is provided without any problems and this way he will improve his family's quality of life and his own.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Encarna

texts.es:
La señora Encarna, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Audaces”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia de Moyobamba y Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 52 años y es madre de 06 hijos,  ya independientes.

Encarna, es una mujer que ha podido superar muchas dificultades en su camino de vida, las ganas de salir adelante le dieron muy buenos resultados y hoy en día, se dedica a la venta de bebidas gasificadas, negocio que hoy en la actualidad, le esta dando muy buenos resultados,  se siente muy contenta por lo logrado. Se encuentra ubicada en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, en su misma casa, donde atiende a sus clientes, con la amabilidad y carisma, que siempre la ha caracterizado. 

Es ella quien administra su negocio, sin tener un horario y un jefe. Nos cuenta que se inicio con un capital de  S/. 500.00 y se inicio con 02 paquetes de gaseosas, vio que le iba muy bien, por lo que poco a poco fue invirtiendo mas. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, comprará más bebidas como: paquetes de gaseosas en diferentes sabores, tamaños y marcas, como también agua mineral con gas y sin gas.
 
Encarna, esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla cuando más lo necesitaba, es responsable con sus cuotas de pago y piensa seguir así.
texts.en:
Señora Encarna belongs to the Banco Comunal 'Mujeres Audaces', Moyobamba District, Moyobamba Province, San Martín Department. She is single, is 52 years old and is the mother of 6 children, all independent. Encarna is a woman who has been able to overcome many difficulties in her life's path. The desire to move forward has given her very good results and now she works selling soft drinks, a business which today gives her very good results. She feels very content with what she has achieved. You can find her in a well air-conditioned area in her own home, where she attends to her clients with the amiability and charisma which have always characterised her. It is Encarna that administers her business, without having a timetable or boss. She tells us that she began with capital of S/. 500.00 and 2 packets of soft drink. She saw that this went very well, so little by little she began investing more. With this loan of S/. 2,000.00 she will buy more soft drinks such as: packets of soft drinks in different flavours, sizes and brands, and also still and sparkling mineral water. Encarna is very thankful for the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping her when she needed it most. She is responsbile with her loan repayments and thinks to continue the same way.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase packets of softdrinks

loans.name: Janeth's Group

texts.en:
Janeth M. is from the village of General Balao, Solana, Cagayan. She is 37 years old. Janeth is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Janeth is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Janeth works in someone else's business venture in the retail sector, operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Janeth has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Janeth joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Janeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. Janeth is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the second loan taken out by Janeth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 21 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Walter Rolando

texts.es:
En el departamento de Chinandega, el señor Walter F. se destaca como una persona muy trabajador que ha sabido velar por el bienestar de su hogar compuesto por sus hijos y su cónyuge. El señor Walter ha iniciado la mejora de su vivienda porque había estado en malas condiciones y al haber iniciado dicha mejora está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de los materiales de construcción tales como 20 hojas de zinc, 10 libras de clavos, 12alfajillas y 10clavadores.

Espera que el crédito le sea otorgado de manera rápida para realizar dicha obra y así continuar mejorando las condiciones de vida de su amada familia.
texts.en:
In Chinandega department, Walter F. is noted for being a very hard-working person who has seen to the wellbeing of his family, composed of his wife and children. Walter has begun to do some home improvements because his dwelling had been in poor condition. Having started this project, he asked for funding to buy building materials like: 20 sheets of zinc metal, 10 pounds of nails, 12 window or door frames, 10 nail drivers. He hopes the loan will be granted quickly so that he can do this project and continue improving his beloved family's living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Hanu

texts.fr: A 33ans cette dame est mariée à un monsieur qui est un chauffeur, ils ont 02 enfants, elle s'est lancée en 2000 dans le commerce du bois de chauffage, avec ce qu'elle gagne de ce commerce elle contribue financièrement aux charges de sa famille, elle s'approvisionne au nord du Togo parce que le coût d'achat du bois de chauffage lui revient moins chers et elle veut rehausser son stock de bois de chauffage raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES  son tout premier crédit pour l'achat de 20 tas de bois de chauffage et assurer le transport de la marchandises.
texts.en:
At 33 years of age, this lady is married to a gentleman who is a driver, and they have two children. In 2002, she embarked on a business of selling firewood, and devotes the revenue generated by this activity to family expenses. She gets her supplies from the North of Togo, because of lower prices for firewood. She wants to increase her stock of firewood which explains why she is requesting a first loan from WAGES, to buy 20 loads of firewood including transportation costs.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy firewood

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
La Sra. Dominga tiene 46 años y esta casada con el Sr. Leopoldo de 58 años, cuenta con seis hijos mayores dos casados y con hijos  todos ellos trabajando. 
Ella siempre trabajo como empleada domestica, cuando su marido se accidento en su trabajo ella decidió trabajar en su casa realizando artículos de limpieza, actualmente cuenta con varios clientes. 
Le gustaría en el futuro abrir para su fabrica en su domicilio y que sus hijos le ayuden.
texts.en:
Dominga, 46, is married to Leopoldo, 58; they have 6 adult children, who are all employed; two are married and have children of their own. She had always worked as a domestic employee. When her husband was injured at work, she decided to work from home making cleaning supplies; she has several customers now. In the future, she would like to open a factory in her home and have her children help her with it.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make cleaning supplies.

loans.name: Ramota

texts.en:
Ramota, 40,  is married with three children. She sells foodstuffs like yams, beans, peppers, tomatoes, and smoked fish in her shop in Lagos. She is very happy because she loves the business which she has been in since childhood. She has been a member of LAPO microfinance for some years.

Ramota is very enthusiastic about the success of her business and that of her family. She hopes for the loan of NGN 50,000 to buy more foodstuffs in bulk to sell. She hopes to pay back her loan by the due date. She says thanks to LAPO and Kiva for their initiative.

loans.use: To  purchase more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Mabula Group

texts.en:
Simon M., a 29-year-old married father of a three-and-a-half-year-old child, has operated a table-top business selling fruits and vegetables since 2000. Working from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily, he is able to make a monthly profit of about $270. To increase his business stock, Simon is requesting his first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He will share this loan with his loan group Mabula, which consists of 11 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan.

In the picture, Simon is first on the right in the second row.

loans.use: To increase business stock

loans.name: Diariétou

texts.fr: Diariétou M. est âgée de 60 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 14 ans et demi et a 15 fois de suite reçu de crédit et n'a jamais eu de difficulté de remboursement. Elle est vendeuse d'huile de palme et son nouveau prêt lui permettra de renforcer son activité et d'augmenter ses revenus financiers. Son objectif est de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille, de subvenir à ses besoins personnels et d'assurer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Dianké M. is 60 years old, married and the mother of five children. She has been a member of the local « Banc Villageois » loan group for 14 ½ years and has been granted 15 successive loans, all reimbursed without problems. She retails palm oil, and her new loan will enable her to reinforce her activity and increase her revenues. Her objective is to participate in the improvement of her family’s living conditions, meet her personal needs and ensure her children’s schooling.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Reinforce and promote her activity selling palm oil

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr:
Cette femme exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de détail de pagnes et d'eau en sachet appelé "Pure WATER", elle fait ce commerce il y a 2 ans de façon ambulante et s'approvisionne au grand marché de lomé. elle veut éviter une éventuelle rupture de stock, c'est pour cette raison qu'elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat d'une vingtaine de pagnes et de 10 sachets d'eau pure WATER.
elle est célibataire et a une personne à sa charge.
texts.en:
This lady’s revenue-generating activity is the retail commerce of pagnes (colourful West-African fabric) and water packs of the “Pure Water” brand. She has been active in this business for the past two years, as an itinerant vendor, and gets her supplies fron the main market in Lomé. She wishes to avoid depleting her stock and therefore is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 20 pagnes and 10 “Pure Water” water packs. She is unmarried with one person to care for.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pagnes and "Pure Water" water packs

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Mrs. Kim M., is 46 years old and her husband, Mr. Vorng Horn (pictured together), is 51 years old. They have been married for since 1981. They have six children: three sons and three daughters. Three of them married, one is a construction worker, one is assists her mother in the business and the youngest attends school. The family lives in a small village off of National Road number Two about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Kim has been a farmer for two years, she grows vegetables on her farmland in the village and sells her vegetables in Takhmao market, about 4 kilometers from her house. Her husband is a fisherman and construction worker.  

Kim is applying for her first loan of US$1,000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting and carrying vegetables to sell.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting and carrying vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité está conformado por mujeres muy trabajadoras y unidas, con ganas de salir adelante y mejorar el nivel de vida para que sus hijos tengan un mejor vivir. 

Las integrantes de este comité desarrollan diversas actividades algunas  se trasladan a otra ciudad para vender sus productos, y otras pasan la frontera hasta la Argentina en busca de un mayor ingreso con la venta de sus mercaderías.

Todas las integrantes de este comité se ayudan y realizan actividades para tener fondos en común y así pagar el crédito que se les concedió. Una de las integrantes es la señora Cynthia quien se dedica a la venta de cosméticos en general como perfumes, maquillajes, cremas en general, carteras y otros.

Ella realiza sus ventas en la zona del centro de Encarnación y en ocasiones se traslada hasta la Argentina para comprar sus mercaderias.
Con esta actividad ella puede ayudar a sus hijos a estudiar y esta muy satisfecha por ello, y solicita el prestamo para la compra de maquillajes, cremas, pefemes y otros.
texts.en:
The committee is made up of very hard-working and united women who wish to progress and to improve their standard of living so that their children have a better life. The members of this committee are developing various activities: some travel to other cities to sell their goods, whilst others cross the border into Argentina, hoping to earn a better income by selling their merchandise. All the members of this committee help each other and carry out activities in order to raise common funds and be able to pay back the credit given to them. One of the members is Cynthia, who sells cosmetics such as perfume, make-up, creams, purses, etc. She trades in the central Encarnación area and sometimes travels as far as Argentina to sell and also buy her merchandise. With this work she can help her children to study and she is very satisfied by it. She is requesting a loan in order to buy make-up, creams, perfumes, and other cosmetics.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Stansfield, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bulk cosmetics such as colognes, creams, make-up, etc., for retail sale.

loans.name: Remberto

texts.es:
Remberto  vive en la zona “Villa Victoria” de la ciudad de La Paz.

Vive junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos, los cuales se encuentran en edad escolar, en la casa de sus suegros.
 
Trabaja como chofer propietario de taxi en uno de los sindicatos los cuales cubren las rutas  en el centro de la ciudad.

El crédito lo destinará en la adquisición de repuestos y la reparación de su movilidad, ya que por el constante uso se vio con algunos contratiempos en el desarrollo de sus actividades
 
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Remberto lives in the "Villa Victoria" neighborhood of the city of La Paz. He lives in his in-law's house with his wife and three school-age children. He owns and drives a taxi for one of the unions that cover routes in the center of the city. The loan would go towards the purchase of spare parts and the repair of his vehicle, which has some setbacks because of its constant use. This is his first loan from Impro, and he passed the evaluation to qualify to receive it.

Translated from Spanish by Eileen Gessner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of spart parts and maintenance for a taxi

loans.name: Abina

texts.en: Abina N. is divorced. She is a fishmonger at Elmina. She has been educated up to the senior high level. She has been smoking fish for sale for 11 years. Abina is going to add the loan to her original income to enable her to acquire more fish to smoke to distribute to her newly found customers. With the new revenues from her expanded business, Abina plans to expand her business.

loans.use: To acquire more fish to smoke

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Don Miguel Angel  de 39 años de edad , es casado, vive en la zona # 5 de Nueva Guinea junto a su familia compuesta por su esposa y sus 3 hijos de 16, 13 y 7 años de edad, los tres estudian, su esposa se encarga de los quehaceres del hogar y del cuido de los hijos.  Miguel labora como  distrubuidor de jugos y gaseosas a las diferentes pulperias del casco urbano y las colonias aledañas de Nueva Guinea, posee su propio inventario y ademàs cuenta con una camioneta donde distribuye sus productos obteniendo ingresos adicionales de un taxi que posee. 

Està solicitando su 1er crèdito para invertirlo en construcciòn de una habitaciòn para que su hijo mayor tenga privacidad y brindarle mayor comodidad a su familia.  Su mayor sueño en la vida es ver a sus hijos que estudien y lleguen a ser hombres de bien y que no les haga falta lo basico en el hogar. Es muy reconocido en la zona por ser bien trabajador y sociable.
texts.en:
Don Miguel Angel, 39, is married and lives in zone 5 in Nueva Guinea together with his family, composed of his wife and 3 children - 16, 13 and 7 years of age. The three children study and Miguel's wife takes care of the household chores and looks after their children. Miguel works as a juice and soft drink distributor to different grocery stores in his urban zone and the suburbs of Nueva Guinea. He has his own inventory and a truck for him to distribute the products. He obtains additional earnings from the taxi he owns. Miguel is seeking his first loan to invest in constructing a room for his older son to provide greater comfort to his family and so his son has privacy. Miguel's biggest dream in life is to see his children study and become good men, and not lack anything basic in his home. Miguel is well known in his zone for being a sociable and hard-working man.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construct a room in his house

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba A. sells provisions at Takoradi. She has no educational background. Her loan will be used to buy extra provisions to sell and she hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to buy a piece of land.

Aba is married and takes care of seven dependents. Her husband is a farmer. She responsibly supports her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.

loans.use: To buy extra provisions to sell

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma, D. 62 años, es una mujer que siempre ha luchado por sobresalir en la vida, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Antonio D. 63 años y su hijo meno Isaac D. 28 años, quienes son el motivo D. todos sus esfuerzos. El trabajo que diariamente realiza Norma en sus chacras, ha hecho que sus sembríos D. arveja y papa sean uno D. los mejores cultivados del poblado D. Huaylahuichan. Todas las mañanas sale muy temprano a trabajar en sus tierras, ya que sabe que es muy importante que las tenga bien cuidadas. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es la libertad que tiene para tomar sus propias decisiones, lleva 35 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos hasta la ciudad D. Tarma. En lo sucesivo comprará nuevas tierras para incrementar su producción. Es el séptimo crédito con MFP y se siente en la obligación D. pagar a tiempo, ya que no desea causarle problemas a su banco comunal, donD. es muy querida y siempre es aconsejada por el resto D. las socias. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Norma is 62 years old and has always struggled to get ahead in her life. She lives in her own home with her husband, 63 year old Antonio, and her 28 year old son Isaac. They are her motivation for her efforts. She has managed to make her crop of peas and potatoes one of the best in the village of Huaylahuichan. Early every morning she goes out to work on her crops, because she knows that it's very important that they be well cared for. What she enjoys most about her work is that it gives her the freedom to make her own decisions. She's been doing this for 35 years and she considers transporting her products to the city of Tarma to be the most challenging part. She subsequently wants to buy more land so that she can increase her production. This will be her seventh loan through MFP and she feels obligated to make all of her payments on time, because she doesn't want to cause any problems for her communal bank, where she is well liked and advised by the other members. She will use the 2,500 PEN ($900) from this loan to buy more fertilizer to improve her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen S. is a married woman who lives in Prk. 7, Brgy. Cabacungan, La Castellana, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: a general store, pig fattening and rice thresher businesses. Her husband, Diego, who is 56 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living, and also helps with his wife's business activities. They have four children between the ages of 20 and 34 years old. 

Helen joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006, because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Helen has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 15,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 13th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 25,000, which she intends to use to buy stocks of merchandise for her general store, and also to buy feed for her pigs so that she can continue to save up for the education of her youngest child and save so that she can expand her business. Helen S. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Rosalia Ramona

texts.es: Rosalía es una mujer emprendedora, con mucho deseo de seguir trabajando ella tiene 35 años. Su negocio que inicio hace 6 años que es la venta de frutas y verduras ha logrado prosperar debido a su buena administración en su negocio. Ya que cuando inicio lo hizo con poco dinero y con ayuda de su esposo, fue así que lograr captar sus clientes, y es con lo que ha alimentado actualmente este crédito es para la compra de mangos, sandias, naranjas y entre otras. Ella sueña con mejorar su condición de vida y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en: Rosalía is an enterprising woman with strong motivation to keep working. She is 35 years old. She started her business selling fruits and vegetables six years ago and has prospered owing to her good management of her business. She started out with little money and the help of her husband. In this way she succeeded at attracting her customers and has provided sustenance for her family. Currently this loan is for the purchase of mangoes, watermelons and oranges among others. She dreams of improving her living conditions and growing her business.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Khalida's Group

texts.en:
Khalida lives in Jaranwala, which is a small city located in Punjab, Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry. She is 30 years of age and has a daughter, who is studying in 2nd grade. Her husband operates a grocery store in the market. Khalida stays at home and does her household responsibilities. She is a very good mother who is raising her daughter with great care and discipline. She lives in a combine family system along with her 3 brother-in-laws also live. They do different kind of works to contribute to the family financially. 

Her husband started the grocery store business 5 years ago and it has earned him good income. Now he wants to expand his business for which he needs to invest capital.  Therefore, Khalida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah. With the loan, her husband will buy groceries in bulk quantity and increase his sales. His shop is located in a busy place and he faces high competition every day from other grocery stores. The bulk items will help him retain his customers and to grow by keeping in stock the  items required by his customers. Khalida is hopeful that this investment will bring increased profits to her husband’s business and her family’s living standard will get improved. 

She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and hopeful that it will be a profitable experience for her. 

Note: “In the photo, the lady who has holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) in her hands is Khalida”.

loans.use: To buy groceries for the grocery shop

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Lebanese Kiva borrower, a 38-year-old married man with two school-age children, has almost 20 years of experience in construction, having built a good business reputation over the years. He takes on an average of three projects each month and is thankful for his business income as it helps him raise and take care of his family and pay the school fees.

Today he is requesting a loan of $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional wood for a big new project, one that he hopes will enable him to meet his business needs and result in his being in further demand by his customers.

loans.use: To purchase additional wood

loans.name: Lizbeth

texts.es: Lisbeth tiene 26 años, vive con su madre y su hijo en casa de su madre. Desde hace 1 año se dedica a la venta de objetos artesanales, que ella misma elabora, su madre la ayuda en la elaboración de estos objetos y una vez terminado todo el trabajo, son llevados al mercado artesanal de la ciudad de Lima, que es ahí donde recibe buena paga por el trabajo que elabora. Su producción artesanal tiene mucha demanda y por eso tiene ventas exitosas con frecuencia, además de pedidos por el cual necesita de manos para poder terminar con el trabajo a tiempo. Considera que su trabajo le es rentable, ya que logra recuperar todo lo invertido, además que es un trabajo que la independiza y eso le hace sentir bien. En adelante su deseo es incrementar su producción. Es el crédito número 4 con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de insumos para implementar su taller y pueda elaborar más objetos artesanales.
texts.en: Lisbeth is 26 years old. She lives with her mother and son in her mother's house. She has sold artisanal objects for a year. She makes them herself, and her mother helps her. Once they are completely finished, they are taken to the artisanal market in Lima, where she receives good pay for her work. Her artisanal production is much in demand and that is why she frequenty has successful sales. She also fills orders for which she needs extra hands to finish the work on time. She considers her work to be profitable, since she recoups everything she has invested. In addition, the work gives her independence and this makes her feel good. In the future, she wishes to increase her production. This is loan number 4 with MFP. She is very happy to know that she has financial support and she also likes being part of her communal bank because all of its members are responsible and very supportive people. She is grateful to all of the people who will be making the loan she is asking for and it will be very useful in her business' progress. With the loan she is asking for, she will invest in buying materials to outfit her workshop and make more artisanal objects.

loans.use: To buy materials to make artisanal objects.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase more stocks to sell

loans.name: Rat

texts.en: Rat S., 64 years old, owns a small shop in the local Prey Tortoeung market, where she sells cooking ingredients to people that come to buy things in the market.  She typically makes ~ $3 of profit each day to meet her family's needs. She was married to Mr. Yan Yorng, who is a local farmer.  This couple has seven children, all of whom are married; some of them live separately in their own houses.  Rat S. will use this Kiva loan to purchase essential ingredients for cooking foods.

loans.use: To purchase essential ingredients for cooking foods

loans.name: Phat

texts.en:
Mrs. Phat C. (pictured above), 35 years old, and her husband, Mr. Mao Rin, 36 years old, live in a small village along National Road Number Three about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have three children - two daughters and one son. 

Phat has been selling noodles (kuyteav or ka tieu) in her village for almost 10 years. Kuyteav is the sound of the Khmer word for these noodles eaten with soup. Her husband assists his wife in the business. She is requesting her first loan of US$300 to buy a new motorcycle for commuting  to replace the old one because it breaks down and uses more gasoline.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Jantrix

texts.en:
Jantrix is a married woman with four sons, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.
Jantrix operates a business selling tablecloths and handbags from door to door and from home to her neighbors. In addition, she sells cloth materials to tailors and dressmakers, which brings her an alternative source of income. Jantrix faces a major challenge of delayed payments by those who purchase goods on credit. She hopes to become a wholesale supplier in the future.
With her 20,000 KES loan, Jantrix wants to purchase a bundle of tablecloths for resale. She decided to join Kiva partner, Yehu, to access loans and improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase a bundle of tablecloths for resale

loans.name: Hussein

texts.ar:
حسين في عمر 43 سنة متزوج وله ولدان يعمل في محل للخشب وصناعة الغرف والادوات المنزلية له في عمله 20 سنة يحب عمله ويتطور
فيه دائما يريد تأمين جميع وسائل الراحة لعائلته له تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة وكان يلقى الدعم الكامل يريد من خلال طلب قرض
من المجموعة الى شراء خشب جديدة للمصلحة يحب التجدد والتقدم في العمل له زبائن من محيطه وجيرانه له خبرة واسعة في مجال عمله
وهو مقصد للزبائن بسبب اخلاقه في العمل والصدق والابتكار
texts.en: Hussein, 43, is married with two children. He has been working as a carpenter for 20 years.  He makes wooden furniture and other utensils.  He likes his work and always seeks to develop it. He wants to secure his family a comfortable life. Hussein has a good credit history with Al Majmoua. He was fully supported by his family during his previous loan cycle. He wants to get a loan from Al Majmoua to buy timber for his business. He always likes to be up-to-date and creative at work. His clients are mainly his neighbors and people in his neighborhood. He has exhaustive experience and is well known among his clients for his honesty, creativity and decency.

loans.use: To buy timber for his business

loans.name: Ofelia Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Ofelia es profesora del nivel de primaria ella da clases a estudiante de 5to grado con 20 años de ser docente , está casada y tiene a cargo 2 hijos los cuales estudian en universidades
Es el primer crédito que solicita en ceprodel este crédito es para la construcción de un cuarto para una de sus hijas
texts.en:
Mrs. Ofelia is an elementary school teacher who has been teaching for 20 years.  She currently teaches 5th grade.  She is married and has two children who are university students.

This is her first loan through Ceprodel.  She plans to use it to build a room for one of her daughters.

loans.use: To buy stone, cement, sand and iron

loans.name: Sagapsapan's Group

texts.en:
Lina S. lives in the village of Banonong. She is 58 years old and leads a two-person loan group that receives funding from PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are both collectively responsible for paying back the loan for their fellow group member if she is delinquent or defaults.

Lina is a widow and has 3 adult children. She makes a living by selling barbecue in the local community. She has been in this business for more than 2 years and earns about 5,000 PHP a month from her work.

In 2006, Lina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid seven previous loans from PMPC, and used each of them as additional capital for her business.

Lina and fellow her loan group member are each applying for a new loan of 12,000 PHP. Lina will buy additional fresh meats and spices for her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by her business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fresh meat and spices for barbecue vending

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Ruben D. is from the village of Binuangan, Misamis Oriental. He is 46 years old. Ruben is married. Ruben owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, junk foods & beverages in the local community. Ruben has been engaged in his business for over six years and earns approximately 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2002, Ruben joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to do business. Ruben has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Ruben is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & junk foods. This loan will be the 15th loan taken out by Ruben from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & junk foods

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia is currently in the business of selling soft drinks. She is 35 years old and married, with 5 children, who all attend school. Lucia has taken out a loan to stock more soft drinks to sell. She hopes to pay her children's school fees with the extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: to stock more soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Zulema

texts.es: Zulema, de 26 años; convive desde hace 4 años con Héctor, con quien tiene una hija llamada Sharmely, a la que cuidan en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Tapo. La actividad a la que se dedica es la agricultura, el cual lo realiza en sus propios terrenos ubicados a las afueras de la comunidad. Sus principales sembríos constan de papa, habas, arveja y maíz; ya tiene 3 años de experiencia y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder trasmitir el conocimiento que le heredaron sus padres. Asimismo afirma que siembra en sociedad con una señora, con quien comparte los gastos de semilla, abono y fertilizantes que requiere sus cultivos; pero lo que más le agrada es el cuidado de animales menores, como cuyes; los cuales comercializa a un buen precio en el mercado modelo de la ciudad de Tarma donde vende de acuerdo a los pedidos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Santa Rosa”, y este es el tercer crédito que tiene con MFP, donde oportunidad de progreso que le brindan. Zulema, invertirá el crédito solicitado en la compra de 2 toros medianos, los cuales cuidará y engordará para luego comercializarlo a un mayor precio.
texts.en:
Zulema is 26 years old and has lived with Héctor for four years. They have a daughter named Sharmely who they take care of in their own home in the village of Tapo. Zulema earns her living through farming. She has her own land located outside of the community. Her main crops consist of potatoes, beans, peas, and corn. She has three years of experience farming and what she enjoys most about her work is passing on the knowledge she gained from her parents. Zulema also says that she partners with another woman with whom she shares the costs of seeds, compost, and fertilizers used for their crops. However, what gives her the most enjoyment is taking care of domesticated animals such as guinea pigs. She sells the animals at a good price at the standard market in the city of Tarma, the place where she receives her orders.

Zulema is a member of the Santa Rosa Communal Bank. This is her third loan with MFP, the organization that has provided her with opportunities to make progress. She will invest the loan she requested in the purchase of two medium-sized bulls that she will care for and fatten so that she can sell them later at a better price.

loans.use: to purchase two bulls for fattening.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 56 years old and is a married woman. She has two children aged 29 and 25.

Gloria started her farming business 25 years ago. She primarily grows rice to sell. Gloria earns 5000 PHP from this farming. She plans to use her loan to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. Gloria works hard to improve her earnings and support her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Veng

texts.en:
Veng (pictured above) and his wife are weavers. In addition, he is a fisherman. The couple lives on an island on the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Penh City, and they have a young son.  

Veng is asking for a loan of $200 in order to purchase fishing nets for his fishing business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets for his fishing business.

loans.name: Ñemity Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son de la zona Yhakarosa de la ciudad de Caacupé. Son mujeres muy activas, con muchas ganas de trabajar y salir adelante.
Las señoras están muy agradecidas con la Fundación Paraguaya, porque gracias al crédito de etapas anteriores y a las constantes capacitaciones que reciben, aprendieron a ahorrar, pueden hacer crecer su negocio, y logran ayudar al sustento de sus familias.
La Sra. Juana es la tesorera del comité, es una mujer muy activa, siempre busca la forma de incentivar a sus compañeras a trabajar y salir adelante, ella posee una granja donde cría todo tipo de animales, y planta todo tipo de hortalizas. Vive con su hijo quien le ayuda en su trabajo.
Hoy día solicita el crédito para poder comprar insumos para el area de la agricultura especialmente, como fertilizantes, semillas, fumigadoras, etc., pues han aumentado las demandas de hortalizas y desea poder proveer de dichos vegetales a los clientes.
El comité ya está trabajando con la fundación hace aproximadamente 3 a 4 años.
texts.en:
The women of this committee are from the Yhakarosa zone of Caacupe city. They are active women who are motivated to work hard and improve their lives. 

The women are thankful for the Paraguaya Foundation because thanks to previous loans and regular trainings they have received they have learned to save money, grow their businesses, and provide for their families.

Mrs. Juana is the treasurer of the committee. She is an energetic woman and she always looks for ways to encourage her fellow members to work hard. She owns a farm where she raises a variety of animals and grows vegetables. She lives with her son who helps her with the farm. She applied for a loan to purchase agricultural supplies like fertilizer, seeds, and pesticides because there has been an increased demand for vegetables and she hopes to provide enough produce for her clients. The committee has been working with the foundation for between three and four years.

loans.use: Purchase agricultural supplies like seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides

loans.name: Angel Ilario

texts.es:
Angel Ilario tiene 43 años, es casado vive con la esposa y con tres hijos de 19, 16 y 13 años. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama UNIDOS VENCEREMOS,	 se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto La América, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol gandul.

Angel se dedica a la agricultura en especial a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace mucho tiempo. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes en Agripar y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos enfermedades en los cultivos que se llama Orasco. Su sueño es comprar un carro.

Le gusta hacer deporte en especial en indor.
texts.en:
Ilario Angel, 43, is married and lives with his wife and three children who are aged 19, 16 and 13.   He lives in the Ventanas Canton in the Province of Los Ríos.  

This group is called "UNIDOS VENCEREMOS" (United We Shall Overcome).  It is located in La América, in Ventanas Canton. The members of this group work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and pigeon peas.

Angel has been working in agriculture for a long time, especially corn and rice.  He makes purchases monthly at Agrippa in Ventanas, and sells in the market in the same town.

He is requesting the loan for the purchase of seeds, fertilizers and manure. With the support of the loan he will be able to financially cover his needs. He faces the challenge of a crop disease called Orasco. His dream is to buy a car. 

He likes playing sports, especially indoor sports.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizers and manure.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is a 52-year-old married woman with five children who have all finished their studies. She lives in the village of Rizal West within San Isidro in the Philippines.

Merlita has raised hogs and had a motorcycle transport business for the past three years. She is able to earn per month about 3,000 PHP raising hogs and 2,000 PHP through her motorcycle transport.

Merlita is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy feed for her hogs and a new sprocket for her motorcycle. In the future she hopes to increase her profits by improving her businesses so that she will be able to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy hog feed and a new sprocket for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Nezinunula Group

texts.en:
Jackson wants a loan to buy another motorcycle for his business that he has been running for one year. At 40 years old, Jackson hails from Kyenjojo District in Uganda and is a father of six children. He lives with his children and their mother in a residential iron-roofed house. He started as a farmer and he saved money to buy a motorcycle to use in his transport business, commonly known as bodaboda. His dream is to educate his children and own at least three motorcycles.
