He is a member of Nezinunula group where each member guarantees the other to access a loan.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for his business

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.es: Feliciana, natural de la ciudad de San Francisco, tiene 52 años, es viuda y madre de 04 hijos que están en etapa escolar. Residen en el poblado de Triboline donde tienen su propia casa construida de material rustico. Feliciana es padre y madre para sus hijos, ella esta pendiente de todas las necesidades de sus queridos hijos. Feliciana supo sobre salir a base de mucho esfuerzo y perseverancia ante la falta de su amado esposo. Hoy trabaja tranquila y con la frente bien en alta y lucha por sacar adelante a sus hijos. Feliciana es campesina y labra sus tierras en donde cultiva cacao y café, viene realizando esta actividad hace 25 años con mucho esmero y laboriosidad,  por que gracias a los frutos que le brinda sus plantas ella cubre los gastos educativos de sus hijos. Feliciana cuenta con espacios de terreno sin cultivar, lo cual necesariamente necesita el apoyo de la entidad financiera para llevar acabo sus actividades programadas, por tanto  tiene pensado sembrar sus tierras con plantas de café, pero no cuenta con dinero suficiente por ello acude a los créditos que la institución MFP facilita a las personas de bajos recursos con miras a progresar. Para el bien de su trabajo e hijos se encomienda a dios para que la tenga de buena salud. Este es su 12avo crédito con MFP y espera el apoyo de todos ustedes para continuar con su trabajo. Con los 500 nuevos soles que solicita, comprará plantas de café.
texts.en:
Feliciana is from the city of San Francisco.  She’s 52 years old, a widow and mother of four children who are school age.  They live in the community of Triboline where they have their house made out of insubstantial building materials.  Feliciana is both father and mother to her children.  She is watchful of all their needs.

Feliciana knew how to get ahead based on much effort and perseverance despite the loss of her beloved husband.  Today, she works at peace and with her head held very high and fights to move her children ahead.

Feliciana is a farmer working her fields where she grows coffee and cocoa beans.  She’s been working in this occupation for 25 years with much dedication and attention because thanks to the fruits her plants produce she’s able to cover the educational costs of her children.

Feliciana has some uncultivated fields but necessarily needs help from the financial institution to carry out her programmed activities.  She plans to plant coffee there but lacks enough money to do so and this is why she’s calling upon the loans that MFP grants to low resource people who want to progress.  

For the wellbeing of her work and of her children she puts herself in God’s hands so that she’ll have good health.  This will be her 12th loan with MFP.  She hopes for help from all of you to continue working.  She will use the requested 500 new soles to buy coffee plants.

loans.use: to buy more coffee plants.

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en:
Maureen is 20 years old, from the Manyatta area, and is married to Keneddy. They have one child who is two years old.
Maureen has a retail shop and is applying for her first loan from Kiva partner, KADET, to enable her buy cooking oil, flour, eggs, rice etc. to add to her stock. She hopes to expand her business in the future and see it become a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cooking oil, flour, eggs, rice etc.

loans.name: Yonis

texts.es:
Yonis, vive con su familia, conformada por su esposa y dos hijos, él se dedica a la siembra de maíz y frijol, tiene 10 años dedicándose a esta actividad, trabaja todos los días de 6:00am a 3:00pm.
Quiere invertir un préstamo en abono y herbicidas, estos materiales son muy necesarios para el desarrollo del cultivo y para protegerlo de plagas, al aplicarlos estará más seguro de la producción que puede lograr, garantizándole a su familia alimentación para un periodo.
Para Yonis, el cultivo es muy necesario, a parte que lo realiza desde hace algún tiempo, es el que le ayuda para apoyar a sus hijos y su esposa.
texts.en:
Yonis lives with his family which consists of his wife and two children.  He grows corn and beans and has been in this business for 10 years.  He works every day from 6.00am to 3.00pm.

Yonis would like to invest his loan in buying fertilizers and herbicides.  These materials are necessary for his crops to develop and so that he can protect them from pests.  By applying them, he will be more certain of the production he will be able to achieve, guaranteeing his family has food for a period of time.

Yonis needs to grow his crops.  As well as having been doing it for some time, it is also how he supports his children and his wife.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his crops

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
La señora Luz Maria tiene la edad de 44 años, estudio la secundaria, esta madre soltera de 5 hijos los culaes se encuentran estudiando, ella y su familia viven en una region de siembra de caña para la produccion de azucar.

Doña Luz Maria nos platica que decio iniciar con su propio negocio de venta de cosmeticos y zapatos por catalogo porque quiere  sacar adelante a sus hijos y ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida.

Ella realiza sus ventas de cosmeticos y zapatos, saliendo a caminar casa por casa, les muestra los catalogos a sus amigas y vecinos, levanta pedidos y despues de tener varios pedidos sale a comprarlos, para posteriormente luego entragarlos a sus clientes, y despues ella recibir el pago por sus productos. ella nos dice que es un trabajo donde se camina mucho pero ella le hecha muchas ganas ya que quiere sacar a delante a sus pequeños


Doña Luz Maria necesita este credito para la compra catalogos, zapatos, maquillajes, sombras, delineadores, lapiz labial, esmalte, perfumes, para su posterior venta de sus productos.

Ella espera que con esta inversion su negocio prospere porque espera salir adelante con su negocio y ofrecerle a sus hijos una profesion.
texts.en:
Sra. Luz Maria is 44 years old and has a high school education.  She is a single mother of five children who are in school.  Luz Maria and her family live in a region where sugar cane is grown for producing sugar.  

She says that she decided to start her own business selling cosmetics and shoes through catalogs because she wanted to help her children get ahead and offer them a better quality of life.

Luz Maria sells cosmetics and shoes by going house-to-house.  She presents her catalogs to friends and neighbors, takes their orders, buys the products once she has several orders, and then delivers the merchandise to her customers and collects payment.  Luz Maria says that her job requires a lot of walking, but it has resulted in good earnings that have helped her children move forward.  
 
She needs this loan to buy catalogs, shoes, makeup, eye shadows, eye liners, lip pencils, nail polish, and perfumes for eventual resale.  Luz Maria hopes that this investment will prosper her business so that she can more forward and help her children pursue a profession.

loans.use: to buy catalogs, shoes, makeup, eye shadows, eye liners, lip pencils, nail polish, and perfumes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase merchandise (polo shirts, shorts, pants) for the spring-summer season.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 57 years old and has four adult children. They lived happily in a rural community, planting and harvesting rice and vegetables for sale. Due to the high cost school fees and commodities, some of their children did not pursue their studies, for they could not afford to finance their schooling. 

Rosita and her husband helped each other to earn income and satisfy their basic necessities. Due to financial difficulty, Rosita engages in a duck-raising business to generate additional income.

At this time, Rosita aims to improve her duck-raising business but she doesn't have enough capital. Therefore, she is asking for additional capital of PHP 6,000 to buy feed and additional ducks to raise. She believes that through this loan, she will raise more ducks to bear eggs for sale. 

In the future, she hopes that her business will grow and becomes a viable source of income.

loans.use: to buy feed and additional ducks to raise.

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en: Roseline is married and blessed with three children who are still in school. For the last 12 years, she has been tailoring to make a living. Previously, she was selling charcoal. In the next 5 years, she wants to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a sewing machine and fabric. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has  been able to adopt the culture of saving.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and fabric

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 27 years old and is a hardworking business man. He sells mobile phone accessories, and has been in this business for nine years. Previously, he was employed as a storekeeper in a spare parts shop. Through his hard work, he has sustained his business in a competitive environment.

Francis has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy mobile phone accessories.

Francis hopes to open other outlets of his business in five years.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone accessories.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a 33-year-old single man who opened a small internet café in Al Zarqa three years ago. Through these years, he was able to expand by adding more computers every once in a while. He also has another service that he provides in his store, which is selling computers. Now Ibrahim has applied for this loan to buy more PCs and design a new front sign for the café.

loans.use: to buy more computers and design a new front sign for the café

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos es abogado, trabaja independientemente elaborando tramites como ser: testimonios, manutención familiar y otros. Con el dinero del préstamo hará la refacción de una habitación en su casa para vivir en mejores condiciones; vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz; Carlos está separado y tiene dos hijos. Es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo en IMPRO esperando mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos is an attorney who works independently preparing documents such as testimonies, family support orders, and other legal instruments. The money from this loan will be used to repair a room in his home so that he can have better living conditions. Carlos lives in his own house in the District of Tembladerani in the city of La Paz. He is separated from his spouse and has two children.

This is the first time he has received a loan from IMPRO. He hopes to improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to pay the cost of repairing a room in his house.

loans.name: Flor Del Bosque Group

texts.es:
El grupo Flor del Bosque está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras una de ellas es Johana de los Ángeles quien se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, ropa y perfumes desde hace 5 años. Ella invertirá el crédito en mercadería en especial cosméticos y perfumes.
Las otras integrantes son Isaura del Carmen quien tiene una tortillería desde hace 3 años y Pedro es propietario de una fritanga, restaurante popular que consiste en comida frita.
texts.en: The "Flor del Bosque" group consists of three hard working people.  One of them is Johana de los Ángeles who has been making a living selling cosmetics, clothing and perfumes for the last 5 years.  She will invest the money from this loan in cosmetic products and perfumes.  The other members are Isaura del Carmen, who has owned a tortilla bakery for the last 3 years, and Pedro is the owner of a "fritanga", a popular restaurant that specializes in fried food.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetic products and perfumes.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is 49 years old and lives in Masindi, Uganda. She has five children and runs a retail shop. She started as a market vendor and set up her shop after acquiring enough savings.  She desires to educate herself and her children and expand her business. Her business faces a problem of price fluctuations and seasonal weather.  She requested a loan to buy soap, sugar and rice to sell.

loans.use: buy soap, sugar and rice

loans.name: Liz

texts.es: Liz tiene 23 años, vive en la compañía de su esposo y su hijo en casa de la propiedad de sus padres. Ubicada en la localidad de Azapampa. Se dedica a la elaboración de fustanes típicos, faldas de colores que son autóctonos de su zona. Desde hace 4 años, su esposo también la apoya en estas actividades en sus horarios libres y trabaja en su misma casa, provista de su esencial herramienta de trabajo que es su maquina de coser y también donde diseñan día a día los modelos de cada bordado de acuerdo a cada temporada, una vez realizados los trabajos los fines de semana  sale a vender lo producido en las ferias comerciales de las zonas rurales de su ciudad  y donde recibe las ganancias  de su trabajo, la elaboración de sus faldas considera que son rentables porque  es un producto demandado  por lo que su deseo es mejorar sus herramientas y aumentar su producción. Ya que esta teniendo muchos pedidos de otras ciudades. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “los héroes al progreso” y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde  ha tenido buenos aprendizajes que le han servido en su vida diaria de la cual esta agradecida  y renueva su compromiso de ser puntual en sus pagos. Liz de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de telas al por mayor para realizar los pedidos que tiene.
texts.en:
Liz is 23 years old, and she lives with her husband and son in a home on her parent’s property, located in Azapampa. 

She makes traditional dress, skirts in colors that are native to her region, and has been doing this for 4 years. Her husband also helps her in her business activities in his free time. She works out of her home, which is equipped with her essential business tool which is her sewing machine, and where they also design patterns every day based on the season’s styles.  Upon completing their work on the weekend, she goes out to sell what she’s made in the markets in the rural areas of the city where she receives pay for her work. She considers making her skirts profitable because it’s a product in demand. For that reason she wants to improve her equipment and increase production since she has many orders from other cities. 

She belongs to the group “Los Héroes Al Progreso” (Heroes in Progress), and this is the third loan with MFP where she’s had good lessons which have helped her in her daily life, for which she is thankful. She renews her commitment to be punctual in her repayments. She will invest the requested funds into the purchase of bulk fabrics to fill the orders she has.

loans.use: to buy bulk fabric

loans.name: Nelson Jesus

texts.es:
Nelson Jesús tiene 60 años de edad es casado tiene una hija, vive con la esposa y la hija de 23 años de edad en Ventanas Provincia de Bolívar.

La VRC SE LLAMA Yagui Chico tiene el nombre de la Comunidad,  se encuentra a 20 minutos del Cantón San Miguel y se dedican a la agricultura como fuente de ingresos de la familia.

Nelson se dedica a los trabajos de la agricultura coMo fuente de ingresos de la familia lo que más siembra es maíz, trigo y papas.

Las compras y las ventas lo hace en san Miguel . Solicita el crédito para la compra de abonos, fertilizantes  y pago a los trabajadores. Con la ayudadel crédito ha podido comprar los productos y abonos agrícolas.

El sueño es poder tener la oportunidad de comprar terrenos. Los desafíos a los que se ha enfrentado es los vientos y las lanchas en los cultivos.

En el tiempo libre le gusta practicar el deporte en especial el boley.
texts.en:
Nelson Jésus is 60 years old and married with one daughter. He lives with his wife and twenty-three year-old daughter in Ventanas in the Province of Bolívar.

The VRC [Ventanillas Rurales Crédito, or Window to the Countryside Loan] is called Yagui Chico, after the community which is twenty minutes from the Canton of San Miguel, and whose members work in agriculture to provide their families with a source of income.

Nelson works as a farmer to provide his family with a source of income. He mostly cultivates corn, wheat, and potatoes.

His purchases and sales occur mostly in San Miguel. He is requesting the loan to purchase manure, fertilizers, and to pay for labor costs. With the help of the loan he has been able to purchase agricultural products and fertilizers.

His dream is to be able to have the opportunity to purchase land. The challenges he faces are the winds and frost in his crops.

In his free time he likes to play sports, especially volleyball.

loans.use: to purchase manure, fertilizers, and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua is divorced and has one child. For some years now she has sold charcoal at Nkontrodo near Elmina. She uses her income to pay for her children’s school fees.

Efua will use her loan to purchase bags of charcoal to sell. With her anticipated profits, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Issifou

texts.fr:
Monsieur ISSIFOU est né vers 1969 à Gningoni Cercle de Sikasso. Père de 5 enfants il vit dans une famille nucléaire au quartier Noumousso - Kadiolo (troisième région administrtive de la république du Mali).
 Il mène les activités de commercialisation de céréales depuis trois ans. Son expérience dans ce domaine, lui a valu une bonne réputation et reçoit des commandes de céréales, notamment du maïs. Ainsi pour avoir les ressources nécessaires afin de satisfaire ces clients, il collabore avec l’Institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso, il y’a 5 cycles maintenant, les prêts passés ont été correctement dénoués.  
Ce prêt lui permettra d’acheter 4 tonnes de maïs et 1 tonne de mil . Il s’approvisionne dans les villages avoisinants de Kadiolo. Les céréales sont stockées dans son magasin. Il  les revend au comptant à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes venant de SIKASSO et de BAMAKO. 
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 90 000 FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Issifou was born around 1969 in the Gningoni Cercle area of Sikasso. A father of five children, he lives in a nuclear family in the Noumousso area of Kadiolo (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
He has run a business selling cereals for three years. His experience in this field has earned him a good reputation, and he receives orders for cereals, especially maize. In order to have the necessary resources to satisfy his customers, he has been working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso through five loan cycles so far, with all the previous loans having been repaid properly.
This loan will allow him to buy 4 tonnes of maize and 1 tonne of millet. He gets his supplies in the towns surrounding Kadiolo. The cereals are stocked at his store. He re-sells them in cash to a clientele composed of men and women from Sikasso and Bamako.
With this loan, he foresees earning a monthly profit of 90,000 FCFA. This profit will allow him to repay the interest on his loan and reinvest the remainder in his business.

loans.use: To buy cereals.

loans.name: Roeng

texts.en:
Roeng, 44, is widowed with one child residing in a rural village located in the Kampong Cham province’s Cheung Prey district, Cambodia. For the last 25 years, she has been growing cassava and working as a paid construction worker to make a living. She can earn about 30,000KHR per day to meet the family’s need. 
Roeng is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is applying for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to make a living better.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Midedji Do Mahugo Group

texts.fr: MIDEDJI DO MAHUGO est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la huitième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Rose (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 35 ans. Rose  n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Rose est mariée à un certain Jean. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Rose prépare du haricot et de l'igname qu'elle vend à son domicile depuis quatorze ans, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Rose s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Rose sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe MIDEDJI DO MAHUGO, un huitième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter du haricot et de l'igname.

loans.name: Mignonmde Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MIGNONMDE est composé de trois personnes qui sont de la même famille. La représentante du groupe, nommée Ayéyèmi (Celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 53 ans. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et trois a leur charge. Ayéyèmi vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Ayéyèmi vend de l’akassa (pâte de maïs fermenté) depuis trente ans à son domicile. De façon secondaire,Ayéyèmi vend également du maïs, ce qui lui permet de mieux répondre aux besoins de sa famille. Ayéyèmi  s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité Ayéyèmi ensemble avec les membres du groupe MIGNONMDE sollicite pour la cinquième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter du maïs.

loans.name: Constantine

texts.fr: Constantine âgée de 29 ans n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Constantine est mariée à un électricien du nom de Anselme. Le couple a deux enfants, dont un scolarisé et tous à leur charge. Constantine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les différentes charges du ménage. Constantine vend produits de beauté par la technique de distribution depuis six ans ; ce qui lui permet de contribuer à l'éducation et à l'entretien des enfants. Constantine  s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. La clientèle de Constantine devient de plus en plus grandissante. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu, Constantine sollicite une cinquième fois l’appui financier de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des produits de beauté.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Rosario works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fattening pigs and farming rice businesses. Rosario is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell to customers.

Rosario has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Massan

texts.en:
Born in Lomé on February 1, 1935, Massan A. is married and the mother of four. Ever since her husband retired, she has continued all by herself to deal with household expenses by selling ice cubes, ice water, and fruit juice. This business has gotten big due to the strong demand in her neighborhood, particularly during the dry season when the heat is excessive and people consume a good deal of her beverages to refresh themselves.

Unfortunately, her production capacity is insufficient to meet the demands of the customers in her area. Ms. A. is requesting financial support in the amount of $1,000 to acquire another, bigger freezer. This new loan will make a major difference for her business and the life of her family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Née le 1er Février 1935 à Lomé, Madame A. Massan est mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants. Depuis que son mari est admis à la retraite, c’est elle qui continue seule à faire face aux charges du ménage par la vente de glaçons, d’eau glacée et de jus de fruits. Cette activité a pris une ampleur importante à cause de la forte demande qui existe dans le quartier particulièrement pendant les saisons sèches où la chaleur est excessive et où les populations en consomment assez pour se rafraîchir.

Malheureusement sa capacité de production ne permet plus de satisfaire sa clientèle du quartier. Madame A. Massan sollicite un appui financier de $1000 pour acquérir un autre congélateur plus grand. Ce nouveau financement aura des retombées financières très importantes sur son activité et dans la vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy freezers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mercy would like to buy seedlings of godgets, green pepper, cucumber, maize corns and lettuce

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is 48 years old and married, but sadly did not have the ability to bear children. Along with her husband, she runs a convenience store out of their home. Since she has no children, she spends most of her time helping customers who come to her store. She has always relied on credit to invest in her business, and at the moment needs a loan to finish construction on her home/store. Her husband is a big help and always accompanies her on their endeavors.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunter

Mercedes es casada y tiene 48 años. Cuenta con tristeza que la vida no le dió la posibilidad de tener hijos. Junto con su esposo atienden su despensa que funciona en su casa propia. Al no poder tener hijos su mayor distracción constituye en atender a los clientes que vienen a comprar de su negocio. Siempre ha recurrido a prèstamos para invertirlos generalmente en construcción, es así que en este momento necesita de un crédito para terminar una construcción que ha iniciado. Su esposo le ayuda y acompaña en todos sus emprendimientos.

loans.use: Finish building a room in her house

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Mrs. Stella J. is 42 years, has four children and lives in Benin City, Edo state. She wholesales and retails drinks. She has been in this business for nine years and a LAPO member for eight years.  She hopes to improve her business with the loan.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for resale.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores estimates that she sells an average of 300-400 RD pesos of chicken each day (US$ 9-12); she is the sole person in charge of her business. She hopes that with the earnings and savings she can generate with this loan she will one day be able to buy several cows so that she can sell milk for cheese and candies. Her community is known for the cheeses and candies that it makes, so she thinks that would be a great business opportunity. She plans to get there by steadily re-investing her earnings into more chickens first, and then, as her sales increase, into a cow. Dolores is very involved with her local church and community. She is thankful for the opportunities and hope this loan will give her.

NOTE: This is a group loan. Dolores is a member of an Esperanza solidarity group. She and her business represent four other micro-entrepreneurs who are members of the same solidarity group. Each members will receive a share of this $1,200 loan to develop their respective businesses. Payments are made together at biweekly meetings. If one person is unable to pay, the other members must make up the difference before any payment will be accepted. The group has gone through Esperanza´s business training courses and have demonstrated their commitment and aptitude for receiving a loan to expand their businesses. Dolores and the other members are also responsible for working with one another as a social support network throughout the loan repayment period and business development processes.

loans.use: Expand inventory of chicken

loans.name: Ana Eduardo Cabral

texts.pt:
Ana is single but lives with a man with whom she has 10 children. (Five of the children are hers, and 5 are from another woman, but they are all under Ana's care.) Ana's husband is a miner and works in a neighboring country. Ana is this man's first wife. She and the other wife take care of the business and the children almost always, since Ana's husband only comes home to spend vacation.

Ana entered the loan program in 2005. The first loan that she took out at that time was 6,000 meticais to invest in the business. Because the business is going well, she wants to take out another loan now to acquire more products to restock her store. The majority of the children are studying. The youngest ones are the only ones who don't go to school, but as soon as they are old enough, they will be enrolled. Ana and her family live in Matchelene, a rural area which is about 15 kms from the city of Xai-Xai. In addition to the store, Ana and her family also have a small field in the lowland area, where fertile land is located for agricultural activity.

Translated from Portuguese by a Kiva volunteer.

Ana e solteira mas vive com um homem com quem tem 10 filhos (5 dela e 5 de uma outra mulher) mas todos estao sob a responsabilidade de Ana. O marido de Ana e mineiro trabalha num Pais vizinho.Ana e a primeira mulher deste homem.Ela e a outra mulher e que cuidam da casa do negocio e dos filhos quase todo o tempo, pois que o marido de Ana so vem a casa para passar ferias. Ana entrou para o programa de credito em 2005.O primeiro emprestimo que ela tomou na altura foi de 6.000,00 Mt para investir no negocio. Porque o negocio esta a correr bem ela quer tomar um outro emprestimo agora para a aquisicao de mais produtos para rechear a sua loja. A maioria das criancas estao a estudar. So nao estudam os mais novinhos, mas logo que estes tiverem idade serao matriculados. A Ana e sua familia vivem em Matchelene uma zona rural que dista cerca de 15 Kms da cidade de Xai-Xai.Para alem da loja Ana e sua familia tambem fazem machamba na zona baixa,onde se localizam as terras ferteis proprias para a actividade agricola.

loans.use: Ana wants to use the money to buy products for her store.

loans.name: Eshmahmad

texts.ru:
Eshmahmad A. is 51, has a college degree in economics, is married and has 6 children. Currently Eshmahmad works as an accountant in the dehkansk farming business called "A. Kodiri". He also has several acres of land. The obtained loan will allow Eshmahmad to purchase seeds. He plans to plant wheat, oat and onions on his land. He is thinking to sell part of his crops on the local market, which will allow the locals to purchase grain and onions at a lower price since the goods will go directly to the market without any intermediaries. The rest of the crops will be used to satisfy the needs of the family. Eshmahmad plans to repay his loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva voluntter

Алмухамедов Эшмахмад, возраст – 51 год, образование высшее, по специальности - экономист, женат, имеет 6-х детей. Эшмахмад в настоящее время работает в дехканско-фермерском хозяйстве под названием «А.Кодири» в должности бухгалтера, также клиент имеет несколько гектаров землию На полученный кредит Эшмахмад планирует пиробрести семена пшеницы, лука и овса для дальнейшего посева. Часть полученного урожая клиент планирует продать чтобы погасить кредит, другая часть кредита будет продана на местном рынке, что даст возможность местным жителям приобрести зерно и лук по более низким ценам, так как продукция на рынок поступит из первых рук, а оставшуюся часть клиент будет использовать для собственных нужд. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: acquire fuel, wheat seeds, oat seeds, onion seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en: Mohamed is a young man who is planning to live an independent life.  He believes in small enterprise as the fastest way to improve his life.  He started his general store by selling in the streets; after his first loan from SMT, he rented a small shop and has increased his stock with the subsequent loans.  He now requests another loan to further expand his business.  Mohamed is very honest and prompt in repaying his loans.

loans.use: To invest in his business now that he is primed and ready for growth.

loans.name: Im

texts.en: Mrs. Im K., 36, grows rice on her small plot of land and earns a $1 a day. Her husband Mr. Sam Kimsan, 38, works as a construction laborer and normally earns about $2.5 a day. They have 6 children, 3 of who are employed by a garment factory. Each month these three children send money to their family to pay for thier younger brothers education. They would like to purchase a plot of land to exapand thier crop and increase  their family income.

loans.use: Use this loan to purchase a plot of land to do farming.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana lives on Tocopilla avenue, in the Pasankeri zone located in the city of La Paz.

She lives with her two children, and her husband works in the interior of the country.

She dedicates herself to clothing sales. She would use her loan to purchase merchandise – sweaters, blouses, jeans, etc., in order to increase her sales.

It is the third loan with IMPRO, and the financial evaluation done indicates that she qualifies for a loan. She has been an IMPRO client since April of 2007, and her previous loans have been repaid in whole and under agreed-upon terms.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Juana vive en la avenida Tocopilla de la zona Pasankeri ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz. Vive junto a su dos hijo de 16 años , su esposo trabaja en el interior del país. Ella se dedica al comercio de ropa, cuyas ventas son en el interior del país. El crédito lo destinara en la compra de mercaderías – chompas, blusas, jeans, etc., y así aumentar sus ventas. Es el tercer crédito con Impro; la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo. Es cliente de IMPRO desde Abril de 2007 y los anteriores dos créditos han sido cancelados en su totalidad y de acuerdo a los planes de pago establecidos.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing for her business.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia S. is a trader who sells used clothing. She is married and has three children. She travels to Accra to buy clothing to sell. The cost of transportation absorbs the majority of her income.

She is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to offset the cost of transportation.

loans.use: Additional capital to to offset the cost of transportation

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora C.´s business is the sale of various products at her own convenience store in the municipality of Cinco Pinos, where she is from originally. Through her efforts and by offering greater quantities of products on her store´s shelves, she has been able to support her three school-age children and has improved their economic condition.

As with any growing business, Teodora´s convenience store needs an investment in products to offer to her customers. For this reason she has been using loans from Ceprodel to acquire those products. Now that she has applied for another loan, she hopes her application will be approved so that she can continue to support her children and improve the standard of living of her household.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

El negocio al que se dedica la señora Teodora C. es a la venta de productos varios teniendo su propia pulpería en el municipio de Cinco Pinos de donde es originaria. Con muchos esfuerzos ha logrado mantener a sus tres hijos en edad escolar, hoy en día ha mejorado sus condiciones económicas ofreciendo mayores cantidades de productos en sus estantes.

Como todo negocio en desarrollo, el negocio de pulpería de la señora Teodora necesita la inversión en productos para ofertarlos a los clientes. Es por esta razón que ella hace uso de los créditos que Ceprodel le brinda para la adquisición de dichos productos. Hoy en día al haber solicitado el crédito espera que le sea aprobada su solicitud para así continuar manteniendo a sus hijos y mejorar cada vez mas las condiciones de su hogar.

loans.use: Purchase products

loans.name: One Way Group

texts.en:
Fatmata is 38 years old and married with three children. With her first loan, Fatmata increased her stock of rice and beans. She was able to diversify her business, realize a profit, and meet some family expenses. Fatmat's husband works as a local building contractor and business is sporadic. This leaves Fatmata's business as the main source of income for the family.

The group would like to continue expanding their businesses and is therefore requesting a loan of Le.2,100,000.

loans.use: Purchase more rice, vegetables, beans and peanuts to increase their inventory and income

loans.name: Mesi

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 39 year-old Mesi S.. She is a widow and has one child, aged 15. In 2002, Mesi established her spears store business. Working seven days a week, and nine to twelve hours a day, she earns about US $50 every month from this business. Mesi has already received, and successfully repaid, two loans from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to buy more goods in bulk. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately US $9. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To buy more goods in bulk.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba O. M. operates a chop bar. Her income as a single parent is not sufficient for Aba and her 2 children. Demand for her food is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.
She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis H. is married and has 5 children. He has received schooling through junior high school. Francis a carpenter, he makes furniture at Abrobiano in Elmina, which he has done since 1996. His wife is a seamstress. Francis uses his income to pay for feeding of the family and the children's school fees. Francis will use the loan to purchase wood and carpentry tools. With the new profits from his expanded business, Francis plans to reinvest for the expansion of his business.

loans.use: Francis will use the loan to purchase wood and carpentry tools.

loans.name: Zahida's Group

texts.en:
Zahida baji is a wife of M. A. and lives in the Bund Road area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has lived in this town for the last 25 years, and is the mother of five children: four sons and one daughter. Her elder son drives an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). The others are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Zahida baji's husband is a mechanic and runs a motor repair shop. He has been in this profession for the last 20 years. Zahida baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She is applying for a loan to buy spare parts for her husband's workshop.

She is joined in her loan group by several other people. Riffat baji wants a loan to buy material (such as colored thread) for her embroidery business. Irshad baji and Sakina baji each want a loan to buy wood for their furniture-making business. Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy scrap (such as plastic bottles and paper) for her scrap business.

This is a group loan. The funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts for motor workshop

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen E. sells clothes and wrappers (sarongs) where her family lives in Benin city, Edo State, Nigeria. She is 50-years-old, married and has four children. Her customers are mostly women and young girls.

Helen is requesting a loan to purchase more wrappers (sarongs) to sell to her customers. She thanks all people that will make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell to customers

loans.name: Paubla Francis

texts.es: Doña Francis tiene 32 años de edad, habita en un barrio que se llama Laureles Sur en la capital de Managua, junto a su esposo y hijos menores de edad de 5 y 12 años de edad, que estudian la primaria en el escuelita del barrio, su esposo labora en como guarda de seguridad gana poco, ella tiene que trabajar para su familia ya que todo esta caro, se desempeña en una casa particular en servicios domésticos desde hace tres años, es un trabajo cansado por que la casa es grande, y lo mas difícil para ella ha sido ganarse la confianza de sus patrones, su mama le ve los niños ya que llega hasta en la noche, con esta solicitud es la séptima la cual ha sido de muchos beneficios ya que ha mejorado su vivienda poco a poco con la facilidad y oportunidad que Afodenic ha brindado, con esta préstamo quiere hacer un sumidero ya que el que tiene esta en mal estado, para esto va a comprar materiales de construcción como piedra, arena, cemento, hierro, para estar higiénico con su familia.
texts.en:
Francis is 32 years old and lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood in the capital of Managua with her husband and children, ages 5 and 12, who attend the local elementary school. Her husband works as a security guard, but earns little money. Francis has to work for her family because everything is expensive. She has worked as a maid for the past three years, but the job is tiring because the house she cleans is very large. The most difficult part has been gaining the trust of her employers. Francis' mother watches over her children for her during the day, as Francis arrives home from work late. This loan will be the seventh, all of which have been very beneficial as she has improved her home little by little with the opportunity Afodenic has offered her. With this loan Francis wants to construct a drain, as her current one is in disrepair. For this, she is going to purchase construction materials such as stones, sand, cement, and iron so that her family maintains good hygiene.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to make a drain.

loans.name: Bafodé

texts.fr: Bafodé K. habite kolda au quartier Doumassou,dans la maison paternelle. Il est marié et pére de trois(03) enfants. Il tient dans cette meme maison une unité de fabrication artisanale de savons locaux à base de produits locaux (huile de palme, péte d'arachide, sel, etc.). La production est vendue à kolda meme et au niveau des marchés hebdomadaires.Il est aidé par sa femme dans la distribution de ses produits. Avec cette activité, il réussit à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et payer la scolarité de ses enfants. Il souhaiterait bénéficier du crédit pour l'extension de son activité.
texts.en:
Bafodé K. lives in his father's house in the Doumassou neighborhood in Kolda. He's married and the father of three children. In the house where he lives, he has set up an artisanal soap production unit. The soap is made out of local products (palm oil, peanut paste, salt, etc). His production is sold directly in Kolda, as well as at the weekly markets. His wife helps him in distributing his products. Thanks to this business, he manages to provide for his family and to pay for his children's tuition. He's seeking this loan to expand his business.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make and sell soap made out of local products

loans.name: Bobosho

texts.ru: Аликулов Бобошо житель города яван. Возраст 39 лет, женат и имеет четверых детей. Уже долгое время заниаеся торговлей крупно рогатого скота. Скупает животных для откормки , а затем продает на том рынке , но по более высокой цене. Таким образом он обеспечивает семью. На данный момент хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы увеличить поголовье скота. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Bobosho A. lives in Yavan town. He is 39 years old and is married with 4 children. He supports his family by selling livestock. He raises calves and sells them at a higher price at the local market. He has been in this business for a long time. Bobosho would like to get a loan for increasing livestock production. He would be able to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase livestock production

loans.name: Alla

texts.en:
Alla is married with three children. She rents a space in a department store and sells gifts and decoration items. She has been in this business for six years and knows the business well. She tries to offer her clients interesting and nice products that can satisfy their demands. Alla enjoys this gift business because "gifts soften people's hearts".

Alla would like to receive a loan of 8,000 grivnas to increase the assortment of her goods. She will spend the additional profit to take care of her children. She believes that God can help her to develop this business even further.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of goods she sells.

loans.name: Elemy

texts.en:
Elemy S. is a 45-year-old mother of six. She lives in San Jose, the capital of Antique Province on the island of Panay, “where the mountains meet the sea.” Her husband is a fisherman, and her children are all in school – one is in elementary school, four are in high school, and one is in college.

Elemy plans to use this loan to buy an engine and repair materials for the family's outrigger canoe, which is used for fishing. She will also buy a piglet. Elemy has been raising pigs for a number of years, which provides her family with additional income.

loans.use: To buy an engine and repair materials for the family's outrigger canoe, and a piglet

loans.name: Nurullo

texts.ru: Клиент Улаев Нурулло 52- ух  летний мужчина, проживающий в районе Абдурахмони Джоми. Женат имеет 7 рых детей имеет средне техническое образования, по специальности механизатор.По специальности работал 33 года, после сокращения должности начил заниматься животноводством.На полученные деньги клиент хочет купить пару молодых телят. Клиент откармливает и продаёт скот, от продажи скота клиент расширит своё хозяйства.
texts.en:
Our client, Nurullo U., is a 52-year-old man who lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi region. He is married and has seven children. He completed a secondary vocational school and is a machine operator by profession. He worked in this specialty for 33 years, but after retirement went into raising livestock. U. wants to purchase a pair of young calves with this loan. He raises and sells cattle, and from the sale of those cattle he expands his farm.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Salome

texts.en: Salome A., 23, is married with 1 child.  She has 4 years of experience selling donuts, pork buns, german buns and pancakes. She sells to the villagers and the general public 6 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (about US $138).  SPBD loans are Salome’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase bakery supplies

loans.name: Rene

texts.es: Rene es un joven muy trabajador, tiene 23 años y vive en un cuarto alquilado y tiene muchas ganas de sobresalir en la vida y forjarse un futuro mejor. Trabaja en una vidriería, es un joven muy cumplido y responsable con sus actividades, él realiza todos los trabajos de cortado de vidrio y a veces cuando el cliente lo solicita lleva los vidrios hasta sus casas y los coloca. Lo más difícil de su trabajo es tener que llevar los vidrios hasta las casa de sus clientes, ya que algunos viven en pisos muy altos y esto le genera trabajo extra y le causa cansancio, aun así sabe que tiene que hacerlo pues es su trabajo, lleva 3 años en esta actividad y lo que más le gusta es cumplir con sus pedidos y no fallarle a sus clientes, espera más adelante poner su propia vidriería, ya que actualmente solo es un trabajador contratado. Este es el primer préstamo de Rene en MFP, está dispuesto a pagarlo a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a su banco comunal, en donde es muy respetuoso con el resto de socias. Rene planea aportar los novecientos nuevos soles al capital de la vidriería, para compra más materiales.
texts.en:
Rene is 23 years old and is a hard worker. He lives in a rented room. He desires to excel in life and build a better future. He works in a glass-shop where he sizes the glass, and if the costumers request it, takes the glass to their homes and installs it. The most difficult part of his work is transporting the glass because many times the costumers live in upper floors. Even though this creates extra and tiresome work, he does it because it is part of his job.

He has been doing this work for three years and what he likes the most is to be punctual with the orders. He hopes to be able to open his own glass shop because he is only a hired worker at this time.

This is Rene’s first loan with MFP and he is committed to paying it on time since he does not want to cause problems to his communal bank where is respected by the other members. Rene plans to add the nine hundred new soles to the capital of the glass shop to purchase additional materials.

Translated from Spanish by Elsa Mejia Connelly, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for the shop

loans.name: Nemat

texts.ru: Немат Узоков проживает в районе Турсунзаде. Возраст 46 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Немат занимается земледелием со своим сыном. Этим видом деятельности занимается более 20 лет. Старший сын тоже работает таксистом. Клиент просит у нас кредит, чтобы закупить зерно пшеницы. А в дальнейшем собрать благоприятный посев для продажи.
texts.en:
Nemat U. live in Tursunzode. He is 46 years old and is married with 4 children. Nemat and his son are agricultural workers. Nemat has been working in agriculture for over 20 years. His elder son works as a taxi driver. Nemat is applying for a loan in order to purchase wheat grain. He would plant it and sell the harvest later.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: wheat grain

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es: Doña Tomasa A. tiene 51 años de edad. tiene 3 hijos pero todos ellos ya son mayores y viven de manera independiente. ella esta casada y vive de manera humilde pero honrada, su esposo ya esta muy mayor por lo que no lo aceptan en ningún trabajo, además el ha tenido muchos problemas de salud por lo que no puede hacer mucha fuerza y son todas estas razones por las que no puede trabajar en plenitud. con todas estas dificultades Doña Tomasa es quien da los ingresos para el hogar, la actividad económica con la que Tomasa ha podido subsistir es con la venta de leña, queso y frijoles cocidos. el negocio lo tiene en su propia vivienda ya que ella esta mayor y le da un poco de miedo algún accidente que le pueda pasar si sale a vender de manera ambulante. Ella comenzó este negocio hace 5 años con un pequeño financiamiento que Fundación León 2000 le otorgo cuando a su esposo lo despidieron del trabajo, desde entonces  no ha dejado caer su negocio, y gracias a Dios el negocio ha crecido, por lo que Tomasa necesita un financiamiento y poder invertir en capital de trabajo pues sus ventas han incrementado y necesita abastecer las necesidades de su clientela.
texts.en:
Doña Tomasa A. is 31 years old. She has 3 children, but they are all already grown up and they live independently. She is married and she lives in a humble but honorable way. Her husband is very old, and so he can’t do any work. Also, he has had many problems with his health. Because of this he is not able to exert much strength, and so there are all these reasons why he is not able to work much. With all these difficulties, Doña Tomasa is the one who earns an income for the household. The economic activity with which has sustained Tomasa is the sale of wool, cheese, and cooked beans. The business that she has in her own home has supported her since she was an adult, as it makes her a little afraid that accident could happen if she was selling outside the home. She began her business 5 years ago with a small loan from Fundación León 2000. It was awarded when her husband stopped working. From that time she has not stopped working at her business, and thanks to God the business has grown. Because of this, Tomasa needs a loan, to invest in working capital as her sales have increased and she needs to meet the needs of her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Las Luciernagas Group

texts.en:
Las Luciernagas is a group of twelve women who have businesses in a variety of industries. Maria bakes bread, Tereza sells clothes, Esneide designs and sells her own clothing, Gerardo rents out tables and living room furniture, Elena sells health supplements, Celina has a DJ service, Marlene cleans, and the rest of the women sell food.

Some of the women have a lot of experience in their businesses, like Esneide, who has been in the clothing business for 33 years. On the other hand, Gerardo, Elena and Maribel have only been in their business for one year each.

Eight of the members have taken out loans in the past and the rest of them are borrowing money for the first time. They are all looking forward to growing their businesses with their micro-loans.

loans.use: To buy products and improve the quality of their products

loans.name: Abdusattor

texts.ru: Абдусаттор Ганиев 1975 года рождения , женат имеет 3 детей. Имеет высшее образование. Но по специальности на работу не смог устроится. Пришлось зарабатывать на жизнь, тем что научили родители.  Он откармливает скот и продает на рынке каждую неделю. Разводит скот более 15 лет. В бизнесе участвуют и родители, так как они и научили его как ухаживать за скотом. На кредит купил 2 коровы и корм.
texts.en:
Abdusattor G. was born in 1975. He is married and has 3 children. He has a higher education. However, he was not able to find a job in his profession. So he had to earn a living with the skills taught by his parents. Abdusattor feeds livestock and sells it at a market every week. He has been raising livestock for over 15 years. His parents also participate in the business because they were the ones who taught him how to care for livestock. He wants to buy 2 cows and feed with this loan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 2 cows and feed

loans.name: Razia Rasheed Group

texts.en:
Razia baji, the wife of R., has lived in Borewala, Pakistan for 20 years. Borewala is famous for its shrines. Her husband sells fruit and has 8 years of experience in this business. He buys the fruit wholesale and sells it to fruit shops. Sometimes he treks to different areas to sell from a cart. Razia baji is a very caring lady. She readily helps him by arranging and packing the fruit. She is applying for a loan to buy fruit to increase the profit of her husband’s fruit business. 

This loan is consists of four additional people. Shahzad baji wants a loan to buy utensils to sell. Najma K. baji wants a loan to buy seasonal vegetables to sell. Naseem baji wants a loan to buy scissors, a mirror and chairs for her barber shop. Suraiya baji wants a loan to buy timber to sell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Razia baji is seated second from the left in this photo.

Note: "Baji," which means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruit to sell

loans.name: Robert's Group

texts.en: K. Robert belongs to Wantoni group in Mukono. He is a single parent with two children of which 1 is in school while the other is not yet in school. Robert has a retail shop in Wantoni that he has been managing for 2 years and also has an office that caters for girls and boys that would like to find employment like maids, shamba boys and casual labourers. In total, he employs 3 people and is happy that at least he contributes to the wellbeing of the other families although he himself is not so much well off. Robert needs a loan to be able to restock his shop with more goods so as to make more products.

loans.use: Restocking his retail shop with more sugar, salt, soap and others so as to make more profits out of the increased stock.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel A. is married and has four children. He has received a senior high school education.  Samuel sells Milo (a milk beverage), milk, coffee, cocoa powder and so on in Aboso near shama junction, which he has done since 2007. His wife is a fishmonger who buys fish from the seashore, then smokes and sells them.  

Samuel uses his income to pay school fees and utility bills. Samuel will use the loan to purchase more groceries to fill his shop. With the new profits from his expanded business, Samuel plans to save to educate his children.

loans.use: Samuel will use the loan to purchase more groceries to fill his shop

loans.name: Joséphine

texts.fr: A. KAÏ Joséphine est âgée de trente six ans et est née à Ouidah  dans le Département de l’Atlantique au Sud du BENIN. Joséphine est mariée. Joséphine est mère de 4 enfants: 3 sont encore à leur charge son mari et elle; deux scolarisés respectivement en classe de sixième et de CE1; le troisième est encore au biberon. Joséphine est une revendeuse de produits de mer au port de pêche de Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. Joséphine a une grande clientèle constituée dans sa majorité des dames qui sont dans la restauration. le premier prêt de Joséphine lui a permis de répondre un tout petit peu aux besoins de sa clientèle. Avec son deuxième prêt, Joséphine a diversifié son activité à la vente de tissus. Joséphine sollicite son troisième prêt pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.
texts.en:
Joséphine A. Kaï is 36 years old and was born in Ouidah in the Atlantique au Sud department of Benin. Joséphine is married. Joséphine is the mother of 4 children: 3 are still in her and her husband's care; two are in school, in sixth and second grade; the third is still a baby. Joséphine is a retailer of seafood products at the fishing port in Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin. Joséphine has a large clientele composed mainly of women who are involved in meal preparation and catering businesses. The first loan Joséphine obtained allowed her to respond a little bit to the needs of her clientele. With her second loan, Joséphine diversified her business by selling fabric. Joséphine is seeking her third loan to strengthen her working capital.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seafood products and bolts of fabric

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge es un joven de 18 años, vive en casa de sus padres, disfrutando de la compañía de los mismos. Su madre le enseñó la importancia del trabajo y es por esta razón que se dedica a cuidar de su propia granja de cuyes. Su rutina diaria de trabajo consiste en cortar la alfalfa de sus pastizales  para alimentar a sus cuyes, posteriormente se va a estudiar. Cada mes o de acuerdo a los pedidos comercializa sus animalitos, preferentemente los machos, por eso trata de mantenerlos con un buen peso y tamaño. Jorge desea para el futuro tener una granja mucho más grande donde pueda albergar a más cuyes e incrementar sus ventas.
Es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete a ser muy responsable, pagando con  puntualidad sus cuotas. El dinero que está solicitando será invertido en la compra de madera y rejillas de metal para ampliar y mejorar su criadero de cuyes.

loans.use: Ampliación de su criadero de cuyes

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly es una mujer trabajadora y dinámica, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali, tiene 69 años, es madre de ocho hijos, todos mayores de edad. Nelly se dedica a la venta de ropa de segundo uso, ella vende su mercadería en varias comunidades cercanas a la ciudad, esta muchos años separada del padre de sus hijos y siempre ha salido adelante. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Valientes” desde hace ocho años, El primer crédito que obtuvo fue de 300 soles que invirtió en la compra de pescado seco para vender en el mercado.
Con este crédito de 1300 soles, piensa invertir en la compra de ropa de segundo uso. La meta de Nelly es llegar a tener una tienda de abarrotes en su casa.
texts.en:
Nelly is a hardworking and dynamic woman. She lives in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali region. She is 69 years old and is mother of eight, all of them of age. Nelly works selling used clothing. She sells her merchandise in several communities close to the city. She has been separated from the father of her children for many years and has always been able to get ahead. She has been part of the communal bank "Mujeres Valientes" (Brave Women) for eight years. Her first loan was for 300 soles which she invested in buying dried fish to sell at the market. With this loan for 1300 soles, she plans to invest in second-hand clothing. Nelly's goal is to own a grocery store in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: This loan will allow her to invest in used clothing

loans.name: Las Creativas Group

texts.es: El grupo “Las Creativas” esta representado por Estenia y conformado por 13 miembros muy trabajadores que ya cumple un tercer ciclo demostrando unidad, responsabilidad, puntualidad y ganas D. seguir creciendo. Muchas D. las socias se dedican a la venta D. productos como cosméticos, abarrotes en tiendas D. barrio, frutas y a los servicios D. costura D. prendas D. vestir, limpieza y a la albañilería.  En cuanto a la competencia las socias no tienen mayor problema gracias a su experiencia y al manejo D. su mercadería. El destino del financiamiento es para la adquisición D. mercadería, insumos y ene especial para herramientas como maquinas D. cocer, surf hiladoras y brocas otras herramientas que ayuden a realizar un trabajo mas rápido y en mayor cantidad que generará mayor ingreso para poder darles a sus familias un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Estenia represents the Las Creativas group, which is comprised of 13 hard-working members. They are completing their third cycle. They demonstrate unity, responsibility, punctuality, and the desire to keep growing. Many of the members sell products like cosmetics, groceries in neighborhood stores, and fruits. Some offer services such as dressmaking, cleaning, and bricklaying. Thanks to their experience and the way they manage their merchandise, the members do not have a big problem with competition. The loan is to get merchandise, supplies, and special tools like sewing machines, spinning machines, and bits. These things will help them do their work more quickly and produce greater quantities, which will generate greater income to be able to give their families a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Delcita

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Fe y Progreso se fundó  en la ciudad de Portoviejo,  este banco es bastante numeroso y las socias son muy organizadas,  la señora Delcita  es una de las fundadoras de su  banco comunal,  vive con su esposo y su hija en la ciudadela la Libertad 2 a las afueras de Portoviejo.

Delcita divide su tiempo entre  los quehaceres del hogar y  su negocio una  tienda donde expende  agua, víveres, carnes, pescado, artículos de limpieza  y uso personal,  lleva 12 años en esta labor y  le ayudan su esposo y la hija ya que  su horario de atención es de 7 de la mañana a 8 de la noche. Para abastecerse de los productos Delcita  compra a los mayoristas en el mercado o los distribuidores la vistan en la tienda y  abastecen de todo lo necesario, nos comenta que invierte  un aproximado de 40 a 60 dólares  por semana para surtir de lo necesario a su tienda y si obtiene  buenas ganancias.

Gracias a la gran ayuda de la Fundación Espoir ella ha podido continuar con su tienda, con este préstamo  que recibirá va a comprar  más productos como arroz y azúcar  por quintales y todos los productos de primera necesidad para darles mejor atención a sus clientes.

La meta de nuestra socia es comprar un congelador  para ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The Fe y Progreso Communal Bank was founded in the city of Portoviejo. This bank has quite a few members, and they are very organized. Delcita is one of the founders of her communal bank. She lives with her husband and daughter in the La Libertad 2 housing community on the outskirts of Portoviejo. Delcita divides her time between the household chores and her business. She has a store where she sells water, supplies, meat, fish, cleaning supplies, and personal use items. She has been doing this for 12 years. Her husband and her daughter help because her work schedule is from seven in the morning until eight at night. To stock the products, Delcita buys wholesale in the market or from distributors who visit her store. They supply everything she needs. She says that she invests about 40 to 60 dollars a week to stock the store with the necessary items and get good earnings. Thanks to the great help from the Espoir Foundation, she has been able to continue with her store. She will use this loan to buy more products like rice and sugar by “quintales” (100 pounds). She will also buy all of the basic needs items to give better service to her customers. Her goal is to buy a freezer to offer better service to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice and sugar by the "quintal" (100 pounds)

loans.name: Catherine Waithira

texts.en:
Catherine Waithira K. runs a general store called Amazing Grace where she sells goods like flour, snacks, tea leaves and cooking oil, to residents of Kiganjo. Her business challenges are lack of proper storage for perishable goods like milk, and the price deflation of goods when selling to customers. 

She will be using her loan of KES 20,000 to restock her goods. In the future, she wants to be a wholesaler.

Catherine is married and has three children ranging from age of seven years to sixteen. She describes herself as aggresive, hard-working and jovial, and she hopes to educate all her children.

loans.use: To buy 3 sacks of flour, 1 bucket of cooking fat, 1 sack of sugar and 2 sacks of rice.

loans.name: Buen Corazon Group

texts.es:
Después de haberse capacitado  durante tres días las integrantes del grupo Buen Corazón, están preparando su solicitud para acceder al préstamo, liderizadas por su mesa directiva tienen como presidenta a Graciela C., Tesorera es Virginia Q. y Secretaria de Actas es Vibiana Q.,  todas elaboran su reglamento interno de la Asociación quienes se reunirán cada dos semanas en el Centro Focal Exaltación
Todas las integrantes tienen sus propios es el caso de Domitila T. de 61 años que vende condimentos hace 15 años en Villa Dolores, sus compañeras tambien tienen negocios como el tejido de chompas, venta de ropa, venta de jugo de quinua y comida. Necesitan el préstamo para comprar mercadería en el caso de negocios de comercialización, compra de materia prima para las que se dedican a la producción.
texts.en:
After having trained for three days, the Buen Corazón "Good Heart" team members are preparing their request to be granted the loan. Led by their board, they have Graciela C. as president, Virginia Q. as Treasury, and Vibiana Q. as Secretary of Minutes. All members draw up their bylaws of the Association that meets every two weeks at the Exaltation Regional Office. All members have their own business as is the case of Domitila T., 61 years old, who has sold condiments for 15 years in Villa Dolores. Her partners also have businesses like knitting sweaters, selling clothes, selling juice, quinoa, and food. They need the loan to buy merchandise at the commercial business event and to buy raw material for those that work in production.

Translated from Spanish by Elycia Mulholland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw material and merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To rent land for growing cotton

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en: Hadjah is 42 years old and married with six children aged between 10 and 23 years. All her children go to school. She rents a four-room house where she stays with eight people. Hadjah takes care of additional family members. The family has no access to electricity or piped water and gets two meals a day. She incurs transport costs to and from buying baking flour and cooking oil. Hadjah fries samosas and chapatti in Kawempe. She works in a semi-urban area, which is on the outskirts of Kampala.  She works seven days a week. She receives an average of 30 customers a day and sells to all categories of people at wholesale and retail.  Her greatest monthly expenses include feeding the family, school fees for her children and rent for her residence. Her major business challenges are transporting the baking flour, cooking oil and cowpeas to her business premises; seasonality, which makes her business difficult; and the rainy season, which disturbs her a lot because she works in an open area. Hadjah has been in this business for 10 years and with MCDT for five years. This is her 10th loan working with the same group mates. Hadjah joined MCDT because it was near her home and was working with poor women in the village. She wants to use this loan to buy more cartons of baking flour, jerry cans of cooking oil and a sack of cowpeas. She hopes to see her business grower bigger and to start employing three people.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio es un hombre bastante entusiasta y luchador de 27 años, es soltero, vive en una habitación alquilada en la selva central del Perú porque cree que es una zona donde hay más oportunidades laborales.

Sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar duro para alcanzar sus metas, por eso decidió estudiar lo que más le gusta, música, pues se dedica a tocar instrumentos como el arpa y el piano. Los contratos que más acepta son de arpista, pues tiene mayor demanda y es más rentable dentro del mercado del folklore. 
Paralelamente, en sus tiempos libres, trabaja transportando personas en su moto carro y gracias a las ganancias que obtiene con ambas actividades puede enviarles algo de dinero a su familia que se encuentran en su tierra natal; a su vez, también puede cubrir sus gastos personales y está ahorrando para comprar más instrumentos musicales porque en el futuro desea tener su propia orquesta; asimismo planea tener un negocio de venta de artefactos domésticos. 

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y manifiesta que pagará puntualmente cada cuota para no hacer quedar mal a su banco comunal, que está integrando por personas trabajadoras, unidas y reconocidas por su responsabilidad. Con el dinero que ahora solicita, planea implementar un negocio de compra y venta de instrumentos musicales de segundo uso, aprovechando que conoce a muchos músicos que necesitan de diferentes instrumentos.
texts.en:
Antonio is an enthusiastic and feisty 27-year-old man. He is single and lives in a rented room in Peru's central jungle because he believes it is an area with more opportunities for work. His parents raised him to work hard to reach his goals, so he decided to study what he loved most: music. He learned to play instruments such as the harp and piano. He is most often hired as a harpist, because there is higher demand and it is more profitable within the folklore market. On the side, he transports people on his motorcycle. With the earnings from both activities, he is able to send some money home to his family. He is able to cover his personal expenses and is saving to buy more musical instruments because in the future he wants to have his own orchestra. On top of that, he want to sell home appliances. This is his second loan with MFP and he has demonstrated that he will make each payment on time to remain on good terms with his communal bank, which is composed of hard-working people brought together by their responsibility. With the money he is requesting now, he plans to start a business buying and selling secondhand musical instruments, taking advantage of the fact that he knows many musicians who need different instruments.

Translated from Spanish by Amanda McDermott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to invest in a new business

loans.name: Natividad Julia

texts.es:
La señora Natividad Julia L. A. tiene 55 años de edad es soltero tiene cinco hijos solo una vive con ella habita en el barrio la florida, es comerciante desde hace mas de 20 años hecha tortillas para vender todos los días de la semana en su casa de habitación.

La señora Natividad A. tiene tres años y medios de trabajar con crédito se le han otorgado 26 créditos cancelados cada dos meses, la señora A. ha demostrado ser una persona con mucha responsabilidad y trabajadora todos los créditos otorgados le han ayudado a mantener estable su negocio.
texts.en:
Señora Natividad Julia L. A. is 55 years old. She is single and has 5 children, only one of whom lives with her. She lives in the suburb of Florida, and has been a business woman for more than 20 years, making tortillas at home that she sells every day. Natividad has been working with loans for 3.5 years. She has been granted 26 loans, which she's paid off every 2 months. Señora A. has demonstrated to be a very responsible and hard working person. All the loans granted to her have helped her to keep her business stable.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tortilla sales

loans.name: Saddan's Group

texts.en:
Saddan is 55-years old. She is a loving mother and hard-working. She lives with her 70-year old husband A. D. and their three children in a city named Pakpattan in Pakistan. She dreams of improving their quality of life.

Her son has been engaged in a food selling business for over twelve years. His food stand is the busiest in the market. He has a good customer’s base. Everyday his customers make plans to enjoy the delicious food from his food stand.

M. Sharif says that his progress belongs to his mother Sadaan because she guided him how to cook food. They both offer varieties to their food stand and attract more customers. 

She is asking for a loan of worth Pak Rs. 15,000 with which she will buy the required items (lentils, cooking oil, rice etc) to enhance the food selling business of her son.

She has three other ladies in her loan group. Nagina wants a loan to buy vegetables for her vegetable selling business. Kosar baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her fruits selling business. Saima baji wants a loan to buy fertilizer to sell.

loans.use: To buy material for food selling business

loans.name: Rasoolan's Group

texts.en:
Rasoolan is a citizen of a city in Pakistan named Arifwala. She lives with her family in a three-room house. She has given birth to two sons and both are not of school going age yet. She stays at home and takes care of the family and does domestic chores. 
Her husband’s name is M. S.. He operates a clothes-selling business. He travels to different cities, such as Lahore & Faisalabad, for purchasing. He selected these cities because of their new designs and great quality clothes and most importantly, they are cheap in rates too. He sells his clothes to the clothing markets and earns a good profit. 
Rasoolan is requesting a loan to buy seasonal clothes to expand her husband’s clothes selling business.

loans.use: To buy clothes for clothes selling business.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward ole N. is 24 years old. He is married to Esther N. and the father of two children, aged 6 months and 3 years.

Edward has been farming for the last five years. His farm is in a productive area. Most of his customers are wholesalers from the city who come to buy his produce and then sell it to city residents.

Edward learned about KADET through an awareness program run by KADET staff in his area. This will be his second loan, which he plans to use as follows: 30,000 KES for wheat farming and 20,000 KES to buy sheep for fattening to sell later at a profit. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming to meet the demand for his wheat.

Edward's future dream is to become a large scale farmer and attain financial independence.  Edward is a young and energetic man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: To plant more acres of wheat and buy sheep for fattening and resale

loans.name: Elberta

texts.es:
Elberta es socia del Banco Comunal Triunfo.
Elberta es casada, tiene 54 años y 8 hijos, Elberta tiene un puesto en el mercado central de la ciudad de Ayacucho en donde vende comida, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su hija.
Elberta necesita un préstamo de 2600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leña, arroz, aceite y gas.
Los sueños de Elberta son que sus hijos sean profesionales, implementar una polleria para que trabajen sus hijos.
texts.en:
Elberta, 54, is a member of the Triunfo (Triumph) communal bank. She is married and has 8 children. She has a stall in Ayacucho’s central market where she sells prepared food; she’s open for business every day, her daughter helps her. Elberta needs a 2600 sol loan to invest in the purchase of firewood, rice, cooking oil and gas. Elberta’s dreams are that her children become professionals and to set up a poultry shop that her children can run.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood, rice, cooking oil and gas.

loans.name: David

texts.pt:
David Z. was born in the Chibabava district in the Sofala province in Mozambique, close to the Zambeze river. He studied till 7th grade of the colonial system and had to stop because of lack of financial means. He is single and has four children. The youngest is 4 and the eldest is 26, a girl, who is in the picture with David's contruction. We are showing a picture of his eldest daughter, who will also benefit from the loan because he was not available when we visited the property to take the picture.
